But being in any kind of relationship with Lanie is going to be a challenge, but thankfully Hop loves a challenge.Secrets, doubts, fear and outside influences are things that this couple has to overcome in order to have that Happily Ever After but, can they? Can they survive the constant push of Hop trying to break down her walls and the pull of Lanie trying to avoid her feeling for fear of loss?Kristen Ashley is undoubtedly the queen of the lost and broken. She again gives us a story that makes you question if you had the same determination and strength to deal with the pain and loss that these characters have had to endure. She makes you put yourself in the Lanie and Hop's shoes and wonder  "would I make similar choices?"This book is more than your typical MC book, it is a story of finding that inner strength and willingness to step outside of the safe and venture into the unknown to find true happiness. Discovering and learning about yourself, the truths that you did not know existed. This story will make you laugh, cry and will most likely make want to check you book/ereader across the room at times.As with most Kristen Ashley book you can expect a familiar face or two.

I am completely enamored with Jackson Steele, The man is sex on a stick and he is tall dark and dangerous. This story answers so many questions like Sylvia's relationship with her father, Jackson's link to Megan and Ronnie and so much more. But like any great book it leaves you wanting more.J. Kenner spins a story of secrets and demons into a story of love enduring. I love that even though Sylvia is damaged she can see the error of her ways when she is being unreasonable about something, Jackson too, can admit he is wrong when it is necessary and these two come together and act like adults and work together to figure it out. The growth as couple is amazing and I am eating it up. Then ending had me practically screaming at the author because I cannot believe the curve ball that was thrown and now has set up the mystery for the next book.Bravo to J. Kenner for incorporating not only Jackson and Sylvia into the Stark world but keeping our favorite couple involved in a completely natural way.I just might die from anticipation because the next book is not slatted to release until September but I will endure

*I was gifted a copy of this book for an honest review.Be careful what you wish for. Ace White wanted to be a star and now he is. But being the lead singer in a put together band isn't exactly what he wanted. He has no control over his song choices, no real friends, and even his band doesn't like him. This isn't because he's arrogant or on drugs - it's because doesn't play up to everyone's fake lifestyle. When he disappears and changes his appearance, he feels free.It's hard to believe that someone would want to give up a life of luxury to live in a trailer park, which is why it is the perfect place for him to hide. And then he meets Iris. I loved seeing this couple together. After being around so many people who used him, he was unprepared for someone who just wanted to be nice to someone.I enjoyed this new read from Michelle Valentine. This was not the typical rough rock band story that I'm used to reading from her. In some ways it was almost too sweet, which is not a bad thing. The one thing that I would like to see with the next installment in this series, is more interaction on the band dynamics and how this relationship will affect the other members - will it bring them together or bring out the reasons they all don't get along.  I'm giving Michelle Valentine's Wicked White - 4.5 stars!

This book picks up after Motorcycle Man of the Dream Man series, you do not have to read Motorcycle man but it is highly recommended...We met Tabby and Shy in the Motorcycle Man when Tabby was just 16 years old and a very troubled young girl. Shy was kinda in the background but he was present. Fast forward a few years...Parker "Shy" Cage is a man-whore biker that is loyal to the Chaos MC. He takes their motto of Living Free to new heights.  He loves his blood brother and his MC brothers. He respects his MC president and would never do anything to betray that trust until he falls for his only daughter Tabby.Tabitha "Tabby" Allen is the only daughter of the Chaos MC President Tack Allen. She was wild in her youth but now is a nurse that is healing from a personal tragedy. Making amends with Shy after years of estrangement from him because of an incident when she was just 19, Shy and Tabby become great friends. Tabby denies that she can have feelings for Shy because she is not in the head space for such a thing. Until she realizes that Shy is not waiting in the wings for her. When confronted with him and his girlfriend she freaks and decides to skip town. Needless to say when Shy finds out she is leaving he FREAKS out! They have a heart to heart and decide they want to be together. But will the Chaos MC accept this relationship, especially with Tabby's not so distant loss  and Shy's reputation? Can Tack take the news like a father and the President of the Chaos in stride? These are just some of the huddles these two will have to endure to be together.The story of Tabby and Shy was good, really good. I was engaged from the prologue. I was unsure that I was going to really care about yet another MC book but KA totally had me wanting more. You really end up caring about Shy and his own demons on top of poor Tabby and the crap she had to put up with from her crazy mom. There is action in the secondary plot that includes KA's other resident hot guys, such as Lee Nightingale, Hawk, Lawson and Brock! So that in itself is a win-win!Highly recommend this read to those that enjoyed the Dream Man series especially Motorcycle Man.

I'm very impressed with the amount of light this little desk lamp provides.  It's a very minimalist design so it fits into most any décor and takes up so little space.  The adjustable 'neck' of the lamp lets you move the light closer or further away or turn it facing up down or sideways.  The added slot for a phone and a usb charging port make it the perfect desk accessory.  This would be the perfect desk lamp for a college student or anyone with limited desk space.  For its size, it produces as much light as you could want. Another feature that I like is that it's sturdy.  It's not one of those cheap lightweight lamps that you can knock over with just a touch.  The base is heavy and sturdy.  I really can't say enough good things about this product.  It has a permanent place on my home desk and I use it every day.  My phone sits and charges as I work.  I haven't had a single complaint about anything since I first plugged it in.

For fans of cherries, this is a delicious snack bar.  It has basic simple ingredients and is compatible with the Zone Diet if you're into that.  I love the flavor and the crunch.  It's chock full of cherries and almonds and has tiny bits of dark chocolate as well.  It really satisfies me when I'm having a craving for something sweet.  They're only 180 calories but do pack 8 grams of fat mostly from the almonds.  It also has 10 grams of protein and 2 grams of fiber.  Overall much better for you than a candy bar.  They're great to throw in your purse or pack to have on hand when you need a snack.  My daughter likes to take them in her lunch bag and my husband packed a few for his hiking trip.  If you're not a fan of cherries, then skip this one because it is intensely cherry flavored.  I really like them and will probably try other varieties of this brand.

This is my second set of Bird's Eye View window film and I love both of them.  I put these on some small windows near my front door.  They fit perfectly and look really nice.  Not only do they keep the pesky bluebird from knocking his head on the window, they also provide a bit more privacy.  They couldn't be simpler to install.  You just clean your window, then spray it with water and place the sticker where you want it.  I used a credit card to press out the air bubbles and a few minutes later the window is dry and the sticker is set.  Since installing these on my back door and front window, the bluebird has been staying away and I feel like I've had pretty etched glass installed.  This is a wonderful and useful product whether you use it to keep the birds away, to add some privacy, or to pretty up your windows.  I highly recommend it.

Ubersleep works well for me.  Taking melatonin usually gives me crazy dreams but for whatever reason this blended formula gets me to sleep without any nightmares and I sleep for at least 4-5 hours which is pretty good for me.  The capsules are a little large and they do have the distinct Valerian smell that is a little unpleasant but as long as they work I don't care.  I take it about an hour before I will be going to bed and I start feeling drowsy within 30-45 minutes.  As a long time insomniac, it's nice to find products that work without any strange side effects and Ubersleep does just that for me.  It's a great alternative to prescription products.  I would definitely recommend it.

These work as well as a prescription pair of multifocus glasses that I bought for over $300.  I am truly impressed.  I sit at a computer all day and need different strength lenses to move between the monitor and anything printed.  These glasses fit the bill perfectly.  I went to an optometrist a few years ago and spent way too much on a pair of glasses and they don't work nearly as well as these do.  They're stylish and comfortable too.  If you're at that age when your arm is not quite long enough anymore, I'd suggest trying Foster Grants.

This year for the first time we had problems with a bluebird who refused to give up bashing himself against our French door.  We tried all kinds of things to scare him away.  My daughter even resorted to soaping the window but nothing deterred him.  After installing these eye catching little window films, the bird hasn't been back.  And, I have to say that I really like the way that they look on the door.  It's really pretty especially when the sun hits it just right.  They would also work great on large plate glass windows or doors not only for the birds but for humans as well.  For such a small thing, they really made a big difference.

I was very impressed with this novel by Julia Heaberlin.  The story is unique and well told.  The suspense builds slowly as Tess relates the story of her life.  As a teenager, she was a track star and her life seemed full of promise.  That all changed when she woke up in the middle of a field surrounded by dead bodies and bones.  As a grown woman, she has to confront some choices she made after surviving the threat on her life as well as try to discover whether the murderer has been leaving clues for her find. Fans of Laura Lippman will enjoy this one.  There is forensic detail and legal drama, everything you want in a good suspense thriller.  It's a great read for the beach or by the pool.  I am definitely recommending this one to friends.

Okay, I'm not a techie so I don't know all the right terms to use but I will say that we have really enjoyed watching movies more since installing this PowerDVD 15.  We didn't have a blue ray player before and it makes such a difference in the quality of the picture.  It's nice to be able to have all our movie files in one place and I love the cloud storage.  I watched a favorite DVD on my phone while we were on vacation.  The software just does everything you want in processing, viewing and sharing video or audio files and does it seamlessly.  The quality is always superb.  The installation was easy.  Unless you're a professional filmmaker, I can't imagine that you'd need more than this software provides.

Living in the South means you are intimately acquainted with fire ants.  Our house happens to have been built over what was once pasture land and the whole yard is riddled with fire ant mounds as soon as the weather starts to warm up.  This Ortho treatment works quickly and easily.  If you follow the instructions, the ants are gone within a day or two.  Since it's a localized treatment, we don't have to worry about our animals getting into it by mistake.  Ortho is the brand to trust for pest control and this Fire Ant Killer is the best we've tried.

Finders Keepers is even better than Mr. Mercedes.  The whole story is a continuation of Mr. Mercedes but it is also a ripping good yarn that stands alone.  The novel begins as a reclusive elderly author faces down three masked thugs in a home invasion. After all his unpublished work and squirreled away money are stolen, the story follows two timelines.  Morris Bellamy, the thief, tells the immediate aftermath of the robbery and what becomes of the loot.  In a future timeline, a teenage boy, Pete Saubers, stumbles across the loot at a time when his family is desperate for money. His father is injured as a result of the Mercedes Killer's spree and unable to work.  What becomes of each of these people and the stolen money and manuscripts is what comprises the rest of the novel.  It is at this point that the characters from Mr. Mercedes show up.  Hodges, the retired detective, and Brady, the psychopath, make appearances along with Holly and Jerome.  The thrilling conclusion pits Morris against Pete with Hodges et al racing to intervene before it's too late.  The cliffhanger ending is one that left me in open mouthed astonishment.  I can't wait to see what happens next.

My beagle is obsessed with her new toy.  As soon as we received it in the mail, she began sniffing the package and it's been by her side ever since.  She keeps it in her doggie bed.  She loves to chase the ball and then make it squeak by chewing on it.  It's adorable to watch.  The bright colors make it easy for us humans to find.  This ball is about the size of a tennis ball so it won't work for small dogs although my Chihuahua likes to chase after it with her sister, the beagle.  We have already spent some fun hours out in our yard playing fetch and I'm sure will continue to enjoy our new toy for a long while.  Chuckit has designed a pretty much perfect dog toy.

I've never been much of an eyelash curling girl.  I mostly just go with a touch of mascara but as I've gotten older, the eyelashes seem to be disappearing.  I have been using this item and have been impressed with how much more volume and length my lashes seem to have when I use it first before applying mascara.  The little gel pad on the curler makes it very comfortable, no pulling or pinching while using it.  Even a very uncoordinated and terribly nearsighted person like me can use it easily.  My daughter has taken to using this one over the one that she has because she says it works better.  The Georgie Beauty Lash Curler is working well for us Georgia Beauties.

I always end up throwing away at least a portion of the produce that I buy because it spoils before we can finish it so I was excited to try this GreenSaver produce keeper.  It works amazingly well.  It's the perfect size for berries so I put a basket of strawberries in it after reading the directions.  Different types of produce require you to adjust the lid to accommodate individual differences.  I put the basket of strawberries into the container and deliberately left half of them for a full week just to see what would happen.  Usually they would be at least half mushy and spoiled.  Upon opening the GreenSaver, I was amazed to find that they were all still fresh.  The taste was perfect.  I was sold.  This little gem has been in continuous use ever since.  I am also buying other sizes for all my produce.  They are perfect for stacking in the refrigerator and honestly will pay for themselves in a short period of time from the money you don't throw away in spoiled produce.  I am recommending this one to friends and family.

I hate applying sunscreen.  It's messy and time consuming and you end up feeling a bit like a greased pig by the time you're done.  Last year, we opted for the spray on sunscreen which is easy to apply but still leaves you feeling sticky and then washes off much too quickly.  So, I certainly was skeptical that this product could do all that it claims.  I have to admit that I was wrong.  It actually does go on very quickly and absorbs easily.  A little goes a long way.  It doesn't make your skin feel icky or look shiny or white coated.  It doesn't particularly feel cool but I guess if you are out in the sun it might be different.  We were outside all day at a charity fun run and didn't get burned at all.  Also, an added bonus for me, there's no bothersome fragrance to have to contend with.  Quite simply, it does what it claims.  Isn't that enough of an endorsement these days?

This one had me right up until the very end and then it sort of swerved off course a bit.  Robert McCammon, the author of Swan Song, does not disappoint with his storytelling abilities.  You are grabbed on page one by the plight of a boy caught in the middle of a battle between two alien races.  He can't remember who he is or what has happened to him.  Through his eyes you learn about the power that the technologically superior aliens have.  The boy eventually joins with another group of human survivors and in their struggles he begins to understand that he is much more than ordinary.  He may be the answer that humanity has been searching for to finally win back the earth.  If you enjoy books like War of the Worlds or The Stand, you should enjoy this latest addition to the post apocalyptic genre.  My only issue with the book was that for all the momentum it had through 75% of the story, it sort of loses speed near the end.  Some of the solutions that are presented just seem a bit too cliché, like a B movie ending.  Overall, the book was quite good and I'd recommend it for fans of the genre or for fans of Mr. McCammon.  If you enjoyed Swan Song, this one will be right up your alley.

I love these sandals.  They have the same general look as Birkenstocks but are much more comfortable.  I've worn them almost daily since I received them.  The straps do run a tad wide.  I had to use them in the last hole of the strap to get them to fit.  For anyone with feet that are even a smidge narrow, they would probably be too large.  I own quite a few pair of Fit Flops and they last forever so you definitely get your money's worth.

Fit Flops are my favorite brand of shoes.  I must own 10 pair in different styles and colors.  They are so comfortable and with the styles like this bedazzled look I can wear them to work or out to dinner with a skirt.  They last forever.  I have two pair that I've owned and worn regularly for honestly like 5 years.  So even though they're a bit more expensive you definitely get your money's worth.  For anyone who needs a comfortable shoe that has some style, I would highly recommend Fit Flops.

What the police in 3 states couldn't do in 30 years, this filmmaker did during the filming of a documentary.  Completely amazing piece of film at the end.  Durst is a singularly fascinating character who because of his wealth and connections managed to escape justice time and again.  Don't miss this affecting and absorbing look at the life and crimes of Robert Durst.

I'm a fan of post apocalyptic fiction and I was also a fan of Mr. Percy's last book so this seemed like a perfect novel for me.  The premise is interesting, a retelling of the Lewis and Clark story but set in the distant future where plagues and radiation have ravaged the planet.  People live in a walled city that was once St. Louis.  Life is harsh.  One day a woman arrives to tell them of a western paradise where life is thriving but she also warns of danger on the horizon.  The novel has its interesting moments.  It also has stretches that were just a bit too monotonous and predictable.  It took me a while to get through the book which isn't really long but I would get to one of the less interesting parts and just set it aside for awhile.  I do enjoy the way that this author introduces a historical event with a completely different perspective.  He did something similar in 'Red Moon' and it worked well.  In 'Dead Lands', it wasn't quite as successful.  Still, if you're a fan of post apocalyptic fiction, it's worth a read.

I started drinking the Spark energy drinks in the fruit punch flavor a few weeks ago after being introduced to them by a friend.  They work better than coffee at really revving me up for a full day.  I ordered the pink lemonade just to have a variety to choose from but this flavor leaves a lot to be desired.  There is a definite vitaminy smell and taste that doesn't go away no matter how much you shake.  I managed to finish one packet but I don't know what to do with the rest.  I think I'll stick with the fruit punch flavor in the future.

I am truly in love with this moisturizer.  I have recently noticed the telltale signs of aging on my face, a few tiny crinkles near my eyes, some dark spots, some dryness.  I've never been into using a lot of products on my face.  I usually wash, apply a light moisturizer, maybe some powder and mascara if I'm going to work, etc.  I knew that I needed to start putting more attention into taking care of my skin, especially because of my age.  I just hate the way most of the creams for 'mature skin' feel.  They're usually greasy and heavy.  I end up feeling it on my skin all day or all night and I hate it.  Olay Featherweight Moisturizer is completely different.  It goes on like silk and absorbs quickly and it doesn't feel like anything.  I've seen an improvement in the dryness and texture of my skin.  It looks brighter.  I'm impressed.  I also love that the moisturizer contains sunscreen.  I neglect using that too often and it's nice not to have to think about it.  I will be using this product and recommending it highly to everyone I know.

I stumbled across this series on a video streaming service that I subscribe to.  I was sick with the flu and just trying to pass the time while I felt miserable.  After the first episode, I was completely hooked and ended up watching series 1 and series 2 over the next couple of days.  The whole show is just completely amazing.  Gillian Anderson especially gives a stand out performance as Stella Gibson, the lead detective on the case of a series of strangulation murders in Belfast.  There is an interweaving of plots featuring a number of the characters but it all eventually ties back in to the one being handled by DCIS Gibson.  To see the portrayal of a woman as strong, intelligent, independent and sexy all at the same time is quite rare but Ms. Anderson pulls it off easily.  At one point one of the other detectives asks her, "Do you realize the effect that you have on men?"  She is unapologetically in charge of the investigation and has no problem with putting anyone, even her superiors, in their place when the need arises.  Jamie Dornan (of Fifty Shades of Grey) plays the serial killer and he is completely believable as the loving father/husband who secretly stalks and then murders women before returning home to bathe his kids and put them to bed.  He is both a man and a monster.  Every single character on the show is done with such authenticity and attention to detail that you get completely lost in the story.  Series 2 has a cliffhanger ending so I'm hoping that means a season 3 will be forthcoming.  Fingers crossed.  Honestly, though, if you enjoy shows like Criminal Minds, True Detective or Law and Order, this is a must see.  This is not a show for the kids, however, as it features sexual violence, nudity, and profanity.

Having profound slow internet connection has always been an issue for us at my home.  If one person is streaming a movie on Netflix, the whole system is usually tied up.  After switching to this Belkin router, we get much fast download speed and connection rates from almost any location in our home.  My daughter and I can both watch Netflix now without having the issue of constant buffering.  My husband was skeptical of the router because of his past experience with some Belkin products but this one has definitely impressed him.  We only use this for typical home computing jobs like watching movies, printer connection, etc. and it works great.  I would definitely recommend it.

This is not the kind of book I would typically pick up to read but the description sounded so interesting.  A young boy is born and immediately ostracized by his mother due to the lightness of his skin.  He grows up terribly neglected and only after he's older and escapes does he get adopted by a caring father in America.  The novel is inventive certainly but almost too far out at least for me.  They boy's inner life and dreams are told in an almost psychedelic trippy style that just didn't work for me.  As the book progressed, I sort of got lost.  The plot gets a little convoluted and at some points almost contrived.  I can see that other people disagree with my thoughts due to the high ratings the book has already gotten and I'm sure this is just a matter of personal preference.  If you're into very fantastical stories, this might resonate more profoundly for you than it did for me.  I like to read books that are much more matter of fact or even reality based.

Our vet recommended we try Natural Balance limited ingredient for our dog that was experiencing a recurrent skin rash.  It's kind of pricey in the vet's office so it was nice to find it on Amazon.  Our dog immediately loved it.  She was sniffing around the bag before I even opened it.  The dry food is disc shaped about the size of a dime.  She's a beagle/terrier mix so on the small side and it wasn't difficult for her to chew. She's done beautifully on the food and is no longer experiencing a problem with her skin.  I researched the brand just a bit and find that overall it's a good choice for dry dog food.  Depending on the type of Natural Balance you buy it can contain chicken byproducts which isn't great but better than the grocery store brands that are almost all corn.  If you can afford a little bit pricier food or if you pet has special dietary needs, Natural Balance is a good alternative.

An interesting back story with multiple challenging hidden object scenes.  It is a game that will offer you easy outs if you want to spend real money to buy them.  If you can be patient you can make it through as a free player.
This is one of those games that can pick your pocket if you aren't careful but it's pretty basic an d fun if you have patience

We had been suffering with a wireless router of a different type for years.  The signal was always weak and we had to restart it at least a few times each week even when there was no power outage.  Our devices would just lose the signal.  Since we installed this TP-Link router, our WiFi reception has been so much better throughout all areas of our house.  We haven't had to restart it even once since it was installed.  Setting it up was very easy even for a non tech savvy person like myself.  I just followed the instructions and it was done within 15 minutes or so, easy breezy.  I can't speak about any of the technical details related to how this item works and honestly it doesn't really matter to me.  All I care about is that it does what it's supposed to do without causing me a lot of grief.  This item does that exactly.  I have recommended it to a couple of family members and coworkers who have similar issues with their home WiFi.  Another nice thing about this model is the price.  It's one of the least expensive wireless routers and it works well.  That's always a winning combination.  If you are a typical home computer user like myself who uses Wifi to access email, social media and Netflix, this will fit the bill for your needs.  For more sophisticated or advanced users, I'm sure you already know what type of router you need.

I've had a tiny little zester/grater for years and always wanted a larger one.  This is perfect for my needs.  It works great for any type of citrus fruits.  I also used it for nutmeg during the holidays.  It gives you the perfect tiny shred that you want when cooking.  I was a bit skeptical about the plastic handle but it seems quite sturdy.  I hope it holds up well over time.  My favorite part is the fact that it comes with a plastic cover so that I can store it in my catch all kitchen drawer without having to worry about scraping my knuckles when I go scrounging for other utensils.  If you are someone who enjoys cooking, this is a nice addition to your selection of kitchen utensils.  Citrus zest brightens up so many dishes and with this item it's a cinch to grab a lemon and add that freshness to whatever is on the stove.  I would recommend this item without hesitation.

Just very strange and rather disturbing.  I was expecting more of a scary movie parody I guess and it is not that.  Justin Long must have lost his voice from all the guttural screaming he had to do.  He did in the first part of the movie manage to make Wallace one of the most thoroughly unlikable characters ever. Haley Joel Osment and the actress who played the girlfriend were not so great in their roles but Johnny Depp who plays the detective really almost single handedly saves the movie from total Dreckdom.  This is one of those you will either love or hate.  If you enjoyed Centipede this one is right up your alley.

I just got an Xbox One console for Christmas.  It came with Watch Dogs game which was a major disappointment.  I traded it in and got Dead Rising 3 which absolutely blew me away.  I played Dead Rising and Dead Rising 2 on Xbox 360 and they were okay games.  This one is so much better.  It's not just the graphics although they are like 100% improved. I really enjoy getting into the Story or Campaign mode of games and playing through all the challenges.  I'm not really into co-op gaming much at all.  DR3 has a very good story with lots of little side missions to keep things interesting along the way.  The game gets progressively harder the longer you play.  By the last campaign, it's wall to wall zombies almost everywhere but by that time you have a lot of cool weapon combos that help even the odds along with a variety of vehicles and combo vehicles that are completely cool.  I really love this game and would recommend it with one caveat.  Their is language and some sexual references that definitely are not appropriate for younger players.  Of course, there is also tons of blood and violence so it really should be off the table for anyone under 13 at least.

Like most people, I have dry skin in the winter.  My usual recourse is to use a moisturizing lotion after showering.  It takes a couple of extra minutes but it's worth it.  The idea of being able to get this all done while still in the shower sounded like a win-win.  It didn't quite work out that way.  The lotion itself is rather thin and watery.  It tends to come out of the bottle really fast and goes everywhere if you're not careful. It does smell rather nice and leaves a silky feeling behind almost like you've used a fine talcum powder.  If you don't have a large shower (I don't), your best bet is to just turn the water off for a bit to get this rubbed on your skin.  Otherwise, it's washed away as soon as you swipe it on.  That's a problem for me because when I turn the water back on, I either get a blast of super hot water or a blast of icy cold water (weird pipes).  After rinsing the lotion off, I step out of the shower and dry off.  My skin does feel smooth and soft, like I've used a  body lotion.  The problem is that now the shower is all slippery with the lotion that was just washed off of me.  So, I have to grab a cloth of some kind and wipe the floor of the shower off enough that I don't go skating across the bathroom the next time I decide to shower.Given the option of having to wipe down the shower after each use or simply swiping on some lotion after showering, I think I choose the latter.  It's easier and takes less time plus I feel it gives me more moisurization.  If you have extremely dry skin and need more than just body lotion, this might be something you'd want to try in addition to whatever you currently use.  The scent is very light and did not cause any problems for me and I'm usually very sensitive to any type of fragrance but it is not unscented so that may be a consideration for some people.  I guess overall my impression is that this is a bit of a waste of space in my bathroom.  It's not something I would purchase or recommend to friends.

If you're looking for the right filtered water bottle to carry around in your car or to the gym, this one fits the bill.  It's slightly larger than the plastic water bottles you buy but not so big that it's cumbersome.  It couldn't be simpler to use.  Just fill the bottle, put the cap on and drink.  Water is filtered as it travels from the bottle into the spout.  It removes the majority of impurities and water definitely tastes better after filtering.  There is a no slip area around the middle of the bottle which is nice afer you've been working out and have sweaty hands.  The only drawback, which I've found is universal with these type bottles, is the amount of suction required to get a really good sized gulp of water.  You have to kind of squeeze the bottle and suck at the same time.  Then there's the wheeze of air returning to the bottle when you stop.  Normally not a big deal but I carry one of these with me everywhere and in a quiet place it's noticeable. My favorite part of this bottle, though, is the size and shape.  A lot of filtered water bottles are just too large and clunky to carry around.  This one is small and sleek enough that it's not a problem. Overall, I've been very pleased with the Bobble bottle and will probably order at least one more of this type.

I love Laurie King's novels of the continuing life of Sherlock Holmes and Mary Russell.  The plots, locales and mysteries are always intriguing and keep me turning pages until the end.  This novel is perhaps the best of the series in my opinion.  Mary and Sherlock are finally returning home after time spent in India.  Their exploits in India were covered in the two books previous to this one in the series.  On the boat home, they meet a young woman who needs their help to protect a prince and reclaim a book of secrets.  This is a true gem of a story with authenticity of period and place.  The writing is no less than superb.  I love these stories partly because they harken back to the works of Agatha Christie and Arthur Conan Doyle who have been favorites of mine since grade school.  If you haven't read any of Ms. King's previous Mary/Sherlock books, you will still enjoy this book.  It can stand alone as a mystery but it is so much better if you've gotten to know all the players and history from the previous books in the series.  I think I'll be giving this novel to a few friends as a Christmas gift.  Any mystery lover would enjoy it.

Nivea is a trusted name in my family for products that are good for your skin.  This lovely gift set of body wash, lotion and lip balm comes in a nice blue and white reusable round metal tin.  The products all work well to hydrate and smooth skin and are not highly fragranced which is important to me.  I especially love the lotion.  My hands get so dry in winter and this now sits on my bedside table so that I can use it nightly on hands and elbows.  My skin is so much softer and doesn't have that dry, tight feeling that I usually get in winter. The body wash lathers well and leaves your skin feeling sort of dewy after showering.  The lip balm glides on smoothly and evenly and I like the sort of chunky tube it's in which makes it easier to find in my purse. This would make a great gift for a teacher, coworker or family member.  I plan on buying a couple more myself to give to my mother-in-law and a couple of coworkers.

I really enjoyed the Blueberry Almond Fruit and Nut Toppers.  They were almost addictive.  The product is made sort of like peanut brittle and then cut into bite sized cubes.  The outside is all almond but when you bite into them, you get the sweet and tangy blueberry flavor as well.  They're called toppers but I enjoyed just eating a handfull of the little squares as a snack on their own.  I did try them on yogurt for breakfast and it tasted great, giving the yogurt a nice crunch.  I can see using them in salads because they're not overly sweet and would pair nicely with some blue cheese and spring greens.  There's really no way to go wrong with these no matter how you decide to eat them because they're yummy with anything. The ingredients are all natural so you can feel good about giving your family a healthy treat.

There is no doubt of Stephen King's brilliance.  I read everything he writes and usually have it preordered for months in advance as I did this novel.  The story is intriguing.  It's about the relationship between a man and the pastor he knew as a young boy at several different points during their lifetimes.  The minister is obsessed with electricity and using it to heal people.  His first such experiment is witnessed by young Jaime Morton as it helps his older brother regain his voice after an accident.  Charles Jacobs, the pastor, turns away from religion after a tragic occurrence but he and Jamie meet each other again about 15 years later and this time Jamie is the one who needs his help.  Jacobs has by that time expanded the scope of his experiments and his fascination with the power behind it.  Jamie discovers how remarkable this can be but what is the cost for such a miraculous invention?  It is only after another 20 years or so when Jamie discovers that his old friend is now in the tent revival healing business that he begins to delve into what "the Rev" is doing and how it is affecting those he "heals".I really enjoyed the novel right up until the very last chapter or so and then it simply lost me completely.  It's an ending that just leaves you feeling hopeless and depressed. It's scary in a sort of 1980's B movie style but mostly I just sat there thinking "this is it?  this is how it's going to end?".  I was hoping there'd be some little something maybe even in the last sentence that would leave this faithful reader with just a shred of hope or closure but that didn't happen.  It's disappointing in a major way.

We just got laminate flooring in our bedroom and I needed an area rug.  The beautiful color and pattern in this one looked ot be the perfect fit.  It is lovely and one of the softest rugs I've ever felt.  I was so excited when I first opened it.  There are, however, a couple of problems with it.  First, the ends want to roll up no matter what I use under the rug.  Short of taping it to the floor, there doesn't seem to be any way to get the rug to lay completely flat.  I'm not sure if that's because it was rolled during shipment or if that's just the way this rug is.  We've tried putting heavy items on the ends and leaving them for a day, using one of the foam mats underneath to hold it down and even rolling it the opposite way and leaving it for a day.  Nothing has improved it.  I worry that I'm going to trip over it. Granted, laminate has a very slippery surface so it might work better on top of carpet or vinyl tile. Secondly, the fibers are always coming loose.  I thought it was just because the rug was new and it would stop after a few days, but every day I seem to find more fibers poking up or coming loose. I worry what this is going to do to the integrity of the carpet after a while.  As pretty as this rug is, I simply can't recommend it unless you are planning on putting it someplace that is a "no traffic" area.  If you need a rug that can withstand actual use, it would probably be wiser to invest in something else.

This gets one star from me not because it's not well written or informative. It is both of those things. I simply found it to be very dry to the point of being boring.  I understand that this is not a novel but I did expect it to be a bit more salacious given the description of the book.  Being not of the Catholic faith, I also found it rather difficult to follow all the terms and titles that were used.  To be quite honest, I only made it approximately half way through the book before finally throwing in the towel.  Trying to keep up with all the people involved and the different investigations and reports ended up being like taking some type of class rather than enjoying a book for me.  I don't usually review books if I haven't finished them but I wanted to let others know what they are in for if they buy this book.The book details the "scandal" that happened at an Italian convent in the 19th century which does involve attempted murder, heresy and lesbian affairs.  That does not, however, mean that the book is scandalous in nature.  It is written in a very dry style with direct quotes from testimony or writings of Vatican investigations or from the diaries of priests or nuns.  Not exactly the stuff a scintillating story.Again, I want to reiterate that Mr. Wolf, the author, is obviously a brilliant scholar specifically in the history of Catholicism.  This book was also originally written in German and translated into English so perhaps something was lost in translation.  At any rate, this simply wasn't what I was expecting in this book.  If you enjoy minutely detailed histories especially as they relate to the Catholic church, I'm sure this would appeal to you. If you're wanting your 'Scandal' to be a bit more like the television show, then look elsewhere.

This is really a surprising value in a smart phone.  It comes with all the gear you really need to get started at no extra cost - Surprise!.  It is as thin and lightweight as an Iphone and the display and graphics look as good.  We have been extremely pleased with the performance of the phone in everything we've used it for thus far, texting, calling and gaming.  It has a camera and the one downside to this phone is that the pictures aren't great.  But, hey, I have a digital camera to use for when I want pictures.  I'm not much of a phone expert and in fact this is the first smart phone I've owned.  I'm old school when it comes to cell phones, what can I say?  My husband has an Iphone 5 though and he was amazed at what this phone can do for the price.  I can't comment on gaming abilities of the phone or technical aspects of it because I know nothing about either of those things.  What I can say is that it works beautifully for the things that I need which are calling, texting and access to email, internet.  I have not had the first problem with any of those features.  I also like the fun color of the case.  It really stands out in my purse or on my desk so I don't have to go searching for my phone amid a bunch of clutter.  Overall, I have been very pleasantly surprised by this phone and have recommended it to friends and family.  If you're looking for a good, basic smartphone that doesn't cost a fortune, you can't go wrong with this BLU Windows phone.

So far I've read two of Julie's books and I've enjoyed them both. This Gothic-style romance was completely different from her first book. I haven't ready anything quite like this book. The writing style was very good and the plot moved along at a brisk pace. The complexity and detail shown reflects the author's creativity. The setting with its Southern culture, graveyards, and creepy secret cult also gave the story an intelligent feel. The creepy scenes and odd characters added to the story's appeal and the mysterious twists and turns in the plot held my attention. I loved the emotion, the tension, the intrigue, and the sizzling romantic elements. I also appreciated how there were several instances where I had no clue about what was going to happen next, and then the author tossed in a curve ball I never saw coming. There was nothing predictable or cliche about this novel. There was even a faith/spiritual thread in the book. And the ending was sweet with just the right amount of resolution to satisfy me as a reader.

Now this was a sensational story. I didn't know if I'd like it at first, but I thought I'd give it a try. I've not read many books set in Brazil, but wow, this was a good one. There were so many double crosses, secrets, red herrings, and conflicts, there was never a dull moment. But the best part was the healing that took place in both of their hearts.So yes, there was action and suspense for people who love car chases and guns going off. Plenty of vivid details there. The way that the hero fought his emotion and at the same time wanted to see the heroine heal emotionally, well, it was very touching. And the way the heroine resisted love because of her past and fought the good emotion she felt around the hero made my heart flutter.I even got teary-eyed a few times as I experienced the emotional conflict with her. There is just something beautiful about watching a woman who was hurt and abused her entire childhood (and resigned to being treated like trash) awakening to the idea that she can be loved. Sigh. Beautiful stuff. It reminded me a bit of Redeeming Love in that respect. I highly recommend this book. Oh, and the ending was perfect. Wow.

I found this movie quite riveting. The acting by Reese was pretty amazing too. I loved how she did whatever she had to do to get ahead in this world and how sometimes people got hurt in the process. But like anyone, nobody is all bad even if they are self-centered. You saw some of the unpleasant consequences of some of the choices she made. I also felt a bit sorry for her at times because of her husband's gambling and then sending her son away to help him get educated. I felt her mother's heart. Anyway, I would watch this movie again. Reese did a great job.

This was a fun read and it had an interesting plot beyond the usual boy meets girl romance. I learned a bit more about New Zealand culture and lingo while enjoying the story. I saw some phrases I remember friends using from that part of the world, like, "I'm chuffed." Some of the equivalent terms made me smile. And the rugby players... oh my. Koti was quite a hunk, at least from what the author described.The heroine started out feeling disdain toward the hero, but it didn't feel forced. In fact, it was one of the more believable "girl can't stand guy" conflicts I've seen yet. She had a lot of reasons to be cautious about men. She had some wildly feminine ideals, too. I loved the emotional part of the story toward the end, like around the time they split up. I loved how the content of one of the later arguments offered Koti some insight... showing him a depth in their relationship that went beyond the superficial. The heroine made some great points that challenged him.Anyway, the story got pretty steamy at times, but the plot was interesting so it wasn't all about the steam between them. And it didn't get gross like in erotic fiction, or I wouldn't have finished it. There was actually a compelling story within this book. I enjoyed it.

Wow, I'm so tired this morning but I just had to finish this book before I went to sleep last night. The tension kept building and building, just the way I like them. I cared about the characters so much my heart ached at times. I would love to see this book in print. It's long, but very good. I enjoyed the entire ride!The story felt real to me and the characters were complex. I often got so lost in the story I forgot I was reading. The plot was emotional and compelling. My heart pounded more than a few times. And the ending... OH MY! If that doesn't make you want and jump up and shout, "Yes!" nothing will. Very well done!I'm a big fan of fiction written about Europe during the war anyway, and this story had just the right amount of tension, romance, and setting. I must have read upwards of fifty books or more during this time period and this was one of the better ones. There were so many compelling twists and turns in this story. I'm telling you, that last quarter of the book was NOT going to let me rest until I finished the last word. Great debut!

I was on the edge of my seat and even jumped a few times when I was startled by action (mostly shooting.) This movie reminded me of a "Bourne Identity type" movie because of the constant chase scenes and government involvement. Only these were teenagers running from killers. I thought the actors did very well at playing their rolls as terrified young people who didn't know what to do/where to go next or who to trust and/or run from.There were some impressive self-defense moves/action that were well executed by Lautner. I liked the overall theme and the emotions that he exhibited while playing the role of someone who just found out his whole life wasn't what he'd always believed. It was kind of cool when he started to realize that all the boxing with "dad" was to equip him with the skills needed to defend himself if attacked, thus preparing him for the day he would be targeted. It all tied nicely together and I really loved the ending.

I found this book compulsively readable. It was sent to me by the publisher to review for my honest opinion, so here goes... It reminded me of someone talking to the reader who has ADHD. Just when you think you are tracking with the story line, it goes off on another tangent. At the same time there were so many cultural elements, foods, and interpersonal issues in the book, I couldn't help being interested. Some of the cultural stuff I got a bit lost with (like the legends related to Indian culture) but overall, I found it hard to put down.The writing was interesting, and at times beautiful. The point of view was a bit convoluted because it seemed like most of story was being told by Mina, but at the same time it was impossible for her to be some of the places with Meterling. So she was sort of an omniscient POV, but not completely. I've never read a book quite like it. Once in awhile the author slipped in Simon's point of view, too. So while it was a tad odd to follow, I got used to it soon enough. The ghost thing was exceptionally weird, but again, still interesting.Clearly this story was fiction, but I enjoyed reading it for the most part. I was never bored. Not once. Confused, maybe. But not bored. So for that, I give it four stars, but overall it was more of a three and a half star book. Three was nothing remotely Judeo-Christian about this book, but it was not offensive to me. I feel like I learned something about people from the Island of Pi in the Indian Ocean who did not like being referred to as people from India, but at the same time they were part of that culture. Kind of like people from Hawaii being American, but Polynesian at the same time. I enjoy learning about cultures I know very little about.

I watched this movie on Netflix and it started out great. Then I was hugely disappointed when I found out why "something felt wrong" the second time he went to England. Samantha was crazy to stick around. Then poor Simon proposes... ugh, poor guy. I felt bad for him. He had no idea. I didn't like the fact that they never really talked about what they did when they were apart after the first time (except for that one huge argument,) but I did like how it showed that the people they were with were mere substitutes for who they really loved. But after awhile even that gets troubled by the conflict that comes with being disloyal to the commitment they'd made to each other. So the unfaithfulness part of the story was a bummer, but it was different than is usually portrayed because they each knew about other people, just not the full extent of the other person's involvement. Even though some viewers hated the ending, I found it profound because you could see in their eyes the impact that their straying had on both of them. It didn't leave them unaffected. Sheesh, I'd feel bad too if I knew that I had a fill-in lover for a time when I was apart from my true love. So I liked how the realism was shown - that the thing they wanted most (to be together) was tainted by their straying on both ends. I would have been more upset if they had reunited and been super happy like neither of them had done anything to hurt someone else (and living with someone when you really love someone else is not going to make you happy unless you have no conscience.) They both had broken hearts needlessly by allowing someone to love them that they couldn't truly love back. So while the ending was tough to tie up neatly and make a true happy ending, I found it realistic.

This was a sweet love story set during the Civil War. I tend to be a sucker for war love stories. This one had a bit more gore than a like to read about, though. I have a weak stomach. All the stuff about stench and lice was realistic I'm sure, but...ew. But I did like the way the characters interacted. I appreciated how loyal people were when they had seen sacrifice for people on the either side of the war. Poor Joe was sick for what seemed like forever. I thought it was sweet how he helped Beth heal by believing in her. She had rejection issues, and because of an injury when she was younger, the man she was in love with as a youth no longer wanted her. Joe saw beauty in her that made his former southern belle seem selfish and petty. It had the typical "wounded soldier from the other side of the war falls in love with the woman caring for him while he's feverish and at death's door" theme, so there were no surprises. One of them had to be angry with God and the other encouraged them to let go of the hurt. I didn't see how the quilt played a part in her emotional healing. I must have missed the connection. The story was pretty good, just not amazing.

I don't typically read books in this genre, though it's kind of funny that I've read two in the past month. I really enjoyed this story for a number of reasons. I think it's cool how the author used a dystopian and futuristic world to show the importance of what God created and how altering the divine order in our lives makes us a bunch of clones of each other.We all need a purpose for our lives and given the right conditions, we will all, at some point, long for something better. We all make choices that make us who we are. Without emotion and love, we have nothing. Since God is love, it all ties together. I found the way the author tied that all together quite fascinating. I would consider this a high concept novel, though the concept if firmly based in a Christian worldview.I appreciated the deep point of view used by the author to show deception and how putting our hope in something that isn't real is kind of like falling in love with our sin. In the end it leaves us feeling emptier...worse than before. I saw Dr. Loudin as not just an antagonist, but also a "satan" figure in that his goal is not only to get the character to believe the deception, but he was willing to not only mess with her mind and her emotions, but destroy her soul to accomplish that. Very profound stuff.And the way the biblical truths were presented to the characters was emotionally moving. The way they were willing to sacrifice their lives for each other was also very touching. The insight and sense of a higher purpose because of the teaching they received from John touched my heart. The ending left me anticipating the next book. I can't wait to see what this author cooks up for book two.

This author sure knows how to pack emotion, tender moments, and passion within the pages of each book she writes. I loved this book. It was compelling and interesting. I appreciated how there were so many lessons about secrets, forgiveness, and knowing God in a personal way inserted into the story line. I also loved how the author showed that a relationship with the living Savior does change the way someone lives their life and eventually people who long for similar peace will seek the same relationship.The romance was delectable. I adored the hero. He was very heroic and delightful. The way he sacrificed his time to help Madison was admirable. I loved how he taught her to swim so she wouldn't be so afraid to be on the water. The tension was tastefully written, but palpable and intense at the same time. There was true love going on within the pages of this book. It flowed smoothly and naturally and I had a hard time putting it down once I got wrapped up in the story.

Since I've enjoyed a number of historical fiction titles over the years by a variety of historical novelists, I thought this might add to that broad knowledge base. I've read about Henry IV and Elizabeth Woodville (Royal Mistress,) Richard III and the Nevilles (The Kingmaker's Daughter,) Lady of the Rivers (about Elizabeth Woodville's mother, Jacquetta, and her husband Lord Rivers,) The Red Queen (Margaret Beaufort) and numerous other stories about the Tudors, Plantagenets, etc., I found this book quite historically engaging. I would have rated it higher, but it took me over a year to finish reading it. Not because it wasn't interesting, but because of the many details including references and historical events. It takes me a lot longer to read non-fiction for this reason. Regardless, I think it helped illustrate the backgrounds of several prominent women during the Middle Ages and their political aspirations/issues. I would highly recommend it for history lovers, particularly those interested in the politics of the 14th and 15th centuries. It also has lineages and pictures in the book, which added to its appeal.

I really enjoyed this book. It was a sweet and tender romance with a character I'd gotten to know previously in Short-Straw Bride. I'll admit, I adore the Archer boys, so I was excited about reading this book. It wasn't quite as enthralling as the last story, but it was spiritually deep and brought tears to my eyes toward the end. That mess with Holly had me holding my breath, too.The story was filled with themes of doing the right thing and the importance of being honest in every way. A little deception is still deception, and coming clean before God and man is good for the soul. I also liked the emphasis on the power of prayer and listening to God's voice in your heart. Those are all decent lessons for any good story. The author just made them more fun because of her lovable characters.Stealing the Preacher's core themes were the importance of listening to God, being patient, and being willing to allow God to direct your steps. I appreciated the spiritual aspects of the story most of all. But I also adored Crockett as the hero and the love he felt for Joanna because of her caring heart and her desire to serve others. He treasured that more than just her pretty face. I thought that was a wonderful theme as well.I believe this story illustrates very well how good men want someone who will be partner for life in all ways, and that woman needs to be someone they admire. That's an admirable message for aspiring young single ladies who want to win a good man's devotion. Flirtation and temptation are not the ways to accomplish that end. Very well done.

This was an interesting, though quite long, novel of about 500 pages. The omniscient point of view took some getting used to, but once I got the hang of the author's writing style, I found it effective. I liked how the author inserted many issues that are still common to women today into her novel set during the reign of Edward IV. Some things may never change this side of heaven. I appreciated how she inserted the realism of the times when it came to faith, prayer, and culture. At the same time, the characters were not above cursing at appropriate times. None of the language felt gratuitous to me, though there were some terms that sensitive people would find offensive.There were realistic scenes in the book that fit the plot. Nothing seemed over-the-top in my opinion, and though there were some pretty descriptive scenes, much of the intimacy was implied. The story focused on her relations with three historical men, so there had to be intimacy as part of the story. I felt pity for Jane in her first marriage. I could see how she felt cheated. Then to have the King of England requesting her... well, she didn't have much choice in that. The other other two liaisons made sense as well, especially to a grieving woman who didn't want to live on the streets.Jane was a likable character and not portrayed as a slutty woman, or manipulative. I liked that she was just a normal woman in unfortunate circumstances that would be easy to sympathize with. There was a scene where Jane finally reconciled with her father that evoked a lot of emotion in me. It was very well done. I was so glad to see Jane happy after so much tragedy and to finally get the baby she longed for and the legitimacy she craved. Then to find out it happened for her in real life and is recorded in history, well, that was especially touching. All in all, this was a good book.

This book was fun and a bit of a thrill ride for the first half. Then it morphed into a romance in the second half with a short spurt of danger toward the end. The use of the term goons to describe the terrorists did take some terror out of the plot, though. It didn't sound as dangerous to me. What I liked best was the dynamics between characters including the quick wit and sense of humor they had with each other. The dialog was great. What wasn't as believable to me was the speed in which they developed feelings for each other. Even if they felt that way I don't think they would say it quite so soon. I'm sure it happens at times. The author just didn't convince me even though the hero became breathless over her beauty a hundred times. I liked the characterization overall and the way the author delved into technology. I feel like I got a mini-lesson on cyber security. That was fun. I enjoyed the spiritual part of the story, though some of it seemed a bit forced. At the same time some great points were made. Overall it was an enjoyable story and I would recommend it.

I love books that make me think. This is the type of novels that leaves you pondering things even after you finish the last page. I really liked how the story ended because it brought closure to everything. I also appreciated the realistic struggles that the hero and heroine had. This author does a good job with stirring emotion in the reader and making hearts ache as well as rejoice. There were just enough "we think we've found out what happened" scenarios to make it seem suspenseful, even though it wasn't a suspense novel. There was also a mystery element to the book. It would be hard to sit around waiting when the trail seems to grow colder by the day.The questions Mitch asked himself were legitimate ones. How do you know when it's time to let go? How do you get peace in a situation like this? Why did God let it happen and why did it take so long to find out the truth? Well, God knows what he's doing and if we tune into His will, we will find peace and a deeper relationship with Him, but we have to surrender our own plans first. It's really hard to talk about some of the characters' journeys without posting spoilers and this is the kind of book that you don't want to cheat and read the end first.Half the beauty of reading the story is not knowing the outcome. The moral and spiritual dilemmas are more complex when the reader doesn't know the future... just like in real life. How many decisions would we change if we knew what the future held? It was a realistic and touching journey for me in that respect. I really enjoyed this story.

I really enjoyed the historical aspects of this story and the pictures the author included. The emotional bonding that took place between characters over various incidents that occurred at the fair was well done. I appreciated the insight the author had into a number of issues. One had to do with how the belief in someone's abilities and admiration of them as a person will increase their feelings for each other. Especially men. They want the woman they are attracted to also believe in them as a person and what they can do, not just the length of time they had known each other. That makes for a stronger kind of love; one that leads to a passionate marriage rather than just a comfortable one.The hero, Cullen, was very likable, but also quite manly. The description of his physique was quite hot, actually. I enjoyed how the author used the need for him to learn how to lip read as a way to meet the woman he became attracted to and make it difficult for him to learn from her by putting them in a number of private situations. That was great when it came to developing tension between them. His fierce protectiveness of her made me love him more. He was a good guy and cared deeply about a number of things, including loyalty. One of his most intense issues was his need to put out fires to save lives. He got to the point where he had to rely on God to see him through some tough issues. I loved that he grieved along with Della during a tragic time at the fair. It helped bond them even more. That was very well done.The heroine, Della, was a sweetheart as well. The way her feelings slowly developed for the hero was touching. The scene with the little girl in her class was a tear-jerker, but it really made Della think about what the kids experienced from being separated from their parents. Della had her own frailties, but she was a tough lady. Her response to seeing the hero's buff physique made me smile. I felt like I was touching those ripped muscles. And that first kiss... whew! Great romantic tension. She got a bit skittish at times when she felt like she couldn't trust him, but she came around and that made me admire her more. Very enjoyable story.

I was hoping to see this at the theater but missed it, so I watched the DVD at home. I really enjoyed the movie. I haven't seen these actors before (and if I have I don't remember them) and I thought they did a pretty good job. That little girl was adorable. The heroine was put in an impossible position and I thought it resembled "Sleeping with the Enemy" with Julia Roberts, but it was a different theme and setting. The movie was more chick flick than thriller, but it had it's moments that made me a bit jumpy. The chemistry between them seemed real enough. I would watch this again.

I absolutely loved this book. Over 80% of it was read to me by my Kindle Fire HD, but I had no trouble understanding it because it was in the first person POV and there was only one character to track while listening. Anyway, I bought this book to find out more about Scott and to see what happened. I was not disappointed. Things just really took off and now I'm feeling bummed that the next book isn't out yet. I loved how the author wrote life like she saw it for this character and wasn't worried about being PC when it came to conversations and actions. These characters acted like real people would.I love the setting because I was young in the 1980s and when computers first came out. I remember the chat rooms and going dancing with friends. Some people might take issue with them drinking champagne a few times, but they never got drunk so it didn't bother me. Phoenix did get drunk in the first book, but she wasn't a believer and her boyfriend made her drink too much. I liked this book better even though the first book sets the foundation for her past, which helps you understand the second book. I found this story compelling and very interesting. The faith elements became a pleasant surprise I hadn't seen coming. I am definitely going to buy the third book.

More like 3.5 starsCatherine's Pursuit is the conclusion to a series about the three McKenna girls - also identical triplets - who were separated at birth and found each other again. I do love adoption stories and particularly ones that focus on a search to find biological parents and/or siblings to help one better understand family roots and genetic traits. The original story of what happened to them was part of a previous book and I found it quite heartbreaking. It didn't get rehashed in this story so people who haven't read previous books might feel a bit of deprivation there. The history was touched upon, but in a very light manner.Overall the story was heartwarming and a bit warm and fuzzy. There were a few scenes with a bit of action, like when Collin went to the bar and ordered a drink so he had to deal with some demons from his past, but for the most part this story moved at a slower pace. This seemed to fit the time period and character development. I enjoyed experiencing Catherine's transformation as well as Collin's. The way the author showed Catherine's change from a pretty spoiled young lady to a woman who understood hardship worked well. I wasn't feeling the connection between the hero and heroine for most of the book, but when they finally came to realize the love growing between them it played out in a very sweet scene. The fact that Collin also changed over time to become more confident was rewarding as well. All in all, this was a nice, sweet historical romance.
Matched perfectly. Be very very careful not to spray thick coats or it will run. Very light coats, like 5-6 light coats, will make it look perfect.

I've only had my french bulldog on this food for one month but I can't really rave about it yet. Mainly because this food is SMELLY and I really think it makes his poop and coat smelly. I think I might switch to the potato and duck formula to compare. The fishiness of this formula just really smells bad and I have to try something else. I was also really disappointed that these weren't the "small bites" because the kibble is almost too large for my puppy. Wish I had known to get the small bites before ordering this bag.

I had a breeder recommend these to me and I think we just became lifelong customers! My French bulldog puppy (10lbs) absolutely loves these! I can't get him to chew his nylabones no matter which flavor, and I'm too hesitant and cheap to try antlers because they look so sharp and expensive. These are perfect!! I like this size for puppies but will probably get the next size up as he grows into an adult. The weight measurement (15lbs) seems accurate. I like that these are hard enough not to break into dangerous pieces but still soft enough for safe chewing. And they are made of natural safe ingredients. Can't say enough good things about them!
Excellent learning toy for toddlers! The bears are hard plastic and seem very durable. Just the right size for little hands.

I really like the idea of this "game". It is perfect for imaginary play for my 4 yr old twins. I am only giving 3 stars because the very top pieces of the cupcakes are TINY--like the size of an earring. Not ideal for toddler play. I know they will get lost in a matter of minutes and will cause a crying meltdown by my girls. Its only a matter of time. I wish all of the pieces were a big larger overall. They are also a huge choking hazard if you have younger children around. But I guess if you are super super careful you can make sure they don't get lost. Good luck.

I love this Zymox shampoo for my french bulldog puppy. He doesn't have any allergies or skin issues so I use this only as a preventative. I'm too chicken to try any other shampoos that might irritate his skin. I love this shampoo because it makes his fur SO SOFT and doesn't have an overly powerful scent. I look forward to trying the enzymatic rinse that you can use after this shampoo. Zymox also makes an ear cleaner that is PERFECT for french bulldogs' huge ears. Thanks Zymox!!

Great price. I like to stock up on these with subscribe and save. They work great and smell great. Not quite as strong as other antiperspirants but I do think they work nicely. My husband even uses them on occasion.

These are just okay for me. They are described excellently--they are TRICKY and CHEWY. I think they would be perfect for a larger more aggressive dog, but for my french bulldog puppy they just take too much effort and time for him to finish each treat. They are just a bit too hard and chewy for him. I LOVE that they are grain free and have only good ingredients in them. Perhaps I'll try them again when he is an adult, but for a small breed puppy these aren't the best choice.

Great preschool workbook for ages 4-5. I like that the pages are in full color with great fun graphics and easy to follow designs. My 4 yr old twins love these. Wish they had more pages but I'm happy to just order more books and have them do each book over again!

I first read Hope by Amanda Berry and Gibs DeJesus and I was very intrigued by Michelle Knight because their book doesn't talk a lot about her background or how she ended up in the house before them. So I chose to read this book, and I'm glad I did. Now I understand why she chose to write her own story--in my opinion, she has a much more tragic story and I was bawling through much of it. Especially the end. She is an amazing soul and I hope she finds happiness and pure joy for the rest of her life. I pray that her son will get to meet her someday. Nobody on Earth should have to endure what she did for the first 32 years of her life.

Another winner from Crocs! My two year old is obsessed with these shoes. His feet are very wide and chunky, especially around the ankles and top of the foot. Crocs are the only brand that he likes to wear comfortably. He wears a 9 and I ordered a 10 in these so that they last all year. When he outgrows the strap, we just remove it and they instantly fit like the next size up.These Crocs in particular are a little heavier in weight because of the lights. Nothing too noticeable, and the extra weight actually makes them feel higher quality and really solid. I love them just as much as he does.

My son has very wide feet on top (not just the width of his feet side to side, but from heel to the top of his foot) and Crocs are just about the only brand of shoe that fits him comfortably. These shoes are very cute and classic. I love that they have the sole of Crocs and the lightweight feeling of a typical Crocs slip-on, but they are more like sneakers. Love the velcro--perfect for my two year old to try and put on himself!

This is a great wet bag! I use it at the pool for all of my things that I don't want to get wet. I put my phone, my medical device, snacks, etc. The zipper is great and I LOVE that it has two separate pockets. Great price and great product!

These are quality rain boots!! The rubber is very flexible and solid one piece, with no messy seams or other places for leaks. They are the BEST waterproof rain boots for kids I have seen on the market. And made in Canada makes them all the better!Other pros:--the liner is very thick and warm. These are not just rain boots, but snow boots as well. The liner inside will keep my son's feet toasty warm, especially with socks.--the top has a drawstring to cinch up once his pants are inside the boot. This is an awesome feature to keep out any extra snow or rain!!My son wears a toddler size 9 and I ordered a toddler size 10 thinking they would be roomy. Unfortunately with the liner inside, these were much too small for my son and he couldn't get his heel down into the boot with the liner on. So I ordered the little kids size 12 and they look HUGE but the looks are deceiving because with the liner inside they actually fit comfortably with room to grow into this fall/winter. I'm posting a photo of the liner so you can see what I'm talking about.Other than the sizing issue, these are awesome!! So perfect.

These work great.Pros:--They clean food really well. Even stuck-on food. I rarely have to re-wash a dish unless it was super baked on food.--Easy to stick in the dishwasher.Cons:--Sometimes the tablets are cracked in half or the red ball is floating around the packaging. Not sure if it affects how it works, but it can be messy to get it all out of the wrapper.--If you have very hard water you will still need a rinse aid. These don't make your dishes sparkles and shine without an extra rinse aid for hard water.--Can be dangerous to have around small children. I need to get a cabinet lock because my 2 yr old likes to try to play with the wrapped squares even though he knows they are a big no-no.

I liked this book a lot. It was inspiring to read and helped me appreciate my health and able body more than I have ever even thought about it. The book is heavily doused in Christianity so it might not be for everyone, but I enjoyed it and I want to keep following their story to see Ian's progress.

I bought the Crocband II sandal and the "Timberland Adventure Seeker 2-Strap" both in toddler size 9. The crocs are a bit wider and longer, which is perfect for my 2 yr old's feet. He has very fat feet in the area where the ankle meets the foot, so a lot of shoes are just too small for his thick foot. Crocs have always been the best fit, and these Croc sandals didn't disappoint! The Timberland sandals were also a good fit, but a little harder to get on and a little more snug. I will be sending back the Timberlands just because the Crocs are a better option for us. Both shoes were extremely well made and I love that the Timberland sandals have such a soft memory foam, flexible sole. I took away one star because the Timberland sandals have more velcro on both straps and that concerns me because velcro typically starts to age and look old after awhile, whereas the Croc sandals have a different type of velcro and only on one strap. Overall they are great sandals for toddlers.

I bought the Crocband II sandal and the "Timberland Adventure Seeker 2-Strap" both in toddler size 9. The crocs are a bit wider and longer, which is perfect for my 2 yr old's feet. He has very fat feet in the area where the ankle meets the foot, so a lot of shoes are just too small for his thick foot. Crocs have always been the best fit, and these Croc sandals didn't disappoint! The Timberland sandals were also a good fit, but a little harder to get on and a little more snug. I will be sending back the Timberlands just because the Crocs are a better option for us. They are so adorable and my favorite thing about Crocs is that you can just toss them in the washing machine with a load of clothes and they come out looking BRAND NEW!! (don't put them in the dryer!!) Crocs win again for my toddler!!

So far this is the absolute best sunscreen I've purchased for my kids. It is non-greasy and thick (not runny) and I love that it is rated top safety ratings. My kids haven't had a sunburn all year and they love to apply this. They think its just lotion. It doesn't sting and it isn't a pain to apply.

These work great, but beware that they have a hard valve inside the lid. I didn't read the description and I just assumed that there wasn't a valve inside. I prefer the one piece lids for easy cleaning.

I like this plush animal, but I was a little disappointed that it is permanently in the sitting position. It cannot lie down or stretch straight out. But that is just me being very picky. The stuffed animal itself is absolutely adorable. Very well made, very very soft. Perfect for a little baby or toddler who loves monkeys. Would be perfect to decorate a nursery and have sitting on a shelf, because of the permanent sitting position.

This was my first Ju-Ju-Be purchase after all of my co-workers were raving about this brand. I am 100% happy and I LOVE LOVE LOVE this bag. It is perfect for my laptop and work stuff, or for 2 beach towels to take all my kids' stuff to swim lessons. The print is adorable and timeless.
