Lindemann is a bit of a reprobate, an aging lecher who doesn't limit his predations to unmarried women, nor to women around his own age. Inevitably, someone takes offense at his actions and he's found with his head bashed in. The city police appear to be heading in the wrong direction and tenuous reputations are at stake. O'Neil, following her independent turn of mind, sails off to nab the killer.This puzzle has a fascinating if occasionally appalling cast of characters and if the pace lags in the belly of the book, the twists and surprises are ultimately satisfying. A good solid addition to the body of mystery literature.

Michael Norman writes in a straight-forward kind of abrupt style that can be off-putting. An almost endless march of short declarative sentences doesn’t allow for much rhythm or flexibility in approach. Nevertheless, the author has constructed a novel with an excellent foundation, logical development, interesting characters and a long-running, intense disagreement at the core of the story, a disagreement which is a real.To the small southern Utah community of Kanab comes a former Denver detective after the destruction of his marriage and his career. J.D. Books is hurting. He needs a job and he needs to recover. Through the probable intervention of his father, Kanab being the town of his youth, Books lands a job with the Bureau of Land management as the local representative of law enforcement. The town is divided among those who favor environmental concerns for preserving the natural wonders of the area, and others, who see the vast expanses of land as development potential.David Greenbriar leads an environmental alliance which, in spite of internal disagreements as to strategy, seems to be winning the local fight to protect the millions of acres of relatively unspoiled land against the desires of developers. Books is hardly settled into his doublewide mobile home when Greenbriar is murdered, shot once while camping in the wilderness. With some reluctance, Books BLM boss agrees to let him run the murder investigation, his experience being far broader than anyone in the small community. This decision puts Brooks into conflict with his family’s friends and his efforts to balance impartiality with finding the killer makes an interesting story.In the end, Norman’s straight ahead style, serves the story well and while twists and turns are not part of the picture, “On Dangerous Ground,” is a solid detective story with comfortable characters many readers will want to see again.

Keely Bennett teaches American Literature in high school and was the adviser to the yearbook club. Then her husband commits suicide in a rather messy way and he is found by the couple’s young son. After that, the story gets really dark and messy. I’ll admit right up front that I am put off by authors who feel they have to search for synonyms for “said” in order to make dramatic points and who use a lot of italics for the same reason. For those reasons, the impression I take away from this novel is perhaps more negative than it should be.Billed as a dark psychological thriller, author MacDonald, who certainly can write well, seems to take the easy path in many instances in a story with considerable potential, with surprising twists and a protagonist I found difficult to like. Keely Bennett makes obvious mistakes, seems unable to think for herself in many instances, and is ultimately present at the final resolution, rather than creating it. She’s very good at despair and hand-wringing. Her son, Dylan, on the other hand seemed the very essence of a modern teenager, beset by adults who neither understand nor listen to him, a boy with a mother one step from being institutionalized, supportive friends at school, yet possessed of keen insight and a willingness to act while his mother dithers.

Another Kate Henry mystery. Henry is a wise-cracking, sometimes arrogant, yet nicely vulnerable sports reporter. She specializes in baseball, following the mythical Toronto Titans in spring training camp. Pretty routine stuff for this tough, experienced, baseball writer, you'd expect. Then another reporter, this one young, attractive and with something of a reputation for round-heeledness turns up dead on the beach and a Titan player is jailed for her murder.Naturally, Henry is pressed to take on the task of proving the accused is innocent. So far so good. What makes this novel noticeably better than average, is the skill and knowledge of the author. Gordon has created a feminine protagonist with a very particular view of her world. It's a view that blends humor, cynicism and a quick tongue with obvious knowledge of baseball. In fact, reporter Kate Henry has a good deal in common with Author Alison Gordon. This is all to the good.If you're a baseball fan, you'll likely enjoy this novel. If you like strong intelligent female protagonists who don't come off as Wonder Woman, but who are real, and if you enjoy puzzles, good writing and interesting characters, you'll probably enjoy this novel.

Author Standiford has created an interesting and somewhat unusual protagonist in John Deal, an independent contractor who's struggling to make a go of it in south Florida. He's married to Janice, a terrific, sensual, woman. The sex is good, business is good, life is good. Unfortunately, dangerous, murderous forces are at work, forces that soon draw Deal inexorably into a situation not of his making. It is a situation from which he is unable to extricate himself without serious damage, except by solving a tangled series of dreams, corruptions, and wending his careful way through greed-spawned violence.Standiford has dealt us a rich novel, laying on the broad canvas of this book many layers of color and of texture. Weather, people, events, politics, all mesh to drive this violent, explicit, action-filled thriller to a most satisfying conclusion.

How did I miss this one when it first came out? I know the author, been following the man’s writing career. He gave me a copy of this book. Still, I only recently got around to reading it. And discovered to my chagrin what I’ve been missing. Delayed a really fine read. Here is Chicago, in all its grit and insouciance, it’s rhythm and its nasty side.Chicago is part of Cook County, and they have a sheriff, a law enforcement presence, and all the problems an urban county can absorb. Comes now one Sergeant Francisco Leal, back after a drug bust gone bad, resulting in a grievous wound to his person. Leal, your basic resentful cynic, doesn’t enjoy busting bad guys to see them get off too lightly, and he isn’t always quiet about his feelings, even in front of the judge. Thus, “the Dark Gable Incident,” which gave Leal a certain cache, positive in some circles, but negative in many others.We get a really good look at the simmering anger that lies under Leal’s professional demeanor and now he has a new assignment. Along with two young, inexperienced detectives and another sergeant, Leal is assigned to a politically sensitive case that is so cold, the detective’s fingers get numb just paging through the files.Almost a year previously a major player, a judge Miriam Walker, went missing, was found dead some time later, and there were no arrests, no apparent motive, no leads.. A random victim, possibly of a carjacking? A very cold case. Now, elections are coming and the Sheriff is being beaten up over this still unsolved case. A team is assembled in an obvious political ploy, to re-examine the case and Leal is second in command, due primarily to his seniority. The team assembles with the initial understanding that there’s almost no upside to the situation.The characters are precisely drawn, their actions methodical and deliberate and logical. The action and the tension are low-keyed for a long time, but the writing is so fine, I was drawn inexorably to page after page until the climax exploded off the page. This is one fine police procedural. Ultimately we learn that the assumption of randomness is not the truth.

When Catherine Saylor decided to become a private investigator, she made a conscious decision to avoid the slugs and bottom feeders of society, those for whom violence was frequently a way of life. Instead, she chose the high road of corporate security, of white collar crime.Now however, she’s forced to confront a brutal killer who has framed her lover, Peter Harman. There is more to this story of the search for justice than first meets the readers’ eye. In what is to become almost a hallmark of Linda Grant’s writing, her protagonist must follow several threads in order to finally successfully solve this case.Hampering her efforts to clear Harman, P.I. Saylor has to cope with several overprotective associates, not the least intrusive of whom is her former husband, Dan Walker. If, at times, the author’s attempts to establish her protagonist as a capable, stand-up kind of person, get in the way of the pace, the story is interesting enough that we forgive these minor excesses.RANDOM ACCESS MURDER is a good story, well told. Compliments to Intrigue Press for bringing this one back to the reading public.

Although it received at standing ovation in 1984 at the Venice Film Festival, this is not one of Fellini's great works. It does satirically poke air out of the pre World War I upperclass society and raises all sorts of metaphorical questions about the place of the individual in that society. The music and the brief conflict between the passengers on the luxury liner and a group of Serbians plucked out of the water sets up the final confrontation between Italy and the Austro-Hungarian battleship. There are numerous  individual touches that interrupt the story and slow the narrative, but in spite of its difficulties, one can see the quirky and intense vision of the master film maker.

Way back in the nineteen-sixties, Lawrence Block was writing fiction. He's been doing that for some time now. Any lover of mystery fiction should be at least passingly familiar with Mathew Scudder, Block's recovering alcoholic, New York ex-cop, and free lance consultant.No Score is not Matt Scudder. It is a Chip Harrison mystery, written over twenty years ago, recently reissued and it is a tribute to this master writer how well it stands up. Oh, sure, you'll find some dated references, some gender-related attitudes that we've (mostly) grown beyond. Still, this is a fine, well-written story, and if the mystery is a little light, well, Chip Harrison's tribulations in his innocent if highly focused teen-aged attempts to score are delightful in their frivolity.As is always the case with a Block story, the characters are keenly observed, strange, wonderful and more often than not, very funny. The dialogue is right on and each scene is carefully drawn. At the same time, some of No Score's explicitness may be offensive. An enjoyable read, a quite different dimension of Lawrence Block, but not, perhaps to everyone's taste.

Boy, can this author write. Hard, restless, muscular prose that drives the story relentlessly forward. Barbara Saranella is in full command of her work. Just as her hero, Munch Mancini is in control of her life—pretty much. She should be. Mancini is an unusual anti-hero—almost. She’s defied parental control, been on the street, run away, done drugs and knows an almost incredible array of those who regularly travel the mean streets of any large city, particularly Los Angeles, where this story takes place.Mancini is getting her life together, what with a regular job as an auto mechanic and her start-up limousine service. She’s managed to put together a deal to buy a house, and her relationship with her eight-year old daughter is improving every day. But then trouble arrives in the shape of long-time girlfriend Ellen Summers. Mancini believes in relationships, almost to a fault. So when Ellen’s mother and stepfather are murdered and Ellen, ex-druggie, ex-stripper ex-thief is released from jail, Munch is immediately and unwillingly swept up in a swirling cesspool of low-life thievery, gun-play and deadly attempts to find hidden boodle.There are clever twists, crackling blunt dialogue while Munch has some second thoughts about helping Ellen in what is becoming more and more evidently a criminal enterprise. She doesn’t want to become collateral damage. More importantly she doesn’t want any of this to touch her daughter, Asia. But Munch Mancini is not one to sit around wallowing in self-pity or wringing her hands worrying about whether she’s up to the challenges life is throwing at her. Get out there and do it sister! That’s her thing and let the chips—and bodies—fall where they may. I say bravo. One terrific novel.

In some ways, I found this to be a difficult book to engage. I had to re-read the first 50 or so pages, to be sure I had certain relevant facts clear in my mind. But, upon reliving the first hundred pages or so, I was hooked.The novel is one of searching. Police are searching for a killer. The killer is searching for his daughter. And a lonely adopted woman, with little to go on, searches first for her birth mother, and then for family, possibly lost forever, in the unconcerned mists of a previous century. The solution to the several mysteries will determine who lives and who dies.With heartfelt care the author has set out to explore the uncertainties, the second-guessing, the frustrations, of researching adoption records, of locating long-missing family members, of issues of estrangement and the inexorable passage of time.Clearly, the author is most interested in the principal but fractured family of the Schlegel dynasty. Two brothers, building a successful business in Chicago, see their progress and their shared business stunningly shattered in the Great Chicago Fire of 1871. The resulting split between the brothers leads, in part, to the mystery of a missing Schlegel heir, a young woman so repressed by the society and her father that, at the end of the Nineteenth Century, she follows her brother’s lead and runs away from a small town in Northern Minnesota, to brawling Chicago.The novel relies on several coincidences, of timing and of actions which may be bothersome for some readers. However, the stories are so interesting, the characters so well drawn and well-thought out, so filled with emotional drama, that this reviewer, at least is willing to overlook those minor irritants. In the end, the novel is about relationships, good and bad, and it speaks in universal terms to anyone open to others.

Author Robert Timberg is an award-winning journalist. He brings impressive credentials to this project. Those credentials alone are enough to inspire a high measure of confidence in this book. It is a further measure of the trust one can place in this astounding work that author Timberg immediately addresses possible reader skepticism in the opening paragraph of the section in which he provides notes and explanations of his research.This is the intersected story of five graduates of the US Naval Academy at Annapolis, Maryland. The men are John McCain, Robert McFarlane, Oliver North, John Poindexter, and James Webb. This is a story of courage and honor, of lying and deception, of politics and statesmanship. This is a story of the lingering effects of Viet Nam on those who bled there, and on those who didn't go; and on the entire nation. This is truth.No toneless, apparently neutral history text, THE NIGHTINGALE'S SONG is so well-written, it is difficult to put it down. The book examines the role of Viet Nam in their lives, and in the connection of those five to the Iran-Contra Affair. In fiction we often talk of suspense, passion, pace. It's all here in this astonishingly well-written, mesmerizing chronicle. By turns wry, cynical, humorous, and insightful, Timberg, an Annapolis graduate and ex-marine himself, is able to provide an insiders view of the way in which our Navy goes about choosing and promoting its officers. The contribution to our understanding of the political, military, and emotional events of these recent decades through this book is immeasurable. And it rings of truth.Author Timberg has thoughtfully provided an extensive bibliography, a good index, a list of interviewees and copious research notes. A memorable book, likely destined to become a classic of its type.

More complications for poor Vicki Bliss. This is another outing for fans of the author and it delivers what has come to be expected. The premise, however, is a little hard to take.In order to get Vicki to Egypt in harm's way and smack in the center of a complex robbery caper, she must agree to become something of an Egyptologist in order to be inserted into a luxury cruise on the Nile River. Her purpose there is to observe and report to some intelligence agency in Germany, anything of interest regarding the whereabouts and activities of one or more master thieves.She's given little accurate information, makes several serious mistakes and misjudges any number of people. Her lover abruptly appears, with a bride Vicky knew nothing about and the bride's mother. Murder, mayhem and multiple maneuverings abound and at times it's difficult to keep the whole thing in focus.Produced with a good portion of tongue-in-cheek humor, Peters once again takes her characters and her readers on a complicated romp of near epic proportions. Consider that there is the river cruise, escape through the desert by car and jeep, a train-ride, more than one rescue of damosel from dreaded captors, an exotic locale, several bumbling folks, conspiracy inside conspiracy, and you get the idea. For myself, I would have preferred that Ph. D. Vicki Bliss had been smarter at times and more instrumental in the final fix.

NIGHT JUDGEMENT AT SINOS AmaZby Jack Higginspb 1997 Berkley 289 pgs.ISBN 0-425-16199-4It’s been said before and I agree, Jack Higgins is a superb story-teller. What’s more, he has an apparently inexhaustible supply. This story was originally published in 1970 and it’s a measure of Higgins talent that it is still a cracking good novel more than twenty years later.The island of Sinos has become a prison for the holding of political prisoners of the then Greek military regime. Deep sea salvage diver Jack Savage, and former British commando is hired by a wealthy shipping czar to retrieve a certain gentleman from this impenetrable fortress called Sinos. Sounds simple enough doesn’t it? Not the task, that’s downright foolish. Sinos is heavily fortified and almost unapproachable. The idea seems straightforward enough, though, even for a man used to the labyrinthine plotting of the Middle East. Mr. Savage is wrong.As we have come to expect from Higgins, NIGHT JUDGEMENT AT SINOS is a small action in a wider movement of the struggle between good and evil, ethics and expediency, and as always is a well-plotted story that keeps the pages turning.

This is the seventh in the author’s excellent southwestern US crime series. It features two former members of a county sheriff’s department. In this one, a new sheriff has been elected. This is reflective of changing times in and around Phoenix, Arizona, which in real life it is all too apparent the author detests.He is also very unhappy with changes in the city of Phoenix. This unhappiness gets in the way of a smoothly organized, nicely flowing contest between the forces of evil and those on the side of the angels. Nevertheless, Talton’s talent as a conceptualizer of excellent plots and formidable characters is fully apparent as newly minted private investigators, Mike Peralta and cold case specialist David Mapstone, team up on their first case, the suspicious death of a young woman from Arizona who dies in a fall from a condo balcony in San Diego.There are a number of issues immediately apparent and Mapstone really wants nothing to do with San Diego. His first wife still lives in the area and he’s struggling to come to terms with his current wife’s absence.Part of Talton’s talent is his ability to gradually weave the personal elements of his characters past and present beings into the reality of the dangerous case Peralta and Mapstone face. The two principals are marvelously different in their backgrounds and their approaches to detection and law enforcement. The differences add materially to reader enjoyment of the novel. The author uses these differences effectively throughout this entertaining and satisfying novel.A copy of the novel was supplied to me at no cost by the publisher.

Sad. With the prestige of a strong tasteful press's reputation, one would expect better from any work, including a debut novel. The writing is problematical, the author's research is lacking in several important aspects and he is apparently unable to conceal his scorn for both the wealthy and the workers who live on the island. He has little patience for most other aspects of modern or historical American society.His murder victim is someone who, like Bernie Madoff, has managed to rip off nearly everyone he comes into contact with. He has zero redeeming characteristics. Unlike Madoff, he has alienated his entire family as well. There are a few people in the book you might want to hang out with for an afternoon beer, Chief of Police xxxx and his friend Fiona among them. Otherwise, if Axelrod is to be believed, the entire island, summer and winter is peopled by shallow, insipid careless people who squander natural beauty, sleep around and relentlessly steal from each other. But not in very interesting or clever ways.The plot is sufficient unto itself, and wraps up as it should. But the book is not entertaining, it depresses, and as such I cannot recommend it to any reader of crime fiction.

MJ Fields has done it again. Just when you think there can't be a better character then her last one she gives us Finn Beckett.Finn Beckett guitarist for the band STD has brought himself to a place where music is his thing the past he wants to keep there and too many memories he doesn't want or need to remember. When he meets Sonya there's something about her that pisses him off but also is totally turned on by her.Sonya a young woman just trying to make her life better for family has a lot of scars from her past and holding on to that anger will get you know where so what she needs to do is move on and in doing that it brings Finn right to her.If you can say love-hate relationship that is there's but insecurities is what's holding her back but Finn wants her to see that it can all be good.The chemistry between the two is off the charts but they have to go through a lot of bumps in the road to get where they are meant to be. This is just the next chapter in the life of STD but I'm staying on for the ride which I'm sure will be a hell of a lot of fun.

What an incredible ending to this seasons Rising Storm. Thunder Rolls couldn't be a better titleFor this episode. Everything is hitting the fan and lives are going to be ruined in its wake.What happens when secrets and lies are exposed the aftermath is bloody but what I can't wait for is more of this series.Dee Davis most definitely takes us on one hell ofA journey through Storm and what you can't help is the fact that you don't want it to end.Eight different authors have written each episode but  the flow of this series was incredible one you surely will not want to miss

This is a quick read but also a great read.The V Spot gives you everything Romance, Angst  even A Second Chance.Emma Masters a nurse is looking to have some fun for her 25th Birthday so she allows her friend to plan it for her what she doesn't expect his to find herself a blind date at a Voyeur Hotel.Brody "The Bull" Bullock Wrestler and sometime visitor to the hospital where Emma Works just so happens to be that blind date not by chance by choice.The attraction is their but Emma can't seem to believe he would give her the time of day no less date. You are cheering the two of them because even with their different physical appearance they definitely have everything else that would makeThem a great couple.

What can I say but Michele Shriver has once again given us another heartwarming story.This is the story of Brennan and Ashley who are going through some tough times in their marriage due to infidelity. Ashley doesn't know if she is willing to continue being married and that just doesn't sit right with her or even Brennan.It all comes to a crossroad when their daughter Hayley takes a fall off her horse and while she is recuperating her husband wants to come back home to help with her care and hopefully win back Ashley's love and trust.Hayley has only one wish for Christmas this year and it is for her family to be whole again. Can Brennan and Ashley try enough for their daughters wish to come true and it is the question that you are hoping ends up with a HEA.

This is the third and final part of this series and what we know is that sometimes past pains effect your here and now. Mally, Jess & Max have to come to some kind of arrangement but the three of them need to put in the effort for it to work.Mally wants this more but if the guys let fears and past problems effect their lives she just might have to leave them behind. What you are cheering for is that Max & Jess get their heads out of their asses and see what is right in front of them.

I have loved this series since episode one but this part was extremely touching. We find out that Byrce & Tara's son has been diagnosed with Autism and as much as Tara is trying to do all she can to help him her husband is in denial and the strain on their marriage is heartbreaking. Se watch them struggle and you are hoping they can find a way back to each other.Dakota is a woman scorned and we are seeing secrets start to fall about and I know I want to be there and watch and read where this all goes.This series is not only one you don't want to miss you are drawn in and all you can say is bring on the next one.

Just WOW is where you begin. S.C. Stephens has given us a book that will leave you with a hangover for days to come.Griffin has been a character in more ways than one since the start of this series. The cockiness, the I don't care attitude. And I'm a rock star so suck it up people is what you have seen. But with this book being Griffin's  story S.C. Has taken it to a whole other level. We see the struggles he has about feeling pushed into a corner and feeling not appreciated but what goes up most certainly must come down and it does in the biggest way.Anna, has grown ten fold in this story and by being the responsible one in this relationship she stands by him through it all and can't beMore encouraging of his dreams.Every relationship goes through ups and downs but this one comes down so far you wonder ifIt can be saved. As time passes you seeHow truly humble Griffin can be and needing his support system is amazing to watch.I have loved this series from the beginning but this book is definitely the cherry on top of the sundae.If you are a lover of romance, Rockstars, angstAnd everything in between this is not only the book you don't want to miss it's the series you don't want to miss either.

Just WOW the minute you meet Roman Steele you are totally drawn to him. He is as Alpha and Dominating as any man can get.Then we meet Sloane Keller World Champion Poker Player know as "The Queen of Cards" as shrewd as she is card playing she can't seem to find a man to keep her interested.With the help of FANTA-C she has an incredible night with the one and only Roman Steele but can one night be enough between the two.What you do feel when reading this book is his Domination coming right off the pages and Sloane is so caught up in it she thinks she might have found her match.If you are looking for a quick read that will have you turning the pages faster than you can read them this is the book you want to read.

Mia Villano brings us back into the lives of Isabella & Fabrice in the second part of this wonderful trilogy. The Ambassador and Isabella come out to the world that they are indeed a couple now and they must deal with everything that comes with that.Isabella is still dealing with her many issues when it comes to her ex boyfriend to family and just thinking she isn't good enough for Fabrice but what she doesn't know is that he will always be her biggest cheerleader.Fabrice also has many of his own ghosts to deal with but with Isabella at his side he finally feels that his life is complete again.They will most definitely go through many ups and downs and plenty of twists and turns and you will see many obstacles that get in there way but you are definitely cheering them on with every page turn. There will parts that will make you laugh out loud but there will be many times you will want to reach for that tissue.I know that when I sat down to read this book the next time I looked up was when I was reading the words The End and saying I need part three now. If you are looking for a story at times will be heartwarming, emotional with some angst this is the book that will take you on a very Romantic Ride.

Once Again Michelle Leighton draws us into a story from page one and the next time you are looking up you are reading the words The End.This is the story of Katie Rydale and Keifer Rogan.Two people who have gone through so much tragedy in their lives but come out Tougher and Stronger.There story starts off as heartbreaking but as you see their relationship grow it becomes heartwarming and you are cheering the two of them on.I love the way Michelle brings you right into her stories and you feel you are actually living it right alongside with her characters. If you are looking for a book that will have you grabbing for the tissues but will leave you with a smile on your face this is the one you want to read.

Katie Ashely takes us back to her beloved characters from The Proposition. We are taken forward a few years into the lives of Nat & Casey. Now happily married and with a new baby in their lives Casey is feeling there sex life is suffering and she will do whatever it takes to get it back on track. What we see is maybe trying to hard is not good. You will laugh out loud and you will see her go to her friends for advice. First is the douchnozzle Aidan their banter hilarious. Emma a little more serious and Megan just telling her try something new and of course Connor just shocked about the whole thing. This story even though it's a novella it's nothing short of perfect. Seeing these characters again is like coming home you can never have enough of there story and this one definitely puts a smile on your face.

This series just keeps getting better with each part. This is part six in the series and the lies, and secrets keep adding up a when the storm rolls in things are going to hit the fan and there will be no slowing it down. Relationships are developing but when lies are entwined what is going to happen. This series is like a soap opera in print and with the end of each episode all you want is the next one.I love that each part is written by different authors but the flow of the story is completely flawless. If you are looking for a series that will have you wanting more this is the one you want to read.

Once again Sawyer Bennett gives us another Hot Alpha Man to fall in love with and his name is Reeve Holloway. An attorney for one of the biggest corporate law firms is put in a case of malpractice and thinking he has an easy win little does he knows he up against the one and only Leary Michaels.Leary Michaels attorney for as she puts the downtrodden is so compassionate when it comes to her clients she pulls out all the stops to win.When Leary meets Reeve you can most definitely feel the chemistry between the two come right off the pages. Both passionate in the job but when that passion develops into more they are both walking that fine line and do whatever it takes to see if they can be just as lucky in love as they are in work.The two of them most definitely go through some ups and downs but what you are cheering for is not only the little guy but the two of them to find that happy medium and be together.Sawyer Bennett has given us another fantastic read and if you looking for a book that has everything from romance, angst and everything in between this is the one you don't want to miss.

What a fantastic new read from FL Jacob. Behind the Computer is a quick read but a read you don't want to miss.We meet Sawyer James Indie Author who is writing her next book and who happens to be at the gym and finds the perfect cover model for her new book.Caleb Allen a man at the right place at the right time meets Sawyer and things take off from there.The two of them start a "Business" relationship but the chemistry you feel coming off the pages makes you know their is more to come.One obstacle in all of this is Sawyer has a boyfriend Liam. Their relationship is starting to come to a head but can Sawyer make the right decision for herself and choose the right man.When I came to the end of this story all I said was WOW loved it and I'm definitely waiting for more.

Rick Steele can most definitely Catch Me. This is a Alpha Male with a heart of gold. A Dealer in Las Vegas and celibate by his own doing decides to take his chances at Fanta C and have a one night stand but what he doesn't realize is when he meets Tara Denton he is totally smitten.Tara Denton a young woman who is just starting to get her life back on track meets Rick and he totally turns her life upside down. You seeThe relationship develops over time for Rick it's to gain her trust and for her to become more independent and show herselfShe can be what she wants to be.If you are looking for a quick read but one that will leave you with a smile on your face this is the one for you

You begin by saying this was Fantastic,Awesome and Just the way the story needed to be told.Ansley, Cooper & Ryan three friends who have been through a lot together go through one of the toughest times together and come out on the other side three different people. Two of them finally realize and open their eyes to see what other people have been seeing for a long time and one person needs to see how life has changed and he needs to accept it and try to figure out howTo make it all right again.Ansley & Cooper have always had that spark but many different turns in life led them away from each other but also brought them back when the time was right and they needed one another on so many levels.Ryan has always been a part of the trio of friends and right now he needs to find himself again and see that things could be good again but it will take time and patience to get there again.This series of books takes us on a incredible journey of three friends that are always there for each other in good times and bad. If you are looking for a series that will have you wanting more with each new book this is the one series that will give you that and more.

Amazing,Incredible,Fantastic I can go on and on. Jenn Sterling takes us back to this incredible series but what we get is the way the story plays out in Dean's POV and WOW it totally is an eye opening one.Dean being the younger brother to Jack always has his back but when he meets Cassie everything changes but as there story plays out we see how the relationship between him and Melissa starts and how right from the start Dean is totally smitten.Not only is Dean there for Jack but you see how much he is there for Cassie as well he considers her a sister right from the beginning knowing Jack needs her just as much as himself, Gran and & Gramps need her in their family.I loved everything about this series fromBook one but what I have to say is that this book seems to complete the story. If you are a person who loves romance, second chances and everything in between you will not onlyWant to read this book but the whole series

An Anthology you will Not Want To Miss. MJ Fields gives you all The Steel Men, The Woman That Love Them and The Woman That Started It All Momma Joe.You get the beginning that started it all Jase & Carly and the amazing story of their relationship and the emotional rollercoaster that brought it all together.Then we meet Cyrus Steel personally my favorite and all the struggles he has gone through in his life but when he meets his "Birdie" things start to become a lot clearer that maybe two people who have gone through so much in their life will finally find the happiness that they both truly deserve.Then there is Zandor Steel one very Kinky loving Alpha Male that will most definitely have you thinking naughty thoughts but when he meets his "Kitten" his life most definitely takes a turn for the better and knowing that he might have found equal in life you want to see them get through whatever life throws at them and to be happy.What can I say about the Youngest Steel Xavier. He is the most stubborn of the four. A man who wants to find his own way and who wants to do it without the help of his brothers. Little do we know that it would be his Momma who finds that one person to help him along the way and her name is Taelyn "Irish" Patrick. Feisty should be her middle name she most definitely is Xavier's partner in business and life and the road to get there is an up and down one but one you most definitely want to be on with them and watch how they become one amazing couple.What can i say about Momma Joe the Amazing Woman behind these four amazing men. She has raised these boys to become the men you see today after tragedy strikes she steps up and can only be the strongest she knows how. We watch her take care of it all business, family but it's time to take care of herself and maybe find Love once again. Where it's least expected is right in front ofHer and his name is Thimas Higgins. Thomas comes into the Steel Family when Carly comes back to Jase and he is welcomed with open arms but as the years pass that attraction grows right before our eyes and when they both finally take that next step you cheer them on because you finally want the Family of Steel to be complete once again.I know I have said a lot but believe me I can go on & on about This Family and the Amazing Words that MJ Fields has created for us to enjoy for years to come so don't miss out on this incredible Anthology.

Once again I'm totally drawn to the town known as Storm Texas. The intrigue and the emotional angst in this small town is off the charts. So many secrets that can change the way certain lives and families will be affected but Larissa Ione has you on the edge of your seat with this installment of Rising Storm this is seriously like a soap opera in print with so many authors contributing to each part all different styles of writing but all creating one incredible series that you do not want to miss

There is a reason this is called Hot Holiday Nights because that is exactly what it is HOT.I have loved the Play by Play series since book one and I'm so happy Victoria has finally gotten her own story.Alex & Ben two gorgeous men catch Victoria's eye from the start of her vacation and what better way to spend her time.Alex a professional surfer and Ben his manager are just as turned on by Victoria as she is of them.The pages of this book are quite steamy right from the start but definitely one you don't want to miss.

I have been a fan of The Worth Series since the beginning and what can I say but Mara Jacobs has done it again.We get to meet again Twain Beck and his ex wife Liv Beck but what you expect from a divorced couple isn't true in their case.They each have respect for the other they love their son Matt fiercely and what Liv wants is Twain willing to give her.We are taken on an emotional ride between Luc and Twain and I have to say that I most definitely reached for the tissues more than once but what you feel coming off the pages is heartwarming at times but heartbreaking too.Can Liv and Twain get to a HEA that is the one question that you want answered because if any one deserves it it is the two of them.If you are looking for a series that will make you feel smile when you come to the words The End then this is definitely the seriesYou want to read

Just WOW is how you must start this review. j Kenner takes her us back into the lives of Jackson and Slyvia. We are taken on the most emotional ride. You have angst, intriguie, romance, and even fear.Jackson and Slyvia go through more than any couple have to endure but Julie has you on the edge of your seat and all you wish is that they find their HEA.

Move over world there is a new Rockstar in town and his name is Memphis Black and he is the lead singer in the new band called STD (Steel Total Destruction).Where do you even begin to describe Memphis but just Hot Ass Rocker, loyal son, loyal brother and loyal to his band mates and loyal to Forever Four where no other than Xaiver and Irish Steel has given him his shot at fame along with River,Billy and Finn. Four unknown up and coming Rockers who become an opening act for Burning Souls to becoming an headliner.One thing Memphis never new he wanted was always staring him in the face was his little sisters best friend but years later when Tallie Priest reappears in his life all grownup things just heat up and you can feel that chemistry coming right off the pages.Their story takes us on one hell of of a roller coaster ride but it's the ride of a rockstar and a good girl but it's also a ride you don't want to get off until you see it all played out.MJ Fields has given us some hot men to drool over but Memphis Black takes us to a whole other level and this is one band that will have you coming back for more

What can I say Jade knows how do write about Rockstars.In Vagabonds we meet the young and impressionable Kyle Summers new girl in town living with her parents who live a very carefree life. The one thing Kyle has in her life that makes her happy is her guitar and with that comes music and maybe a career.Kyle goes through all the teen angst first boyfriend and all that comes with that but when the opportunity to become part of an all girl band she jumps on the chance and that is where all the fun begins.We meet the other girls in the band Liz,Vicki,Barbie and Kelly each with their own story to tell but the music these girls make is fantastic and all they see is stars in their eyes.We meet Peter Cyrus the man who brings them together but what you see in him is a total creep factor and you want to know what is his deal is and you will sit on the  edge of your seat hoping he does right by these girls and not just mess them up.We do get to meet Siege (CJ) star of a new band Death Crunch but we see he takes a liking to Kyle but with that we will have to wait and see where their relationship might go.This book is going to be one hell of a ride from teenage dreams to reality but it's a ride your going to want to take to see where Vagabonds ends up.This is book one of three but when I was done reading this all I said is bring on book two

What can I say London Casey takes us back into the world of Back Down Devil and the word Intense is what you need to describe the Atmosphere inside their world.Emotions are high as everything they have worked for starts to spiral out of control but in their world Intensity and Fight are two words that are common in the MCNate a Patched in member is getting over the attack on him but things don't add up and when he sees where all this is coming from he tries to handle things along side his brothers.Mia a young woman who always seems down on her luck is just looking to make some extraMoney but when her paths cross  with Nate the chemistry is explosive but so is the situationLondon takes you are an incredible ride throughout this story but the emotion and angst has you on the edge of your seat and you are hoping that everything works out not only for the club but for Nate & Mia as well.

What can I say but Nina Levine has brought us back into the world of The Storm MC and one word says it all Incredible.We finally get to find out what Griff's story is all about and it is one hell of a story. Griff has a lot of demons in his closet and we see that relationships are no longer his thing and the only woman he truly cares for is his Aunt Josie who only wants what is best for him.There is a lot of turmoil in the club and with Griff past maybe coming back to haunt him you are sitting on the edge of your seat to see where it all goes.Then there is Sophia a woman looking for that one true relationship that she can truly find the love she never has growing up and to not have to worry about anymore heartaches or heartbreaks. Sophia is dealing with her own demons from the past and when fate decides to step in she brought right to Griff by circumstance.The chemistry between the two of them is explosive but each wanting something different you ever wonder if there will be that HEA that truly they both deserve.Nina takes you on one explosive rollercoaster ride of emotions and angst but is most definitely a ride you want to stay on until the very end. If you love everything that has to do with MC's , Romance and everything in between then this most definitely not only the book for you but the series you don't want to miss

Where do you even begin to write a review for this but by saying Incredible, Heartstopping, Edge of Your Seat, and Psychologically Thrilling.When we first meet Henry you know that this is going to be a book that will have you from the prologue and you will not put it down until you see the words The End.Henry is a married father of two girls and is a Best Selling Author who writes Psychological Thrillers and we see that is he struggling with his latest manuscript and needs to get away to write another best seller.Henry winds up in a town in Coastal Maine where he definitely becomes inspired but at what cost does this book get written. Their are many ghosts in Henry's closet and as we see things transpire through the writings of Henry's book.We get to meet many intriguing characters throughout this book, starting with Henry's Grandmother who is always there for Henry and we meet Henry's wife who is the calm of his storm. She will always have Henry's back and you are totally engrossed in her character who not only will do whatever is needed for Henry to succeed but will be there no matter what.I have to say that I loved this book hard I literally gasped at certain parts had to walk away at times because of its intensity but what I can truly say is do not miss it it will having you saying Elizabeth BRAVO.

Just WOW this series just gets hotter as it goes along. Abigail is really exploring her naughty side and who else would she do it with but Lukas Thorne. But the mysteries keep adding up to and I am ready to find out all the answers. Skylar definitely leaves you guessing about everything but you know you want so much more and you definitely will be coming back to see this rollercoaster of naughty play out

What can I say two great writers London Casey & Anna Fawkes have written a fantastic new book to start a Fantastic new series.We meet AJ a young woman looking for her way in life and after a upbringing that's not so great and having a sisters reputation to live with she just wants to be happy.Bryan a guy out with his friends trying to move on from a toxic relationship meets AJ in of all places a strip club but what he doesn't expect is how quickly he becomes protective of AJ and wants to get to know her.Their relationship is anything but normal but what's normal is the two of them healing one another and trying to be together but life will get in their way and what is a rollercoaster of emotions wil have you riding it with them until the end.This is only part one of their story and I know that I am looking forward to see where they go and what they are going to go through hopefully to finding there HEA.

Unfortunately Amazon only allows you to give 5 stars as a top review but there truly aren't enough stars for this book.This is book two in Cecilia London's Bellator Saga and the mystery,intrigue, edge of your seat in tenseness come at you with a force that you will leave you feeling Amazing.Caroline Gerard now First Lady of Pennsylvania and married to the Ultimate Man in the now Governor of Pennsylvania Jack McIntyre have seen what happens when the things in life you take for granted are taken away from you at such a force that you will do nothing to protect what you know is the truth and what you need to do for your family.This book is told back and forth from the past to the present but the ease that it is done has you on edge of your seat with a lump in your throat and tears in your eyes but also has you cheering on Caroline and Jack throughout the story.If you are looking for a book that will have you saying bring on the next one now this is the one you won't want to miss

This is the second book in Michele Shriver's Men of Ice Series a quick read that holds a lot of punch. We meet Nikolai Brantov a rookie from Russia who has the potential to becoming their star player but unexpectedly crosses paths with Meryl Johnson daughter of the owner.When the two meet the attraction is powerful you can feel it coming off the pages but Nikolai is trying to stay away from Meryl not wanting to jeopardize his career but Meryl will have none of that.Trying to keep her father from ruining not only her life but Nikolai's career can standing up to him bring them the HEA that they both truly are seeking?If you love Sports and Romance this is a series you will not want to miss and there is a lot more to come when it comes to this tea

Jenika & Sam do it again. Another Amazing Read.We meet Malcolm the ultimate Dom always looking to please his subs but holds back because the shifter in him is afraid of hurting that one special woman.Madison knows she has feelings for her Dom but she feels he is holding back and she wants him to be himself with her and let him know that she is not afraid of who he is and want a relationship with him and tells him to just be you.Malcom and Madison are not only the perfect D/s but they are perfect for each other she shows him to live without fear and he shows her that she is his mate and that they are just more.

What do you do when two people meet who are so right for each other but it doesn't seem like it ever will be the right time. That is Jack & Charlotte's story.Charlotte a successful interior designer who is recently tossed aside from the man she hoped to marry but "Fate" had other things in mind.Jack a sworn bachelor looking for the it's all about me right now life never looking for that special someone anytime soon.When Charlotte and Jacks's paths cross it is on one of the worst days of his life and the timing just does not feel right.Can two people who are so right for each other get to the point that "Fate" works in mysterious ways and they might just find that HEA that they both truly do deserve.If you are looking for a quick read that will bring you on a emotional ride and will leave you with a smile on your face this is the book for you

Where do you start but by saying this book is HOT I mean not only in the Firemen sense of the word. Travis & Cara have been together on and off for ten years and Everytime they get together it's even hotter.Travis has a relationship phobia due to losing his dad at a young age.Cara is looking for that relationship right down to the picket fence and dog.Can two people who are so right for each other see past the others issues and continue to try and be together because the chemistry that comes off these pages is down right steamy.

What can I say but this is the first story I read from James Hand but most certainly will not be my last. The story of Scott and Russell even though it was a quick read definitely holds a lot of punch.Two men, friends since college one having a incredible crush and other giving off the vibes that tells him to finally go for it. Unfortunately Tabitha is in the mix thinking that Russell was going to be her husband but when reality sets in the two men are meant to be together but is it too late.

An Indecent Arrangement has you meeting Max Burdanov & Jesse Kanatawa two men looking forward to a life of going legit after so many years on the wrong side of the law. To do that they need to look the part and doing so they need Mary Alice(Mally) to do that.Mary Alice is a young woman who works for Tristan & Adam but has met Max & Jesse through there business ties to them.What she wants is the two men but the feelings she is having is any thing but normal it is down right Lust.The opportunity to to see these two men appears when a friend is in need of her help and this is her chance to go after what she wants but when she goes to them the tables are some what turned and an arrangement is formed each having their own demands.Can the three of them really go into this with open eyes and let feelings get in the way all I know is that I can't wait to see where this very indecent arrangement will go.

What do you even say when you read a book like this, Incredible,Heartwarming,Heartbreaking,Fantastic,Awe-Inspiring and you can go on and on.I have loved the Assassins Series since book one but this book has just totally moved into a another category all in itself.The personal touches in this book could make you feel that Toni Aleo has put her heart and soul into Jordie's story at you can feel it with every page you turn.Jordie and Kasey's story will bring you on one emotional rollercoaster but it will be a ride you will want to stay on until the very end.Jordie know he wants to become a better man for Kasey and you are taken on his journey and you can't help sit back and cheer him on knowing that to get what he wants and deserves will take a lot of hard work.Kasey trying to get over Jordie knows that she never will so when the opportunity to see if second chances are worth it she takes that leap of faith.The support system in this story is incredible and the King Family are one family that every person would want to be a part of they make you laugh out loud but when things need to be serious they are right by Jordie and Kasey's side.If you are looking for a book that will leave you with the Biggest Sigh and maybe with the biggest smile you don't want to miss this one

Where do I even begin with this book the words Incredible, Fantastic and Completely Drawn in are just a few.We meet Isabella a young woman starting her career in a world where she always wanted to be. Working for the French Ambassador and leaving behind a life that wasn't what everyone thought she had. She always had a supportive family but some past secrets and scars had her looking else where for happiness.Fabrice Arbidoux the new French Ambassador gorgeous man and all around mystery but with so much intrigue to him you just want to find out all there is to know about this man.When Isabella meet the Ambassador all you can say is the pages become down right steamy the attraction between the two is Crazy but it is something you can't look away from and you feel like you are peeking into the window of their amazing new relationship.The relationship between the two is a rollercoaster of emotion,angst,mystery and even love. They must overcome a lot to be together but I know I want to be their to see it happen.If you are looking for a book that will have you sitting on the edge of your seat at times and having you swooning other times this is definitely a book that you will not want to miss.

Daryl Banner,Chelsea Camaron,Angelica Chase,MJ Fields,MX King and Ripp Baker know exactly what the word SIN means and his name is Simon Sin King of Porn.Simon Sin King of Internet Porn has been at the top of his game from the get go but the one thing that keeps him their is his lover,side kick and master mind really behind it all and her name is Sadi.Sadi who knows all about Simon from growing up with the creepy stepfather but who unknowingly leads her right to him.Sadie has dreams of being his queen but when life steers you in another direction you basically have to create what you want to make it happen and maybe it leads you right back where you started.As fate has it Simon tells Sadi all his Sins and she makes the decisions she does to create the life that she wants and she truly believes she deserves.This book is most definitely Naughty, and down right HOT and you definitely feel like you are at times a Voyeur watching and reading it through a window but one you definitely will not want to turn away from.

Where do you even begin to write a book that truly touches every emotion that you have.Not only is this Ally Derby's first book it most definitely will not be her last and I truly can not wait to see what more she gives us.This book every person young and old should read.The emotional impact this book definitely will have you thinking about the way people treat one another and what truly words can do.This is Hadley's story one that will take you on an incredible ride to show what one mistake people think you made can spiral so out of control that your life can change in a instance.Another incredible character is Pax not only does he see the real Hadley but also becomes her cheerleader and is always the one who tells her "Breathe" he is most definitely someone that you want in your corner who can help you right all the wrongs and stands by her no matter what.There is so much more to say about this book but I think everyone needs to experience it themselves and see that it will definitely show you never to take life for Granted.Granted. (less)

What can I say but another great book in Jaci Burton's Play by Play series.In All Wound Up we meet another Cassidy, this one being Tucker Cassidy the only baseball player among all football players within his family.Tucker is a recent addition to the Rivers baseball team and he has the pleasure of meeting Aubry Ross in a very unconventional way.Aubry Ross a up and coming doctor whose father happens to own the Rivers meets Tucker at a team party at her parents home.They might have met a time or two unconventionally but the chemistry is steamy from the get go and what you are hoping is that with the strains of both their careers they can make a relationship work.What they don't expect are hurdles tossed their way but with a little bit of faith you just hope they can find that HEA.If you are looking not only for a book but a series that will leave you with a smile on your face this is the one you don't want to miss

Summer Temptation is part of trilogy of Hot in the Hamptons Series and what a great addition it is.This is Leigh & Nick's story and what a heartwarming story theirs is.Meeting under circumstances totally taken out of context these two are brought together not only again by chance but by the ever loving Grandfather of Nick, Murphy ( who is awesome by the way).Leigh out to have one last summer with friends but finding out sometimes life throws you curve balls and then there is Nick recently let go from a job he loves but brought to the beach by the care he has for his grandfather.When the two meet again the chemistry is undeniable but can a summer fling really turn into more. If you love a quick read that has all the romance but with some twists and turns this is one you don't want to miss.

What can I say Michelle Leighton has done it once again. Where do you even begin to describe Jason King. The man is just down right all alpha dark dangerous and just someone you should be deathly afraid but under all that outer angst is a man who has dealt with far more pain in a lifetime then any man should.Muse Harper was raised by her Dad and was fiercely protected to the point that he would do whatever needed to be done for her. All Muse ever wanted to was a life as an artist but there was always something that made her always be aware.When Muse & Jasper meet under circumstances having to do with her Dad she knows he is all business but the attraction between the two is undeniable and you can feel it coming off the pages.When truths are found out life takes an incredible turn and we see how protective everyone becomes of each other but all you want is to see a HEA for the both of them because truly that is what each one of them deserves.

What can I say but a great start to this new series of novellas of Hot in the Hamptons.We get to meet three woman recently graduated from college to celebrate their last summer before starting their careers and adult lives.Summer Dreaming is Kelsey Mitchell story recent college grad and still undecided what she wants to do with her life and career.Then we meet local "Townie" Sean Dempsey lifeguard and as some call is the Hampton Hottie.When Sean and Kelsey meet the attraction is almost immediate and we see two people who enjoy each other think it's only an Summer Fling but fight the feelings for one another but as their relationship develops we are cheering them on for that HEA that they both truly deserve

What a great new Summer Read by Jennifer Probst. This is one part of a trilogy that will have you saying Summer just got better.Summer Sins has you meeting Storme Sullivan heir to her families vineyard and engaged to her lifelong friend Philip. Storme heads to the Hamptons for one last summer with her friends from college Leigh and Kelsey and to try and get her self excited for her upcoming wedding but what she thinks of wedding jitters might not be that at all.We meet Holden Fox a up and coming Wall Street Executive but not having to start for. Few weeks he heads to the Hamptons to spend time with friends what he doesn't anticipate is meeting the very Sassy Storme.The chemistry between Storme and Holden is off the charts that you feel it coming off the pages. Can two people think that a summer fling could be enough or does their paths lead them somewhere else. If you are looking for a quick and fun read these novella's will have you saying most definitely yes.

What can I say but Hardy and Rose's story was a long time coming and what a roller coaster of emotions their story is.Hardy and Rose have been married for 10 years and not all of them have been great you can say that their relationship was hanging on by a thread.Hardy made a terrible  mistake many years ago but now in the present Rose can not seem to let it go and with every right she is wondering if their marriage is worth even saving.Hardy will do what ever it takes to make all his past mistakes up to her to prove to her that he is the man that is suppose to be in her life.The emotion in this book will sometimes leave you with a lump in your throat and at other times will be so heartwarming that you will be cheering them on with every page you turn.This is book twelve in The Skulls Series but with every story you fall more in love with this MC and to see that each and every member truly deserves the HEA's makes you want to never see this end.

Once Again Karolyn James takes us into the world of one of the best bands around Willow Son.Colby lead singer for Willow Son is looking for a way to keep his band out there with no label behind them all he wants is to live his life by his rules but to keep making music.Tessa a drug rep just looking to always do the right thing in life and do the right thing when it comes to her sisters is just going along with life.As "Fate" will have it Tessa meets Colby in a hotel lobby when there eyes meet and the chemistry is just jumping off the pages.Colby & Tessa always seem to meet in different places as "Fate" would have it there is something there that can not be denied but past issues have Colby holding back on "Pretty Eyes" and maybe you just need to make your own "Fate" to see where life leads.If you love Rockers, Romance and little bit of everything in between this is another new series that you will not want to miss.

What can I say but Sawyer Bennet has done it once again. We first get to meet Wolfe Jennings in The Last Call Series brother of Tenn Jennings and one very sexy Cowboy. Wolfe takes over the business after his dad dies but his true passion is The Wicked Horse a typical western bar in front but Wolfe's passion in back a Kink Club which he starts with his best friend Bridger.What Wolfe never expects to see is a face from his past who was his best friend sister and she's all grown up now and her name is Callie.Callie comes home after living away for years and when she sees Wolfe again all those old feelings come right back again and when the two come together the chemistry is so Hot you feel it coming right off the pages.Wolfe and Callie definitely take a rollercoaster of a ride but all you hope is that there is a HEA at the end.

S.K. Does it again. We are brought deeper into the world of Jayd and seeing for the first time her experiencing the world of her hidden desires.What and Who brings it out in her Lukas Thorne but there is a deep rooted secret their some where that I can't wait to find out because the chemistry between the two is damn HOT.With each page turn you are brought into the world of BDSM not only by Lukas but by the mysterious Lorena and what is her secret part in all this I can't wait to find out but I'm sure it is one we all can wait to know.I

Vanessa Waltz does it again. We are once again brought into the war between the MC & Cravotta family and things are at a breaking point.Jack a man part if the Cravotta family looking to find the men responsible Fie killing his brother but he us do out of control he needs an alibi and that comes in the form of Beatrice.For the MC & the family too fiorm an alliance Beatrice is used as collateral and she is forced to marry Jack to keep him calm and out of jail.What we get is one hell of a rollercoaster ride not only between Jack & Beatrice but between the family and the MC. This is a book that will keep you on the edge of your seat and makes you want to turn the page just as fast to see where they all end up.

Karen Armstrong’s ST. PAUL: THE APOSTLE WE LOVE TO HATE is a fairly brief scholarly biography of the apostle Paul, the man to whom many of the Epistles in the Bible are attributed.  Armstrong’s work is quite frank.  She informs readers that some of the letters once thought to be Paul’s very likely are not; she points out that those letters that are more certainly Paul’s encourage equality and agape love, not the misogyny, anti-Semitism, and social elitism many see in some instances.  Also, when something about Paul is unknown, Armstrong frankly says so. Back matter lists seventeen pages of resources – the Bible and strong Bible scholarship – to support Armstrong’s claims.Even with all the scholarship, readers don’t have to be seminary students to read and understand this book.  Laypeople with some knowledge of Paul can read this and understand it, particularly if they're willing to read it at a "study" pace (my reason for four stars instead of five -- don't try to gulp this book down too quickly).  This work will help readers see the man said to be the first Christian writer in a new light, and thus see his writings in a new light.I would recommend this for Bible study classes or church libraries.

Do you like movies of the 1930’s, ‘40’s, and ‘50’s – or maybe even an old silent film from the 1920’s?  Then Adriana Trigiani’s ALL THE STARS IN THE HEAVENS is a novel you will enjoy.Yes, this a novel; it’s fictionalized.  But, closely following real events, it deals with real people from the Golden Age of Hollywood and all the power plays, adventure, and forbidden romance.  Loretta Young’s role seems to be the most prominent in this novel, but readers also see plenty of Clark Gable (of course, because of the maybe-not-so-secret-after-all romance between him and Young that resulted in the birth of their daughter), Spencer Tracy, David Niven, Carole Lombard, Myrna Loy, and many more prominent Hollywood people of that time.Readers begin and end with a frame story set on the autumn of 2000, where we meet Roxanne Chetta, the great-niece of Loretta Young’s assistant Alba and her scene painter husband Luca.  This framing is momentarily confusing, but it doesn’t take long to see where Trigiani is going.This novel kept me engaged throughout; I wanted to see what happened, or, if I knew, how Trigiani handles the particular event.  Movie buffs, do try this one!

Tracy Borman’s QUEEN OF THE CONQUEROR is a biography of Matilda, the wife of William the Conqueror.  Borman begins with Matilda’s defiant refusal of William’s proposal of marriage because of William’s illegitimacy, then her acceptance.  Readers see Matilda grow to become a very unusual queen for her time.  She was more than just a consort and producer of heirs; she actually ruled as regent many times when William was away.Because there are few primary resources about women of the eleventh and twelfth centuries, Borman does have to rely on what resources she does know and deem trustworthy (and many good ones are listed in the back matter).  The front matter consists of genealogical tables for both William and Matilda and maps.  Besides the resources (notes and bibliography), there is an index in the back matter.Borman gives us a reasonably good physical picture of Matilda, based upon tapestries and drawings—a small but capable woman, and William as very large for a man of his times, and, at times, temperamental.Though the style is very readable, even for non-historians, this is a scholarly work.  I would recommend it as supplemental reading for a history class studying eleventh and twelfth century Europe.

TEXAS INGENUITY: LONE STAR INVENTIONS, INVENTORS, AND INNOVATORS takes readers from the beginnings of Texas (Sam Houston) to Texas food and restaurants (Dr Pepper, Whataburger, Chili’s)  to entertainment and music (Buddy Holly, Van Cliburn, Selena) to sports and athletics (Babe Didrickson, Bill Pickett, the Kilgore Rangerettes).Obviously this book covers a broad spectrum of people of Texas, including some transplants; there is even a mention of Mary Lou Retton (actually born in West Virginia, but moved to Houston to study gymnastics) and her Romanian coach Bela Karolyi. The style is very down to earth, perhaps at times a little too conversational (a little disconnected) in places.  It is readable for both its intended young audience and adults. Each segment tells where to find out more about the person being highlighted, cites good, scholarly references, and offers readers at least one Texas Tidbit.However, there are instances when Elliott needs a good copy editor.  I spotted several confused words and some typographical and punctuation errors.  (When discussing Anthony Lucas, on page 28, did Elliott perhaps mean Croatian/Romanian, not Roman?) In my eyes, this took the author’s credibility down considerably. Particularly if students will use this book, it must be free of errors like these.Entertaining? Yes.Good reference for students?  Yes, with another good “cleanup.”Who I am:  I hold degrees in English and library scienceHow I came to own my copy of this book:  I purchased it at an event for local authors at the Fort Worth library.

The first thing most people will notice when their printer arrives is that it is slightly larger than most printers.  It will take up a bit more desk space, but I believe it’s worth it.  The ink receptacles are very large, so there are fewer worries about running out of ink at a bad moment. Also, the ink levels are very visible from the right side.  It is very easy to fill these receptacles, but the instructions encourage the use of gloves and protection in case of spillage.We found the instructions for installation to be well-written and clear (high five there!), but new users MUST allow about two hours or maybe a bit more for installation.  The ink receptacles take about twenty minutes to prime, and, of course, software downloads take some time.  We had NO installation problems, but, as I point out, some steps do take a while.I also like the way the paper feeds from the back and is quite visible.  Users can quickly see how much paper is ready to go.The printing quality is very good for both text and photos.  Text and images print out sharp and clear.This printer is a little larger and more expensive than some others, but I think it’s worth it.

This set of three terry kitchen towels arrived today, and I am impressed.  The size is fairly generous for kitchen hand towels, and the “hand” (feel), apparent durability, and absorbency of the fabric are all good.As is my habit with all kitchen, bath, and bed linens, I washed them with chlorine bleach -- something my mother, a nurse, taught me to do when she taught me how to do laundry when I was a teen.  The orchid dye did not change from the bleach, and I saw no apparent damage to the fabric.These towels would make a good gift for a housewarming or wedding or even for sending a college student off to his/her first apartment.

Evan, age 16, has just found his father Clifford dead of hypertrophic cardiomyopathy.  He was raised by his father because his mother left when he was about three years old. Evan finds a mysterious yellow book on Cliff’s desk –Kokoro-Jima, the Heart Shaped Island.Evan’s grandfather, Griff, arrives at Evan’s home after Cliff’s passing.  Griff is estranged from Cliff because Griff is a career Marine and Cliff was a pacifist.  Cliff fled to Canada during the Viet Nam era.  Evan and Griff really don’t know what to think of each other because they’d never even met.  Griff knows that Evan knows about the yellow book, but the older man really wants nothing known at all about it.Readers see three points of view in this novel.  Some of the novel is told from Evan’s point of view, the present day, in a suburban Anytown in Canada; some of it is told from the viewpoint of two soldiers who were stranded on Kokoro-Jima during World War 2:  Derwood, an American, and Ohiro, a Japanese .  Some parts seems surreal, and the readers – and the characters involved – wonder whether they are dreaming or something worse.  The writing style and some calligraphy make it very clear to readers where and when they are and in whose head.This is a well-written novel that tells three young men’s tales – and readers will see whether or not the wall between Evan and his grandfather comes down or stays up.

Three very promising students – Charlie, Georgia, and Alice arrive on the Harvard campus during what appears to be the fall semester of about 1997.  They come from varied and not-really-wealthy backgrounds, and sometimes “frenemies” would be a good word for their relationship, but they are there and ready for their college years.During their senior year, there is a murder on campus.  Julie Patel is found dead near her dormitory. The prime suspect is Rufus Storrow, a charismatic but seemingly eccentric faculty member.This novel shows the impact this murder had on these three students, not just at the time of the murder but ten years later, when the students from that class return for a memorial tribute to the slain student.This novel kept me engaged, but I didn’t really feel satisfied at the end.  It is a psychological thriller, not a mystery, and I was never really clear about who murdered Julie.  Also, I grant that college life can be all about experimentation with sex, alcohol, and drugs, but not all students are that way.I also wondered as I read why Kirman chose Harvard for her setting; she is a Yale/Columbia graduate, and Yale and Harvard, I understand, are bitter rivals.This is Kirman’s debut novel.  I see potential here, but this is perhaps a three-star piece of work.

Stephanie Smith’s 300 SANDWICHES is a mix of memoir and recipes.  Her boyfriend, referred to mostly as “E.” has promised her that he will marry her if she makes him three hundred sandwiches.The very idea that Smith would be willing to do such a thing could be off-putting to some readers; if E. really wanted to marry her, would he have her jump through hoops like that?  But I counter this by pointing out the price of the bridal ring set that Smith wants; many women would be happy with a more modest ring set.  So perhaps Smith is the winner there?  We’ll see.Smith also details other things going on in her life during the “three hundred sandwiches” period, in particular, her father’s terminal illness and her wish to have him escort her down the aisle to E.  Smith and E., like all couples, do have occasional quarrels, and sometimes readers might wonder whether Smith and E. might give up on the sandwiches – and the relationship.Though the narrative part has some strong points and some very weak points, the recipes that Smith shares are some that I like.  Though she lives in Brooklyn and would likely have fairly easy access to not-so-commonplace foods and ingredients, most of the ingredients in the sandwich recipes are available at most supermarkets.  I will look the recipes over again and try some.If you liked JULIE AND JULIA, this is a similar work.

Consider the world of TO KILL A MOCKINGBIRD about twenty years later. Jean Louise (Scout) is in her twenties; Atticus is in his early seventies; Jem has died; Calpurnia has retired.  GO SET A WATCHMAN is set during the beginning of the Civil Rights movement.Jean Louise comes home to Alabama from New York City.  She learns a lot about her beloved father Atticus and isn’t happy about some of the things she learns about him.  Is Atticus really a bigoted anti-hero after all, or is he a product of his times?  As Jean Louise struggles with this question, readers must as well.The characters are consistent and well-developed; I can easily imagine the adult Jean Louise as the little Scout in MOCKINGBIRD.  The style of WATCHMAN is, of course, similar to that of MOCKINGBIRD, but told through an older Jean Louise’s eyes.  Readers will need to hang on a bit with the narrative; it isn’t linear but has flashbacks to Jean Louise’s and Jem’s high school days – and mischief they found during those days.Though this novel definitely kept me engaged, I must hold at a very high four stars because when I realized that Atticus was in his seventies with Jean Louise in her twenties, I thought, “What? That’s an awfully late fatherhood!”  The reasons for Atticus’s late start toward marriage and parenthood are mentioned during the course of the novel, but I still feel that it would have been even better if Atticus hadn’t been nearly fifty by the time he fathered Jem and Jean Louise.I would strongly recommend (re) reading MOCKINGBIRD before reading WATCHMAN, and I see both as classics.

Young marrieds Stan and Charmaine once had good jobs and good lives and were happy.  However, a severe downturn of the economy took from them almost everything they had.  They are jobless, living out of their car, and targets for roving gangs of young people in the same or worse straits.  They hear of the Positron Project and a place called Consilience that could give them hope.  But there are some major catches:• Media is highly censored in Consilience; residents can pick up only movies and TV from the 1950’s.• Residents live in homes similar to standard suburban cookie-cutter homes and must abide by strict rules.• Residents may never leave Consilience.• Residents of Consilience spend one month in the suburban type homes, then one month in the local prison, with the first of each month the date to change over.• During the time the residents of a home are in the prison, there are alternate residents; the families are never to meet each other.Considering what the outside world holds, these sacrifices don’t seem to be too much, but, for Stan and Charmaine, there are entanglements.
