I used this to make a custom lamp out of a piece of black walnut I purchased on ebay. The kit worked fine and I ended up spray painting it to give it a oil rubbed bronze look. It does not come with the rod that usually houses the wire inside the lamp. I was able to pick it up at home depot in the lamp section.

Works great. I was using it to block the banister so my rabbit would not try to jump off the landing. It's very clear and does not look bad (well the zip ties don't exactly look great but the plastic is clear).

These cost so much more in the stores. Great value for the money. I have been using them probably 5 months and they are still holding on with a huge amount of weight in dirt. Make sure you line the baskets with something. I used our compactor bags folded up with holes punched in it.
My kids love this game and it is one of the few games they can play without me constantly having to get them unstuck.

I got this for my 4 and 6 yr old to play. They are probably on the young side but most of the time we can figure out what needs to be done. They cannot play this by themselves as they get stuck too often. A couple times even I could not figure out what we were missing to get into the next room, advance to the next level. Luckily I found a website where the guy plays through the game so we can get unstuck ([...]If you are a big gamer you may have an easier time with this but for us at times it gets difficult to figure it out. If your kids are in this age range just be prepared to play it with them and at times have to calm down really frustrated kids when they cannot perform the actions as required. In all the kids like playing it and they have a fun time with it.

I bought 2 of these and both times my rabbit peed of them. I actually have the one now hanging on the wall next to the bunny litter box since he seems to think he needs to pee by it I figure that will encourage the box usage. He never really chewed or laid on it, just wanted to pee on it. It makes sense because this pad is essentially similar materials to his litter box food (hay/grass) where he pees while he eats. On the rabbit forums I have found that I do not have the only bun who pees on these mats so if this is a new product for your bun just keep your eye out for accidents.

I bought this as I do a lot of baking with coconut flour. I filled up gallon ziplock baggies and keep the flour in the freezer. It does not stick or clump when frozen so this method allows me to buy coconut flour really cheap! I think it ended up filling 5 or 6 of the gallon baggies. If you have freezer space get it!

I am actually using this as a liner for my rabbits indoor pen. It is definitely waterproof and thick. I can't speak to the mildew aspect but for my needs it is working great and is much heavier then the typical store liners at Walmart.

1:20 MinsNOTE: this video was done on my cell phone and something went funny on the audio at the beginning. I am not possessed.Ok, now the review: I love this product but my 6lb rabbit barely fits through it in the tunnel shape. At the correct width (he is not overweight) it is not nearly tall enough to be comfortable for him. He will squeeze through it to find his food but would never sit in it by choice. He LOVES tunnels so I ended up putting wood blocks underneath the sides to raise it up higher and he likes it much better now.

I am using these in my 10lb indoor rabbit pen just incase he has an accident. While he was litter training he would have 1 accident a day so these pads were amazing to keep the mess contained and they wash really well (I hang dry most of the time though). Only one time did the pad leak and that was when the bunny peed near the corner (they pee a surprisingly large amount just a couple times a day just for reference). If the accident is farther inward on the pad it has no issue containing it as it absorbs away from the impact spot in all directions and keeps the moisture in the pad.I don't know if I would use one of these exclusively to protect an expensive mattress. I did consider getting a large one to use on my potty training sons bed but I would still put those cheap plastic liners underneath just in case. When is came down to it I can get the "Wet-Stop Twin Waterproof Mattress Cover" which I have used many times before and it works really well and covers the entire bed for just a few dollars more than the large whelp pad.In all I think this is a great product and it does work well however if the accident is near the edge it may leak so I would get one much larger then you think you need especially if it is going on a bed and may move around under the sheets. If you are using this for a small dog or new puppy this is such a great option vs. the disposable puppy pads.

I bought 2 of these in 2011. I just now finally had to throw the second one out. Eventually with light washing the plastic bottom starts to rip. I do keep one of those cheap plastic liners under this pad just incase but I think only one time did it actually go through to the plastic liner underneath. In all I am very happy with the product and for the price I think it is worth it even if it only lasts 2 years. I am on today to buy replacements.

Please do not buy this for a rabbit unless you plan on giving them LOTS of time outside of it. This is way too small for a bunny to be in for extended periods. Your bunny should be able to take 3 full hops in their cage. You can make a very good size pen/condo with the wire cube systems/exercise pens for less money than this (search C&C / nic cages or xpen for bunnies).
I need to get more of this stuff already. Very happy with the size, price and quality. I recommend this to anyone looking for a reasonably priced coconut oil.
This is perfect for wii Mario kart. The kids love it and it works great. I would recommend this to a friend.
I looked online for a wool fireplace rug and they were much more expensive. This one is nice and thick, feels great, neutral color and the perfect size. We are VERY happy with this purchase.

The thing is not 100% accurate. It is a few ounces off so I am not very pleased with that. The instructions say it can be calibrated using the correct tools which I don't have and am not going to spend more money to buy. I guess you get what you pay for. It is ok to get an idea on kitchen measurements but should not be used for exact weights unless you can calibrate it.
I use these to send home made frozen smoothies for my kids lunch. They are a little big for my kids (4yrs/6yrs) as they always come back only 1/2 - 3/4 eaten. They do not leak!
Love these, use them for freezing soups to put in my kids lunch. No problems so far and I would recommend them to others.

I have 2 sets of these that I use for my kids lunches every day. They are wearing out and I am not sure if I will get an entire year out of them but even still, they are worth the price. One of them did crack in the corner of the small compartment but my kids are also young (4yrs/6yrs) so I think they may be a little rough of them trying to get them open. They never leak between the compartments!
My kids love these however the small 2 prong animals are not the best at picking up stuff. Overall I recommend them.
Love these for my kids lunch. They keep cold for a long time. They will sometimes leak if the flip top is not closed. Will buy them again!
These work great and I am happy with them so far. Have used them for cutting up cheese and some soft veggies. My kids LOVE to get these shapes in their lunch.
I use these in my kids lunch box. They are cute, and the kids enjoy them however I can only use them with certain foods as wet/slippery things (cut up fruit) will sometimes slide right off of them.

I use these for muffins but also for holding snacks/small bits of food in my kids bento boxes. A few of them have stained but overall I am happy. These work so much better then the paper cupcake holders for baking.
Very quick shipping. Good quality, they look really nice. They are the perfect size for a 4-13yr old. My daughter just loves them!

I use these in my daughters lunch box to make her food a little more exciting. I stick them in her cut up fruit or sandwiches every so often. She really likes them and they are perfect for his purpose. Would be great as cupcake toppers as well.

I received this product for free from BzzAgent and was asked to provide honest feedback. My son who is 4 was so excited when this arrived and could not wait to play it. We popped in the bot and started to play and although the graphic quality is not horrible it is not the best either. My son is used to playing games on the Wii so the difference in quality is significant. That being said the games are short but fun. He really enjoys playing this for short periods of time. It is a bit repetitive but holds his interest long enough for me to get some chores done. I find he had no trouble using the controller although it is not 100% responsive all the time. The game requires batteries and cannot be plugged in. On one hand it is a bit of pain to have to use batteries but on the other hand the game is small and since it does not require an outlet we can bring it in the van for play on the go with our dvd player. In all I would say the game is fun and great for those around 4yrs old however the price may be a bit high for what you get. If your child has not experienced video game systems yet then I would definitely give this a try.

This movie is AWEFUL. The cat's voice is the most irritating I have ever heard in a cartoon. The story is just bad and some of the content was not ok for my little ones. Half of the time they had no idea what was going on. They could not follow this at all. I have 3 kids 6yr and under and they all did not like it. We ended up turning it off half way through. I for some reason was thinking this was in line with the shrek movies and it is not. Save yourself the money and skip this one!

They look pretty and for the first second tasted ok but then all the sudden as you chew you start to get a really strange after taste. I am doing a high protein low carb/sugar diet and the taste of these make them not worth the calories/carbs that they do contain. I am pretty realistic and don't expect them to taste like a regular chocolate cookie and usually don't have a problem with bland diet food but I am sorry, I just cannot eat these. I ate one and will be trowing the package away. Oh well, off to find something else.
I had this sitting in my order queue for 2.5 weeks waiting for it to ship and just today I was out at Walmart and found it for just over three dollars!

I have 12 of these in my house. I expected at least one to have a defect but all 12 worked perfectly! I even dragged one of them off the counter by mistake and it fell to the tile floor and the bulb smashed but the light is still working just fine. I looked at all the different window light options and at first wanted the LED battery ones but after looking at all the ones available decided not to get them for the below reasons.1. From all the reviews I have seen the LED bulbs either come in organge (think halloween orange) or white (LED super bright harsh white). I did not want orange lights. These plug in look so much nicer and the light color is closer to an actual flame coloring. This was probably the most important difference for me. I did not want halloween orange lights.2. From all the reviews it appears the battery lights are not as bright. I live on .5 acre and am set away from the road. My neighbor across the street who is at least 300 ft away from me commented on how nice and bright the lights are.3. I thought that battery ones would be easier but after researching it I found that is not exactly the case. It seems most of the LED have timers but you have to set the timer based on when the light is initially on. People commented that they would have them all set (if you have a lot you need to work quick to set them all together as they have to be set individually). Once it came time to change batteries you have to try to get the new lights in sync with the old ones. With these plug in lights they have a light sensor and automatically come on when it is dark and turn off when it is light.4. Some people commented on the batteries in the LED's only lasting 1-2 months for the AA and 3-4 months for the C kind. I did not want to bother with having to change batteries since I am running 12 lights. I like that I just plug it in and leave it.5. I thought it would be cheaper to use the batteries but after calculating the cost I found it would cost me $3.00 to run all 12 lights 12hrs a day for a month. It would cost me around $9.00 to run the LED's (assuming the 2 C batteries in each would last 4 months). So it was cheaper for me to get the plug in ones.So in review: If you are looking at these vs. LED-The color of these are much nicer unless you are going for that LED bright white or orange-They are brighter (according to folks who own LED battery ones)-They are easy, plug it in and forget it!-They may be cheaper depending on your electricity rate and what cost you can get batteriesObviously I have not owned the battery led but went through every model I could find and looked at every review (both good and bad) and this is the information I found.Overall I love these and am VERY happy with my purchase. I will probably leave them on all winter as I love the way they look. They are bright so if you need complete darkness while you sleep they might not be for you. I have them in my bedroom and my sons and we have no issue with them on while sleeping. Yes, they are light weight but I just added a little bit of masking tape to the base and they sit fine.UPDATE: My neighbor got battery LED ones this year and standing on the street looking at them side by side mine are much brighter. Still very happy with these although I do seem to lose 1 each year. When I pull them out in November 1 will be nonfunctioning. Considering the price I am still very happy and just replace the broken ones. If you plan to put these in your bedroom be warned they are on the bright side. They are nightlight bright. We just close our curtain (making sure the curtain is not touching the bulb).
This was much bigger then I expected. Our utility sink is open (does not have a cabinet) so it worked ok but the plumber had to bring the sink away from the wall a lot to make this thing work.

I got these to go on a wreath that hangs on my front door. I was hoping the gold would be more like the old christmas light color but it is really gold so if you are trying to match don't bother. Also, I was expecting the wire to be able to cover the entire wreath but it is way too short. The wreath is medium - large size. Not huge so I guess I expected 1 length to do the job. I would have to use 2 strangs to cover it enough and did not want to bother with it.

I used these outside on our bushes for Christmas and they were great. After being outside for a month I packed them up and stored them for next year. This November I pull them out (2nd season) and probably 4 of the 8 strands needed bulbs replaced. Also, with one bulb out half the strand will not work. I thought the bulbs would last longer then one season (1 month outside then storage). Oh well.

These are great for travel. I keep a pouch in my car and another in my diaper bag. They cover a lot of the seat but the opening is large enough that my son will actually use them. He is terrified of the covers that are in the bathroom because the hole is not big enough and he feels like he will miss it!

I love this belt. Works really well as long as the pants have loops close enough together (standard style). Love that my son can still get his pants off himself to go potty without his belt getting in the way. Great buy, would get again.

I have 3 young kids so my driod gets dropped often. So far this thing is keeping my phone safe. I even had it drop screen down from a full size pickup and it was fine. Does add a little bulk but my phone is so thin it really is not a big deal. I am a female and can still easily put my phone in my back pocket and don't feel it at all when standing/walking. I would purchase this again.

I got this for my son who at the time was just 3yrs old. The fast speed was too quick at first but it did not take him long to start using it. My daughter who is almost 6 loves it as well. We use it on the road and on the grass (hills as well). My son will get stuck about once a week on it but usually he is going up a hill and stopped at the bottom. If he does not stop it goes up hills pretty well. Holds the charge for a week with regular use. Very easy to recharge the battery. Overall I am very happy with this and would purchase it again.Good for ages: 3yrs - 6yrs (I am sure a 7-8yr old would have no trouble with it)Pros:-large enough for kids to use it for a few years-Slow and fast speeds as well as reverse. Simply click the button to back up.-pretty good turning radius compared to the power wheels pickup truck we own-battery life is pretty good, kids get a lot of use out of the charge-lots of fun! goes well on grass (even with hills)Cons:-wheels are pretty loud on the road which is typical with plastic wheels but because of the big tread these seem really loud. I have to remind my kids to stick close because if they get too far ahead the wheels are so loud they cannot hear me yelling. Also, hard to hear cars approaching from behind with the wheel noise.Not an issue on dirt/grass.UPDATE: It is now 9/25/2014 and this thing is still charging and running like a champ. It gets a lot of use and the back wheels are cracked (well one has a large hole actually) but it still plugs along. This was worth every penny!

Got these for my daughters bedroom wall and am very happy with the purchase. Colors are vivid, sizes are perfect for a bedroom. My daughter was able to put most of them on herself. They have been up for over 6 months and still holding strong.
Got this as a replacement cord and it worked just like the one that came with the laptop. No complaints. Price is good.

I am happy with this purchase. The size is perfect for school or travel. We actually purchased this for our NJ to CA trip so our 5yr old daughter could help carry some of the carry on stuff (we were traveling with 3 very young kids and car seats). It would be too big for her to use for school but she was able to roll it around the airport no problem. It has a lot of compartments for storage. Good buy for the money.

I am really happy with this gate. It takes some time to get it tightening perfectly to swing shut correctly but once you get it right it does the job. The opening is more narrow then my last tension gate and it is also taller so going through with a very full laundry basket is a little more difficult. I am 5'8'' so I just lift the basket up and over the gate but since it is so high someone shorter may have issues with that. The top of the gate (straight side parts) comes up to the very top of my thigh. The gate at it's highest point is at my stomach. I have a 115 lb dog and young kids and this gate works well for both. My doorway is about 1.5 times as wide as a normal doorway and it works just fine. Looks really nice and I got compliments on it from family which I never did with our white gate.

I have two pear trees the slugs were destroying. I put this down in the evening one night then the next night I could not find any slugs anywhere. Seems to do the job really well! I had no issues with birds taking away the bits but I also put it out at dusk.
We used these for VBS week on the little kids and they stayed put well. Since they were on 2-4yr olds I can recommend them for anyone!
We used these for VBS week for the little kids. They held up all morning on 2 -4 yr olds so I can recommend them!

I got this for my daughters wall and am happy with the purchase. It came quickly and also included 2 small decals with the same name which I was not expecting. The decal is VERY easy to put on. It is more of a wall sticker then the decals I have used in the past. You just feel off one side, place on the wall, push it down and slowly peel the back paper off. Very easy, I did it by myself. Letters are big and very well made.

I purchased these to put into a big mason jar filles with pincones. The jar is actually one of those drink dispensers so I pulled out the pouring piece on the bottom/side (this became the back) and fed the lights through the hole. These lights do not have a connection on both sides. They plug into the outlet and that is it. NO CONNECTION for other lights on the other end. This is what I wanted as I only needed one set of lights for the jar and didn't want a plug sitting in view on the top. The color is very similar to the old christmas style lights. I have the glass jar completly closed and after having them on for a few hours they are not warm at all. Works great for my use.

My kids are 18mo, 3 yrs and 5yrs old. They all LOVE this book. We actually picked it up at a garage sale and the mouse was missing but the back cover gives a template for making a new mouse which is really great! I decided to give this as Christmas gifts this year for those who have young children. The story is about a mouse trying to find food in the house and he slips through slits in the pages to get from one area to another. My 5yr old always wants to work the mous and usually is able to do it just fine on her own. Some of the slots are easier than others but all in all she really enjoys it. The content of the book is fine for someone who is concerned with that. Nothing that would make you cringe like other childrens books. Great buy, worth the price in my opinion. I have heard that this one is better then the squirell book.Good for ages 1-7Pros:-Very cute, kids will LOVE it.-Different from any other book we have-Gets the kids interacting with the story while moving the mouse around-Easy to make a new mouse when it gets lostCons:-Can’t  think of any! The price is high for what I would normally spend on a childrens book however I feel it is worth it.

I use this in the kitchen to dispense dish washing liquid and I LOVE it. I use a scrub brush so not having to put the dish down to pump the liquid out onto the brush is really nice. I have used all sorts of dish liquids in here without a issue (dawn, store brand, method). It is really nice to just stick the brush under the sensor and have it dispense the soap. It holds a lot of liquid so I don't have to refill it often. It has a control to change the flow to more or less depending on your needs. I highly recommend it and am giving it as christmas gifts this year.

These look nice however they do not absorb water. The water sits in a puddle on top of the wood. They hold the water ok however I was expecting them to absorb it not just let it sit on the surface. So far I have only used it with a plastic cup but I imagine because the glass is sitting in the water you have a good chance of drips when you pick up the glass. I had the stone ones and they absorbed the water much better. The other issue is these will fit the standard dinner glass however I tend to use a wider beer mug type glass (with a handle) and the glass will not fit on these because of the lip. Also, these do not have a soft bottom (felt/cork) like others I had. It is all wood so I am concerned they may scratch my tables. I decided to keep them anyway since when company is over I give them the normal drinking glasses. I still have one stone coaster I keep for my oversized glass.

The instructions that come with the product do not match the doctors or patient instructions from the manufacture. 15% should be worn for 4-6hrs and not overnight. Only the 10% is supposed to be worn for 8-10 hours or overnight. Not sure why the instructions don't match but wish I had read the manufactures instructions first! Left it on for 8hrs overnight and my teeth are sore today.

I just ordered 2 of these light strings. The lights look good right out of the box however one of my sets was missing a metal pole to stake it into the ground, the solar panel was missing the protective film, the panel itself looks damaged and the plastic covering is moving around in the casing (the other one does not do this). I have two sets so I can easily compare them and the way they were packaged. I contacted the seller about my missing part and my concern that the one panel looks damaged. He kept saying they would sent me the missing pole and that I have a yr warrenty on the lights so if they stop working to call them and they will send me a new set. I told him I wanted a product that was in new condition right from the start and could they just take back the damaged looking one and send me a new set but they refused. My concern is the casing does not seem tight and I think these things are going to stop working as soon as some water gets in there. Also I have no idea if this thing is used as the protective film is missing the panel is scratched up. I am going to hang these so I really don't feel like putting them up only to take them back down in a couple weeks. I am a bit annoyed that they would not just replace the one set. Anyway, the lights appear to be pretty bright considering they lit up right out of the box. Hopefully these things truly have a yr warrenty...guess I need to confirm that now before I get stuck with a dead product. Customer service is NOT GOOD....UPDATE: I changed this to 5 stars because I am just now having to order a new set as one set just stopped working. I ordered 2 sets originally May 2012. I live in Northern NJ and they have been wrapped around a arbor since then through summer and winters (solar portion buried under snow). The one set is still going strong and the other just finally died. It was the one that I was concerned about to begin with but honestly I never expected either set to last this long under NJ weather. Money well spent.

I am not sure why the other person had such a horrible experience with their Aosom. I bought mine 3/2010 and the trampoline mat and frame are holding up great. We leave ours fully assembled year round and we live in Norther NJ so we get hot summers (sitting in full sun) and snowy winters. The pad is not holding up well however we did leave it sitting out for 2 winters. The plastic is cracking and the skirt was never really long enough to keep it from creeping up. I felt like I was pushing the skirt down more then I would like. The net also needs to be replaced this year as we tore a hole in it while shoveling 10 inches of snow off the mat. The springs, frame and mat all seem to be holding up really well. I would not expect to get 3 years out of the netting or pad but I think that is a fair timeframe. My three younger kids (under 5) and myself (160lbs) use it all the time. We had a few parties and had multiple teenagers on it at once. I am VERY happy with our trampoline. I wish the outer spring mat and net would have held up better but I understand if you leave them out year round they don't last long. I would purchase again.UPDATE - 2/15/2015This trampoline is still going strong. The replacement outer mat/net is holding up well. The net did get a few small holes but I use fishing line and sew it back together which gets me at least another year out of it. Considering we bought it in 2010 and leave it up year round in full sun and snow I am very impressed. The frame, springs and trampoline mat are all holding up very well. I would absolutely buy this again. Best money spent!
So simple but works so well!  Holds my phone securely allowing me to be handsfree  It fits both our cars well and I like that it rotates for my GPS app.  Definitely recommend.

While the company was great and returned my money, this whistle was completely useless.  I worked with it for a few days and couldn't get either of the dogs to respond.  I re-read the instructions and adjusted the whistle, blew so hard I thought I'd pass out, waited for the dogs to sleep, got really close, stood farther away.  Nothing happened.  Back to the drawing board!!

I loved the book and love the movie.  It's rare that a movie really reflects the book well, this one does.  I watched this with my teenage daughters and they loved it as well.  The early civil rights movement from the perspective of maids in Mississippi is very unique.  We talked a lot once the movie was over and my kids were shocked that this sort of treatment of people took place not so long ago.  Anything that keeps the conversations going is worth my time to watch.  Helping my kids understand the world they live and why certain things are considered a big deal is important.  They are growing up well after the events in the story and are sometimes confused by racial divides.  There is good in that because that means it's not as prevalent today but understanding our history is essential to avoid repeating it's ugly parts.  This is a great way to glean a fresh perspective on a recent time period in our country.

This is the only detergent that works in our new dishwasher. Everything else I've tried makes my dishwasher smell funny, weird, I know but true.  These are convenient, no more trying to pour the powder into the tiny soap dispenser and spilling it all over the place and hoping suds don't come out the sides of the dishwasher as it runs.  The price here on Amazon is good.  I recommend trying these out!

This is my second pair of these.  I think they are cute and they certainly are comfortable.  I can wear them all day and my feet don't get sore.  I prefer this style to flip-flops as I hate the thing between my toes.  They are crocs so it's an entirely rubber shoe.  Not very dressy but great for most summer styles.  I have worn them with trouser jeans out to dinner and they looked great.

I really like this.  It dispenses a very small amount of soap but that's what I wanted.  My kids do the dishes now and we can go through a bottle of Dawn in a week.  I get it, the bubbles and foam are really fun to play in the pictures of them up to their ears in suds are great, at first.  I found this online and have been very happy.  It looks nice.  We have OXO brush holder stand and this fits perfectly on the spot for the soap dish.  It dispenses enough to wash a few dishes, doesn't drip, and is really easy to use.  I like that the bottom is clear so I know when it's time to refill.

We have 2 bedrooms that are really hot in the summer.  I bought one of these to try a few years ago and was very happy with the results.  One reviewer suggested removing the fan cover on the underside to increase airflow.  We did that modification and it made a huge difference, it also reduced the amount of noise the unit produced.  I understand why it's covered but having that extra grate for the air to run through does reduce the overall airflow.  The lights on the unit bothered one of my kids so I just stuck a piece of duct tape on it.  Overall, it's worth a shot to see if it will help make that one odd room more comfortable.

We love this peanut butter!  Just wish I could get a larger size!  I buy it because we avoid hydrogenated oils but love peanut butter.  I have fantasies of making my own and being that all natural mom but reality hits as I look at the clock.  I'm grateful for a product that I can feed my kids with out all the extra gunk they don't need.  This tastes great and has a great consistency verses other natural peanut butters.

My son was so happy with this cute tooth pillow!  The pocket is a bit smaller than I expected but has plenty of room for a tooth and some money.  It's a well made stuffed toy with nice quality fabrics. We were happy to find something masculine for my little guy as he starts having fun encounters with the tooth fairy!
Zyrtec works for me but I have switched to the generic version to save money.  We now have 3 people who use this and we've found the generic to be just as good and far less expensive.

I don't see how these get such high ratings!  They worked fine for one day.  Since then, even though they are stored horizontally as recommended, they don't work!  I have to shake and press the point down for a bout 5 minutes to get them to even make a streak.  Total waste of money, very frustrating!

I love these!!  I switched to glass nail files years ago but had to keep replacing them because they would break.  These little cases are perfect!  The files are nice and now I can safely keep them in my purse without worrying about accidentally smashing one.
Great for on the go snacks.  Keep these in my purse for the kids.  They all love them!!
They're crackers.  They're good.  My kids love them.  Need I say more?
Just okay.  I like the deoderant, don't love the smell.

The picture makes it look like a pump bottle.  I really was hoping it would be because it's much easier than the bottles you have to pick up because they get slippery and drop in the shower.  Or maybe that's just me!  ;)  Nonetheless, I really get annoyed when the pictures and product aren't the same.  The conditioner is great - soft silky hair.  Just wish it was a pump bottle!
A staple in our house.!
We like cottonelle but this is not the best price. Convenient through amazon pantry but not that great a price.
Just yummy!
Yummy!  I buy these for my kids to have on the go.  We are out between activities and someone is always hungry. These  are great to keep in my purse for just such an occasion.
We like these vitamins but for this size package, better prices exsist

Fell apart in three months!  I have a similar cart that was another brand that is still going after 6 years of use.  Never would have thought that this would be so flimsy! It finally broke while I was walking to my car spilling the contents all over the road. My other one can handle being pulled carefully up and down steps, I tried that with the Qube and it swayed and pulled so much I ended up carrying it.  Total junk!!

The first one I got didn't work at all. I called the company and they sent a new one.  Great.  All is well for about 2 weeks then the second stops working.  Not worth the constant hassle.  Save your time and money and find one that actually works!

I was skeptical of the reviews because they were all written in May 2014 and were all raving about this thing.  I decided to buy it because I like the look.  My first impression, it looks cheap, not something I want in my living room.  With that said, I filled it with  water and some orange essential oil and it definitely diffuses the oil.  The light is weird to me and I won't use that feature, maybe if I end up putting it in a kids room for night light.  I will update.  There is just one big reservoir for the oil and water that is connected to the motor so cleaning will be a pain.  You can't submerge it, just wipe out.  This also means the oil sits on plastic not ceramic, which for a lot of people is a concern.  For the price, go with something else.  I'm not sure if I'll keep it, I find it's appearance disappointing and know for sure I could get something better for this price.

We've spent so much time playing with this! Who would have thought that this little toy would be so entertaining!  Everyone in the family likes it and has found new ways to play.  It's been great for teaching the youngers about circuits and how/why this works as well as just being fun to make music with.  I don't know how long it will keep my kids interest but it sits in our living room so that when anyone comes over, it's picked up and played with.  Each person who plays with it is fascinated and spends a good amount of time making music with us!

Bought this for my 5 year old Lego fanatic.  He's the youngest child in the family and thus spends a lot of time at his siblings events.  This has been a huge hit!  It allows us to bring his Legos and some other toys and provide a place for him to play that contains the Lego so I'm not freaking out about losing them.  We use it at least once a week on the go and often around the house to keep the tiny pieces from getting lost in the carpet.  This size is just right. Not so big that it's cumbersome and not so small that you're limited with what you bring.  We do also have the small layngo for dinners out or places that wouldn't have the space for this mat.  Highly recommend if you are an active family and want to bring some things along on your adventures!

These are just what you'd expect. Thick soled, fluffy, soft slippers.  I needed something to wear for the warmer months around the house and these are great.  They would be 5 stars for sure if there just wasn't that annoying embroidered acorn on the heel.  I will never understand why shoe companies do that.  For one, you can't see the logo. Secondly, it's like having a pebble in your shoe.  I asked my daughters to try the slippers to see if it was just me being overly sensitive and they both made the same comment.  So I took a seam ripper and removed the cute little acorn embroidery from the heel and these are perfect!  If anyone from Acorn reads these reviews, I suggest placing the logo on the part that goes across the top of the foot where it can be seen and allow your customers to be perfectly comfortable.  I would recommend these with the caveat that the stitching across the heel may annoy you but there is an easy solution.

We bought 2 sets of these because they looked like they'd be a fun novelty toy.  Three broke within 5 minutes of use. The next day I brought out the next three and they all broke that day.  While it's cute to see the ball splat, it's not so cute cleaning up the mess of whatever goo is inside them.  Save your money for something else!

I really really wanted to love this vacuum cleaner. I have spent so much time on the phone with Dyson customer service having parts replaced. The only original part I have now is the motor which must be the underlying problem.  The brush head is always getting jammed and needing to be cleaned making this a high maintenance vacuum.  I could live with that.  I battery stopped holding a charge, got a replacement, I could live with that.  The big problem is the cleaning power.  I keep it in our kitchen hoping for quick pick up after meals and general "sweeping" chores on a wood floor.  This thing can't pick up crumbs! I use the roller head to go over the floor first, then attach the narrow end to get under cabinets and around baseboards.  Still a ton of stuff left.  I've given up and now just sweep.  My $40 dust buster did a far superior job.  I thought I would be upgrading with all the Dyson hype. If I liked this one, I was going to upgrade our household vacuum for a Dyson. Now, not a chance!  If it can't keep up with basic daily pick up, there is no way I'd trust this company to produce a vacuum that could keep up with weekly deep cleaning of the house.  Save your money, look elsewhere.  All you'll get here is a cool looking wall decoration that makes noise around your home.

The first time I wore these it was 5 degrees outside and it had just snowed an inch or so. I wore these with a pair of medium weight socks and was very happy with the fit and comfort.  A bit stiff around the heel but not bad.  I was excited to have dry feet and was prepared to write a raving review.  Then I wore them the next day.  My feet were not only cold, they were soaked! It wasn't raining and the snow I walked in was only an inch deep so it wasn't coming in the top of the shoe.  I tried one more time and noticed the same thing.  I called UGG and was told I could return them for "warranty inspection".  That means I would have to pay to ship them to UGG for them to decide whether or not to replace them or return them to me.  Totally up to them.  That is, in my opinion, terrible customer service!!  If I went into LLBean to return a shoe that leaked, they would just give me new shoes on the spot. No questions asked!  I returned these to Amazon (thank you Amazon for your amazing customer service!) and did go to L.L. Bean and bought a pair of bean boots instead.  Not as cute but definitely stay dry and the customer service is amazing!

I liked the idea of this after being a loyal "Gentle Leader" user.  I didn't like that with the G.L., some people thought it was a muzzle and assumed our dog was aggressive. We lost our gentle leader and decided to try this.  It work well at first but I found that every time I wanted to use it, I had to readjust the straps because they constantly loosen up.  My dog is a strong puller and this just doesn't cut for him.  We went back to the gentle leader and will stick with that.

I bought this for myself this year and I'm so happy with it! The study notes are excellent.  I love the introductions and have learned so much about the culture and background in the bible that I just didn't know.  I enjoy the notes throughout the chapters and have found them to be accurate and helpful.  I had the old NIV study bible but the notes just weren't that great.  The ESV had excellent maps as well.  It is HUGE but I enjoy reading from it so much that I find carrying it back and for the church and bible study is not an issue.  I considered the personal size but the font was frustrating to my 40 year old eyes so I stuck with the full size.

I returned this after a week.  I didn't care for the smell and upon closer inspection of the label, found there are chemicals that I am trying to avoid.  It probably works just fine but I found other more natural creams that work and don't include the harsh chemicals. Bel Essence All-Natural Anti-Wrinkle Treatment is the one I tried after this and I'm still using it.

I bought this because of the natural ingredients and I am very happy with it.  My skin looks amazing! I've been using it for about 2 months now and my skin is soft and looks refreshed.  My routine is washing at night then applying this all over my face, eyes, and neck. it is a bit thick but fairly easy to spread.  After 2 months, I have about half the bottle left so it lasts a good amount of time.  I don't think everyone will like the consistency but if you consider the benefits of good healthy ingredients and the impact on your skin, it's absolutely wonderful!

A beautifully written book that will help anyone see the sweet love that Jesus has for his people.  I found this to be so comforting and convicting.  This is a good book for new believers as well as those who have been raised in the church.  This and Paul Miller's "A Praying Life" are to must reads for all Christians.

I use this because my Air-o-swiss manual has me scared to try anything else.  It does seem to clean the unit but I'm not sure that it's worth the price.  I use it about every 3-4 weeks and haven't had a problem with my unit.  I'm curious if there are other options but I haven't explored that yet.

We homeschool and I needed some extra stuff for my 4 year old to do.  He loves mazes and this book is fantastic. The mazes look simple at first glance but there are many  that require a few tries.  We tore out the pages and put them in page protectors so he can do them with dry-erase.  It holds his attention well and has a nice mix of easy confidence building mazes as well as more challenging pages as well.

My son is 4 and like most kids, loves using scissors.  His cutting skills are poor and instead of practicing on my mail and books, I decided to get him this.  He loves it!  We call it a school book so he knows it's to be treated well and he is to do his best work with it.  I am impressed.  It is a simple concept but it works well. There's a nice mix of zigzag lines and shapes to cut out.  In just a week, my son improved enough to help cut out Christmas trees and snowflakes on his own.

The bible is very special. It tells the stories you know and makes the connection to Jesus in a way that I had never thought of.  I have enjoyed reading it with my kids and learning about the connections from the old testament to the new.  I've been a Christian for a long time but was able to learn from this children's bible!  The DVD is nice but we prefer the book.  We've watched it but just in short stints as it doesn't hole my kids attention as well.  None the less, a nice set. The DVD will reinforce what they are reading and in my opinion, the more they know about what is in the bible, the better!

These are amazing! My nails grow better since I switched to glass files.  These are nice quality and don't seem to break as easily as the last set I tried.  They do an amazing job of smoothing the ends of my nails leaving them snag-free.  I like the larger size for my toes. I've bought a few to give as gifts and I always hear back about how great they are.  Highly recommend.

I got these for my daughter who asked about changing the light when she read.  I like these as a way to play around with the proper colors to use for filters.  The only draw back is that they are glossy which in itself, could cause eye strain.  For the price, you get to test some colors and combinations to see what works for you.  We then purchased 2 filters through Irlen.  The Irlen filters are matte finish and easier on the eyes.  They are more expensive but if you figure out what color works best first, you can just purchase what you need.  These filters also get more "bend" marks in them than the Irlen filters so wouldn't hold up for long term use.

I was expecting to get thin bendable spoons.  I took a chance based on the reviews and couldn't be happier.  My first shipment was lost in the mail and the company immediately sent out a replacement.  When those arrived, I was so happy with what I got.  I picked these because they are fairly close pattern to the full set we have. That set would have cost a lot more for replacement pieces.  For less than $20 shipped, you can't beat these!  They are solid and feel very nice to hold.  I will definitely be buying more to replace/supplement what we have.

I am very pleased with this. Knocking off 1 star because within a few weeks, all the markings for the size of the grind came off.  It still functions the same but it does add in a bit of guessing.  I ordered the pepper mill at the same time and it's markings are all still fine. That being said, the quality of this mill seems to be very good.  It's very easy to refill and holds enough that you won't need to constantly refill it.  The clear part is acrylic but nice and clear, could pass for glass.

The design is so simple.  Open 1 side and you get 10 CDs, all of which are easy to see.  Open the other side and you get 10 more.  I used this to organize my sons CDs into music and stories.  He can see all of the disc labels which helps in choosing what he wants.  It all snaps down into a very compact solid case.  This case has been dropped dozens of times and gets thrown in the car for road trips.  It holds up very well and all the CD's are safe inside.  Taking another reviewers suggestion, we ordered a larger size to organize video games.  It also works very well for it's purpose.  Of all the cases I've tried, this is my favorite.

I bought this for our regular height bathroom door hoping that my younger children would be able to reach up to hang his towel.  We have 3 kids using 1 bathroom and adding this and the shorter length bar has helped immensely to keep the towel clutter down in the bathroom.  My children can all easily hang up their towels behind the door leaving the room feeling a bit more open.  The bars each have rubber pads on the back to keep them from clanking against the door.  I use them for 2 towels each and our towels dry out easily

I read reviews on several of these types of calendars and am very happy with this one.  The size is great for our larger family and the area for notes on the side makes highlighting important details easy.  The space for each day has enough room to list each child's activity. I like that it also has room for the first week of the next month so we can see what's coming up before the current month is over.  The mounting system is very simple and it's easy to take the calendar of the wall to write in the next months activities.  The frame has been solid and stayed on the board without issue, unlike some less quality boards I've had.  I recommend this calendar without reservation.

We ordered 8'x10' and it was too large for our 8'x10' rug.  Cutting it down is relatively simple but it would be nice if it were the correct size.  That being said, it keeps our rug in place.  We have a large rug in our family room and 4 kids are constantly running around the room. With this mat the rug does not budge!  I didn't find it as plush as other reviewers and would love for it to be a bit more so to make the carpet more comfortable but it's not a big deal.  The quality of the mat is excellent. Solid rubber backing, well made felt composition.  No shedding or fluff coming off.  I used the scraps to under the carpet in our entry way and that rug is finally staying in place!  Definitely would recommend.  Maybe remeasure your rug and take advantage of the fee custom cutting to ensure exact sizing.

It seems that every year I'm buying a new mat for the kitchen sink.  I've had some that kept slipping away, some that collected all the dust in the house, some that just got too many stains.  I was skeptical about spending so much on a mat but took a chance and trusted the reviews.  I ordered this in Cinnamon hoping for a slightly more red color than I got.  The color is fine, it's brown but nice enough.  I laid it out and left it overnight to "unroll" a bit more.  Here's what I love, it disappears in the kitchen.  I mean you forget it's there.  I don't spend time pushing it back in place or always having to vacuum it.  If it gets spilled on, I wipe it up and voila!, good as new.  It is very comfortable to stand on, it's not like a day at the spa or anything but I notice that I don't have any discomfort.  My feet don't get sore or tired and I don't find myself shifting my weight from foot to foot trying to stay at ease.  In my opinion, it's well worth the investment.  It comes with a 7 year warranty which to me means that it should last at least that long.  It seems well made so I expect it will last at least that long.  That's less than $10 per year which is already less than I've been spending on all my cheapo mats.  I would love to see it in more vibrant colors but the fact that it just blends into the kitchen is growing on me.  It's nice not notice it because to me, it means that it's not having the same problems we've had with lesser quality mats.  If you're on the fence, I can confidently suggest you go ahead and try it.  I am, in fact, ordering a 2nd to place in the laundry room which is where I spend the rest of my time once the dishes are done.  ;)

We have an overhead light in our kitchen that requires this type of bulb.  I bought a replacement at Home Depot but when I got home and installed it, I felt like I was under a spot light!  I did some reading up and learned lumens measure the temperature of the light and started scanning the internet for better options.  This got good reviews so I decided to try it.  I am very happy with the outcome.  I no longer notice the lamp over head, just the light in the room.  In my opinion, that is how it should be.  It turns a potentially harsh lighting situation into a soft, natural, ambient light feel.  I highly recommend this.  Arrived safely and quickly.

I really wanted to love this.  I love the wine color and the fold over snap closure.  I read many reviews before buying this that said it was too big for the iPhone 4s without a case. Yes, my iPhone did have extra room and did slide around but I wasn't concerned about it falling out because the closure is wide. The only way it would fall out would be if the magnetic snap closure didn't close. The reason I returned this was because it just didn't have a great way to keep all my cards and cash.  I had to fold my cash small and double up my cards.  Not a huge deal except that I couldn't find what I needed easily.  If you don't have many cards and don't tend to carry cash, this is a great option.  Beautiful color.  Wish it was just a bit more practical. Ultimately, I returned it bought the new Anniversary Wristlet which I am very happy with.
I was not expecting this sort of quality; they are just beautiful and very high quality; much better in person and they are very weighty. You will be pleasantly surprised.

I came across a toy guide in a magazine and was looking through it when I first saw Butch. I had heard of the good dinosaur but did not know any of the characters. I don't know why but for some reason I fell in love with Butch at first sight; he was different, he had a great face and as I have already amassed a large collection of T-Rex figures I knew I had to add one more. He is GORGEOUS he is HUGE and I just can't stop holding him and looking at him, he is wonderful.
I love these desk top toys, this one in particular; the movement of the blue 'surf' and the figures is soothing and mesmerizing. Very well made and a must have for your desk or anywhere.

This is by far the best food magazine out there; it is done with no expense spared, and superb recipes and photos so appealing they verge on food porn. do not persue this magazine if you are hungry, it will drive you insane! Pick up a copy and you'll see what I mean, you won't be disappointed!

Westworld meets Disney World with truly fascinating suspenseful results. If such a park could ever be created it would put all other parks out of business, it is that incredible. I had to get up and walk around, take a break, but I could hardly wait to get back to the book. I LOVED it. (I think you guessed that by now) and will be re-reading to savor it because I was too panicky to read slowly and I missed some of it. It is unique, no other book like it, and it deserves, I HOPE, to be made into a movie.
great little scratch pads, very handy!

Since I was six years old I have been plagued with migraines; horrible heart pounding agony, and when I was six no one believed me, my mother said I was too young to get headaches. So I treated myself with a washcloth soaked in cold water on my forehead and a mental exercise in which I visualized the top of my head being removed and my brain taken out and soothed in cool water. Yes, I know it sounds wacky, but it was all I had and it did alleviate some of the pain. then I got Excedrin in my teens and never had a bad headache again; these pills are amazing, literally 5 minutes and I take one the headache vanishes. heaven. At the first sign of one coming on I attack it with one Excedrin. Fabulous. Works every single time.
A real beauty; I love the older Barbies and this one is extra special!
You have to see this in person, just too cute!
Adorable, funny little guy!
Oh he is FINE; I just LOVE him!
Defines adorable; plush sushi how can you go wrong? Happy little guy, LOVE him!
My fault, thought the figure was included
The tiny size is clearly written in the description, but it is fine for cake decoration or crafts.

I really love this T-Rex; his color is outstanding as are his expression and detail. His mouth is moveable you can open his jaws or keep them closed, however I do not think his jaws would stand up to really rough play. A superb addition to any T-Rex collection.
This figure is really wonderful; he is so well made and such high quality; his jaws are extended to go in for the kill! Beware!
Perfect little Mickey Mouse! Love it!
Fabulous high quality shark figure, sturdy detailed and a terrific addition to my shark collection.
Cute but VERY tiny! I already misplaced it!
Really nice tiny figure of DD; captures his personality in a small version.
Hold MARS in your hand! Amazing detail, beautiful deep red color, and fascinating to hold and imagine where the robot is and when he will reach the mountain range! A must have for astronomy lovers.

This little piggy is EXTRAORDINARY! Even better in person! The details incredible, he is a perfect little piggy and a real bargain at twice the price! Bring home the bacon and if I'm not mistaken...you will go hog wild!

Gorgeous piece; just like Outer Space, deep, dark and mysterious, punctuated by the planets, colors against the vastness of outer space. I will never travel aboard a space ship, this is as close as I will ever get and it is plenty for me!
Wow; is this fantastic! I esp. love the tiny Moon; put them all together and they are just gorgeous. The earth is very impressive and Mars is wonderful!

Photograph does not do this extraordinary piece justice. I was STUNNED when I opened the box; it is HUGE and HEAVY and so beautiful it takes your breath away. I just held it and stared at it, just so exquisite, I was expecting a nice piece but this blew me away, You must see it to believe it, worth it at twice the price.

Truly AMAZING product. I frequently feel sick, nauseated, after a meal. I had six weeks of radiation in my stomach area and (sorry, this gets kind of graphic) I had a colonoscopy and watched the TV monitor and noticed all this black char stuff, I asked the doctor and he said it was from the radiation. I do know that after the surgery and the radiation my stomach was never the same and I tried yogurts, vitamins supplements you name it. NOTHING did ONE thing until I found THIS product, which has been literally a Godsend. I take one on an empty stomach and no matter what I eat I feel great, no more nausea, no more stomach aches, got back to where I was before the radiation. WONDEFUL stuff! I'm 66 years old and feel like I have been blessed with a twenty year old stomach!
My favorite jerky of all. HOWEVER...buy it elsewhere, FAR too expensive here. It is MUCH cheaper right on the JL site.

Really bad, really scary dizziness; the episodes would bring me down to the ground, it could and did happen anywhere at any time and each time really freaked me out; the worst one was in bed, the room started to spin, worse and more violent than any amusement park ride ever, and I stared at my hand, to focus on something, and eventually it stopped. I knew then I never wanted to go through that again so I looked online and found Divertigo, ordered it and it saved me from these horrible spells. If I feel one coming on I apply a few drops of this and I'm fine.I will never be without it again. great stuff and smells wonderful.

SUPERB film! ONLY Gloria Swanson could possibly have portrayed Norma Desmond, she WAS Norma Desmond, the line between role and actress disappeared when she appeared for the first time in the film. Such a great beginning, Holden face down in her pool narrating how he got there and what had transpired before that led to this watery end. The monkey funeral and the appearance of Von Stroheim as the butler were appropriately bizarre and eerie. The house itself, used for the film, has a history almost as compelling as the movie it was used for:http://wilshireboulevardhouses.blogspot.com/2013/02/641-south-irving-boulevard-please-see.htmlThe story is unbearably tragically sad; poor Norma, so lonely so lost so rejected, then having William Holden just appear on her doorstep truly seemed like salvation for her. He stayed with her allowing her to treat him like a sort of living Ken doll, a plaything to dress up lavish money on, then to fall in love with, when the dynamic changed, so did the uneasy nature of their relationship. You feel sorry for both of them but sorrier for Norma (at least I did).I was blessed to have not only met her at a party but to spend time sitting next to her with the party swirling around us and have her do the entire staircase scene for me, hand gestures and all; I was MESMERIZED. When she finished she looked at me and said "I suppose all your friends think I'm crazy" to which I replied "Oh no, Miss Swanson, not at all, they ADMIRE you!" and that was true.The setting for all this was in the house that Douglas Fairbanks Sr. built in 1919 (the date carved into the enormous fireplace) and the ceilings were so high and the room so vast the only curtains that could be used to cover the windows were theater curtains. There was also a passage from the basement/wine cellar that, when traveled through to the other end, came up at Pickfair, Mary Pickford's house, so they could visit each other secretly.This is a REAL Hollywood gem, a masterpiece, not one single flaw, and it is just as riveting every time you see it as it was the first time, it holds up beautifully through repeated viewings."I AM big, it's the PICTURES that got small."Indeed.

We were having a memorable dinner at a fine French restaurant and this salad was served and at the first bite we all looked at each other and rolled our eyes in gastronomic bliss. The combination of the raspberry and the oil was just fabulous and so good you can practically drink it right out of the bottle. The only difference was they used walnut oil, which was delicious but a wee bit too rich, this is much easier on the palate. Wish Bone has perfected the blend, you can put it on ANY vegetables or fruits and just be in gourmet Heaven. Try it!

My favorite recipe; try it, it's great! and you can add hot sauce if you want to spice it up, I like Frank's.Ingredients teaspoon dill weed¼ cup vegetable oil1 box (16 ounces) oyster crackers1 packet (1 ounce) Hidden Valley® Original Ranch® Salad Dressing & Seasoning Mix¼ teaspoon lemon pepper or garlic powder, (optional)DirectionsPlace crackers in a gallon-size Glad-Lock® Zipper™ Storage Bag. Pour oil over crackers; seal bag and toss to coat.Add dressing mix and spice; seal bag and toss again until coated. Bake on ungreased baking sheet at 250°F for 15 to 20minutes or until golden brown.

These dolls are amazing; I have amassed quite a collection of these dolls and the latest one is just gorgeous. Very detailed as is the entire line, and beautifully dressed and impeccable makeup. LOVE this doll!

VERY well made, sturdy and totally engaging. You can change his expression by moving the little twig on the top of his head and he's such a happy joyous little guy you will want to look at him all day long. Fairly indestructible I'd say but of course, he would not stand up to really rough play. Better for older more careful kids. He comes apart just like in the movie and reattaches easily. Wonderful toy! Bring him home and treat yourself or someone you love!

I won't go into all the details of the story which other reviewers have done so well before me but I did want to share what joy and fascination I enjoyed while reading this book all the way through more times than I am willing to admit. Matthew Clairmont is a wonderful character and totally engaging. There has been some speculation as to casting should this ever be made into a movie (and it should!!!) unfortunately my number one pick for Matthew is now too old to play the part, but when he was younger...Timothy Dalton, he would have been absolutely perfect! Check out his photo from Wuthering Heights!So now I would choose Ralph Fiennes...or Bradley Cooper...UPDATE: I found MATTHEW![...]

The killer's last words to his victims; a mother and her daughters. This book is so sad and so inexplicable as all stranger murders are; why kill people you never met don't know and have no interaction with? Murder is bad enough but at least with crimes of passion (so called) you can grasp the feelings and the motive while not approving of them, of course; but this. This is evil beyond evil, this rage and cruelty expended on totally innocent helpless victims. Chandler is a monster and after he raped the women (actually woman and children) he tied cement blocks to them pushed them overboard and yelled at them "Swim for it!" There is a special place in hell for soulless beasts like him.

She comes in a large beautiful box, has many accessories and is just breathtaking in person; I just stared at her when I opened the mailing box. What a beauty and what fabulous detail! A must for any collection!

From when I was growing up in the 1950s I have adored mustard and tried new mustards whenever available to me. We moved to Europe for a few years and when there I found a fabulous mustard in a tube. Grey Poupon is almost identical to that one, if you're curious. Anyway, I also love Gulden's, French's, Grey Poupon, etc. and I assumed French's was the only yellow mustard around. Then I found Heinz. Oh My God, my search was over; this is THE best mustard EVER! On hot dogs, on hamburgers, on sausages, on bratwurst, on fish, on steak, on knackwurst, you name it it's fabulous I even love it on boiled potatoes (which I have with sausage, esp. Polish sausage) One taste and you'll be hooked too!

To get this much juice, and high quality delicious juice to boot, is simply unbelievable, yet here it is. I was recently diagnosed with type 2 diabetes and this is my safety net. I will always have it on hand, always available and it is just so good I might drink it whether I need it or not! I just can't get over the price for this much juice!!!

These artichoke hearts are simply superb. You can always have them on hand any day any week any month of the year and you can use them in recipes or just right out of the jar, they are just incredible.

This entire book is based on a lie; this woman is not now, nor ever has been, a "warrior." She went to Africa, and visited the Maasai for a few weeks, ate goat, drank blood, threw up then flew home to go back to her Prada shopping and her Beemer. This is all fake and she is using the noble Maasai to promote her self serving egocentric diary about her experiences with them. This is a travesty, a disgrace, and horrifying in very sense of the word. It is hideously insulting to a brave tribe of real warriors who were used as book fodder for this spoiled rich b*tch who has no regard for these people beyond using them for her own selfish greedy purpose.She PLAYED at being a "warrior" she never was, nor does she have any conception about what the word means. But hey, time to go shopping for more Prada! Wow."But she never went without her Chanel Red Dragon lipstick to carry her through the hard times.""As part of her training she was asked to suffocate a goat but she is unable to finish it off.""Instead the men cut its jugular and hand her a cup of blood squeezed from its body - considered a delicacy by the Maasai.Mindy writes: `The blood was still warm as it slid down my throat. I furrowed my brow, curled my toes, clenched my butt, and continued to drink, while holding back the vomit.`It took every ounce of my being to hold back the bloody throw-up. It felt like drinking warm whole milk, which I've always refused to do not only because of the obscene amount of calories - but also because I have always had an aversion to thick liquid substances'."She couldn't stop herself and fell to her knees, buried her face in the tall grass and vomited it back up again.""She tells in the book how she found an inner courage she did not realize she possessed, which showed itself when they encountered an angry 600lbs buffalo in a field."Mindy writes: `I screamed as the snorting, slobbering, raging buffalo charged in my direction. Then Lanet's (one of the Maasai) teaching replayed itself in my head: "If the enemy is stronger than you, you must attack first", and that is what I did.`Grunting and howling and with a quick request to the powers above, I released my spear. As it rocketed through the air the other Maasai released their spears but mind landed first, on the very edge of the buffalo's right butt cheek'.Her spear did little damage but her bravery won the respect of the other Maasai, who killed the buffalo."Come ON! Are you KIDDING me???? Good GOD! How embarrassing is this????"After returning from her adventure Mindy enrolled at the University of Chicago Booth School of Business.Under the laws of the tribe, even though Mindy lives in the U.S. she is bound to return and fight for them if there is a war, sing and dance at all weddings and protect the community if there is an animal invasion.She has every intention of doing so."

Oh how I LOVED this book; ex (but not really ex) Marines, art, diamonds and the Russian Mafia, how can you go wrong? Juggling all these stories and keeping the balls in the air has always been done successfully by Patterson, but in this book, his skills are just off the charts. The best and most complicated characters, all the story lines and how well they connect, the love and loyalties that support the good guys and the bad boys fatal choices hang them in the end just the way stories (and life) should be. Fantastic and totally believable villains and even more believable heroes make this book a real stunner. Set against a background of exotic locales throughout Europe, the chases to recover the stolen diamonds, the love of the hero and his lady friend are just perfect and perfectly satisfying. I won't admit to how many times I've read and re-read this book, but let's say it is a permanent fixture on my nightstand. I NEVER tire of reading it. Read and see for yourself, enjoy the fantastic ride!

Luscious, delicious, toothsome, gourmand, primo, number one jerky, the Rolls Royce of jerkies, the KING of all jerkies, and...there is none better! Buy it, try it; get your satisfy with it!!! Glorious stuff!
look elsewhere. This jerky is OK, but very salty, spicy and no discernible sweetness at all. Try the honey BBQ, that is fantastic, this is not.

Who would ever have imagined during those glorious days of childhood that one day, thanks to current technology,. we would be able to OWN these fantastic shows!!!! To watch over and over again; an embarrassment of riches for sure! I don't think there are any HB shows I do not own, but if there are, that will be rectified SOON! This one (and The Roman Holidays, which I ADORE) are my favorites. Yes, you CAN go home again, get this DVD< if you've never met the Captain now is the time to get acquainted! Enjoy!

I ADORE Tang, the sugar version, that is; it not only tastes fantastic, it has more vitamins than orange juice does; it never goes bad, never needs refrigeration, good to have handy and all you need is water! perfect, esp. for folks like me who are subject to hurricanes and power outages, if you have Tang at least you have a tasty healthy drink! LOVE this stuff!

After inflating his terrific globe, I spent a long time examining it and finding much more detail than I expected. It is great, very nice to look at and educational as well. Take it to the beach, out to the pool, enjoy!

This is a crime that has taken on new life and is more and more prevalent throughout society in general. Anyone, from little kids, to older adults, can fall prey to these sick individuals and may not even know it for a while. We have the celebrity stalkings, John Lennon, who was assassinated by his stalker, Chapman, Ronald Reagan, a victim of the obsession Hinckley had for Jodi Foster, Rebecca Schafer, the victim of Robert Bardo, Teresa Saldana, victim of a Scottish maniac who has vowed to finish the job when he gets out of prison, then we have the regular folk, who would have remained unknown had their paths not been intercepted by stalkers. Forward by Gavin de Becker, who write the excellent and potentially life saving book, the Gift of Fear. HIGHLY recommended, fascinating read.

I got this feeling of absolute evil while reading this book, yet I could not stop reading it. Like looking at a grisly accident and unable to avert your eyes. I remember the care of poor Mark Kilroy, a hapless medical student on Spring Break partying with friends in Matamoros Mexico. BAD idea. I remember seeing a photo of him SO handsome, poor poor guy!SPOILER!!!Then I remember seeing a photo of Sara Aldrete wearing a NECKLACE made from Kilroy's SPINAL CORD!!!! The story re: Constanzo, AKA El Padrino, the godfather, is chilling as we read about the making of a monster from childhood courtesy of his mother who makes Satan look almost normal. This woman is off the rails. Constanzo did have powers, no doubt about that. He was charismatic and very handsome and so disturbed and so dangerous. Many who crossed his oath met horrible deaths during witchcraft rituals incorporating Santeria practices. Constanzo wanted more power so he gave orders to he followers to bring hiom a young student, fresh, white and blond, which they did, abducting a terror stricken Kilroy off the streets. His death was so grisly you won't believe your eyes and the horrifying depths some people will sink to in order for them to get what they want.This the story of pure vicious evil, it upset me so much I ended up giving it to the library, I wanted it out of my house.

The illustrations and the text in this book are a perfect marriage; the father is so kind so loving and so patient, makes your heart warm. Every time I get to the last page I get tears in my eyes; so touching and so simple yet so evocative! A must for all daddies and children!

I wanted this book as soon as I saw it and read about the content; what a great idea! Complaining crayons! We go through all the colors in the box and share their unhappiness when they send a batch of letters to their owner Duncan. He reads all of them and comes up with a magical solution which is shown toward the end. Along the way we meet various crayons and read about their individual complaints and though I found all of them to be funny and witty, my favorite was poor Peach who was afraid (and embarrassed!)to come out of the box since Duncan removed her wrapper! This book is simply brilliant and the illustrations are fantastic! This book can (and should) be given to kids everywhere for birthdays, holidays or just because, it is that special. No child should without one!

This is an excellent introduction to the contributions African American Women made in the opening of the Old West. Wagner profiles 10 women of indomitable courage who went through whatever it required to get where they wanted to get.I am a bit disappointed there were no stories of African American women who helped settle the Inland Empire of Oregon, Washington, & Idaho – but that's probably due to the fact there were none. Those who came went on to Portland or Seattle.I think my favorite character, and she was, indeed, a character was Mary Fields, aka Stagecoach Mary, though it's difficult to pick a favorite.Ms. Wagner did her research, and told each story with care and attention to detail, without bogging the story down in nothing but facts. This book should be in every history class in every high school in the country. Not just in the class, but taught.I look forward to reading Wagner's book, It Happened on the Underground Railroad. If I have to find a negative remark about this book, it is only that it was too short. I would like to have read a great deal more about many of these women. Oh, wait, I can do that, can't I? ;-)If you're a history buff, as I am, I heartily recommend this book. Job well done, Ms. Wagner. Job well done.

If you are a fan of history, especially that of the opening of the Oregon Country to pioneers, I think these books (there are two Volumes) should be at the top of your "must read" list. Drury is the undisputed authority on the Whitmans and the early members of the Oregon Mission Board who came here (the Spaldings, Eells, Walkers). The Rangers at the Whitman Mission National Historic Site use Drury as their authority and bible. I now understand why.When I picked Volume I up, and began to read, my eyes began to quickly glaze over. It began as a very dense history book. However, by page 3 or so, I was hooked. Yes, it is dense, yes, it is packed with facts and tidbits and many items of interest, and yes I found myself resenting the times I had to put the books down. When I finished Volume I, I immediately picked up Volume II and began reading.Volume I contains more information about Narcissa, which is what I was after, but Volume II contains more information about the mission in general and Marcus. The primary focus of these two volumes is, of course, Narcissa and Marcus; however, due to the nature of history, many other people entered the narrative from the Rev. Henry H. Spalding, a rejected suitor of Narcissa, the Indians who invited the Missionaries to come and teach them, to the metis, Joe Lewis the primary instigator of the uprising in which the Whitmans and others were killed.The only complaint I have about the books, and believe me I had to dig to find one, is the quality of the maps and drawings. I know they were copies of the originals, which weren't all that great to begin with, but they were small. It would have been nice had they at least been full page instead of 80% or whatever. Keep a magnifier handy when reading.Drury was not only an Historian of merit, but also a minister, a terrific author, and he was able to bring the characters not just to life on the page, but to give us insights into their actions, and thinking.Highly recommend these two books!

Spalding, a rejected suitor of Narcissa, the Indians who invited the Missionaries to come and teach them, to the metis, Joe Lewis the primary instigator of the uprising in which the Whitmans and others were killed.The only complaint I have about the books, and believe me I had to dig to find one, is the quality of the maps and drawings. I know they were copies of the originals, which weren't all that great to begin with, but they were small. It would have been nice had they at least been full page instead of 80% or whatever. Keep a magnifier handy when reading.Drury was not only an Historian of merit, but also a minister, a terrific author, and he was able to bring the characters not just to life on the page, but to give us insights into their actions, and thinking.Highly recommend these two books!

I took a poetry workshop from Ms. Austen, our Washington State Poet Laureate. What a delightful two hours. After, I bought her book, curious to read her work, which was not used in the workshop.She mentioned some personal life stories during the workshop, and this book tells a little about them. Many people I know read a book of poetry willy-nilly, they enjoy picking up the book and opening it to a poem. I tend to start at the beginning and read to the end. The beginning tells us it is in memory of her brother, who died too young at 37 years of age. I read the first three poems and stopped. The third poem is "What Is Known" – for her brother, Michael – just blew my socks off. She has several poems in this book with the same title, and they are very, very powerful.This is not a book of lightness and humor; it is a book of delicately written pain, and sorrow. It explores life in all its meanings – and every reader will read their own poems, their own stories, into these words.While it is not a book of lightness and humor, it is yet filled with light, and touches of humor. These poems will go directly to your heart; they will allow your soul to soar. I read the complete book in a matter of 3 or 4 sittings. I have since gone back to several of the poems to read again, and sometimes yet again, to read, to absorb, to marvel at the beautiful writing, and then to lay aside only to pick it up again and again.

I was sent a package of these labels in return for my honest review.These labels are marvelous. I originally thought to use them in my sewing room, but they were just a tad too large for what I wanted. I did cut some to use in the kitchen, but in describing them to a friend, his eyes lit up, so I passed some along to him. He is responsible for the photos.They are being used in the super market where I do business at the cheese counter and olive bar, and his son uses them for his toy containers.
