In one exercise, she recommends taking out everything except the furniture.  To take out the accessories and items that are flexible.  Then she says to put back only what's necessary.  Brilliant.  I should do this.I highly recommend her book, partly because of the practical knowledge she shares, and also because she deserves kudos for providing a new way to think about interior design.  I applaud her.  I really do.  More information about her life and work can be found at her blog called The Nester.(i received this ebook free to review from booklookbloggers/thomas nelson)

While I have to admit this book will help many couples understand how to enjoy a satisfying sex life, I found several parts of the book uncomfortable to read.  I realize folks want to know what to think, but sometimes more isn't better.The author leaves no stone unturned, it seems, and covers all the areas a couple might have questions about. I take issue, however, with the emphasis on having so many paper towels on hand in the bedroom--how messy the act is---and how a person can make clean-up easier.  Please.  And as for details about personal grooming--do you think it'll go over well for a husband or wife to nudge his mate and share how unhygienic they are?  Some of the details would be best left alone.When descriptions are clinical and maybe too obvious, I think some of the magic leaves.  No book is a one-stop shopping sort of enterprise.  Yes, she covers many topics that people want to know, but is there anything wrong with just finding out on your own?  Do we have to have one more self-help about sex?  Hasn't it all been covered before?  Are we so clueless?Yes, her book is thorough.  But not sure it's what I'd want to pass out to anyone.  Brown paper wrapper, please.(i received this book free to review from BookLookBloggers/Thomas Nelson)

Lisa Samson has a gift for telling a story behind the story.  Her books are never light, and always give a refreshing spiritual uplift.  I've thought before that in some way she personally identifies with her heroines---that she puts herself, or the way she thinks into her main characters.  There's a common thread in each of her books that always appeals to me.  And she's done it again with 'Runaway Saint.'This one is about a young married couple who live a wonderfully artsy life.  They run an old-style printing company and Samson goes into a great deal of detail telling of the antique equipment they use/buy (which was a bit confusing and overwhelming), but was probably necessary to the story.  Their shop is full of unusual people, more than I run into during an ordinary day, and this is a typical Samson trait, always a treat.  Sara, the main character, has a long-lost aunt, Bel, who moves back into town after being a missionary in Kasakhstan and the strange behavior of her aunt is the curious thread that drives the story.Her aunt has a secret---really many secrets, and little by little they come to light.  What Samson tells isn't always pretty, sometimes painful, but the ending to this story is perfect, and I never saw it coming.  Highly recommended.  Have a pencil on hand to underline---with Samson there's always something I want to remember.(i received this book free to review from BookLookBloggers)

Jane Kirkpatrick's monumental undertaking (at least from my point of view) called 'Emma of Aurora' was impressive.  This weighty book, over 1,000 pages is three books in one including 'A Clearing in the Wind' (2006), 'A Tendering in the Storm' (2007), and 'A Mending at the Edge' (2008).  For fans of Kirkpatrick's, this is a treasure to own.The vast majority of characters introduced in the books are taken from real life incidents, and her re-telling of the events of their lives is done thoroughly and with style. Kirkpatrick writes beautiful dialogue and her characters are believable.  And even though I'm not keen on saga-style writing, she does it well.  Her research and the bibliography at the end of the book are impressive.The books tell of the life in the 1800's of Emma Wagner, who at a young age marries a rising star in, what appears to be, a cult.  She marries for love at the beginning of the series, suffers a loss and in the second book (which I found a bit disturbing) has to recover from that loss and, as a result, makes some very bad decisions.For anyone who enjoys fiction/non-fiction set in the days of America's early days of the frontier, this is the series to read.  And for those who like to see books well-written, you'd be pleased as well.(i received this book free to review from waterbrook/multnomah)

To be honest, I thought William Sirls' newest book called 'The Sinners' Garden' began with too much unnecessary detail.  He walks you through every noise and action of the characters, which I found mildly irritating. Less is really more, even in writing.That said, his story is interesting to the point of being hard to put down.  Several parts of it are strange and hard to believe, but they work just the same.The book is partly about Judi, an abused wife and mother of Andy, who as a small boy suffered a disfiguring accident, yet he grows up not knowing what really happened since the truth is kept hidden.  The story is also about Judi's brother, Rip, and his involvement in the incident with her son. Heather, the small-town police officer, former girlfriend of Rip, is also caught up in the thick of the mystery.  Everything revolves around how they struggled and lived after that life-changing situation.  After telling about the tragedy in the Prologue, the story flashes forward eleven years later with the child, Andy, having grown up into a very bitter and angry young man.  Oddly enough, the anger is all directed at his mother, and the readers don't know why he comes across this way.  I did find it frustrating to read the story told at times from the young man's point of view, which slipped in at different spots, and wasn't consistent throughout the book.  He'd comment in an ugly way on his mom's outfit or her expression, and that comment was told to the reader in the author's voice.  That was confusing.But even so, I enjoyed the book.  Sirls uses a science fiction/fantasy style with Christian overtones.  He has characters seeing things or hearing things that seem out of place in an ordinary day, but as I said, they do work.  It's a good story and one I'd recommend even with my picky fussing.  I just think Sirls needs to polish up on his style.(i received this book free to review from booksneeze/thomas nelson)

Christa Parrish's book called 'Stones for Bread' is mesmerizing. After downloading the e-book to review, I instantly began reading, only to look forward so much to the next night's installment. Parrish's book is amazingly full of bread recipes, rich dialogue, and characters that are unique and totally believable.  I loved it.About depression:  "In my mother, as dishes piled up and cocoons of dust huddled in corners and her dark moments overcame her.  No one should have to shrink this way."Her sentences grab you and cause you to take notice.  I couldn't take it all in---such a beautiful story.It's about a young woman, in her thirties, who's the owner of an artisan-style bakery.  Her bread is all original and far beyond anything I've ever tried to bake.  Works of art.  That's what Liesl McNamara creates.  But she has baggage.  The pain of her mother's suicide, and her dad's re-birth into the church which causes Liesl heartache since she feels he's in part abandoned her.  Plus she becomes involved in a relationship which puts her in the position to make difficult choices.  Oh, and she's chosen to take part in a televised bake-off with a famous fancy baker.  Lots going on, and highly recommended.My only regret is that I wasn't able to receive a print copy of the book.  Would love to thumb through it, underlining and turning down corners.  I marked several passages, and with the Kindle, that's sort of difficult. Not impossible, but do-able.  Might order the hard copy just because.  It's that good.(i received this book free to review from thomas nelson/booksneeze)

The introduction to 'Awakening Faith' which is compiled by James Stuart Bell and Patrick J. Kelly says the following: "Perceptive readers will notice the Fathers' almost exclusive focus on personal virtue rather than broader societal changes, which may be frustrating at first blush to Christians whose understanding gives primacy to social justice."Current evangelical writers place a lot of importance on voting, morality based on social issues and post modern thinking.  The writers in 'Awakening Faith' talk about self-discipline, guarding your hearts, sacrifice, and cut to the heart of what a believer's life should represent.  They talk about personal responsibility in the light of Who Christ really is.I find it very refreshing and a wonderful resource for morning or evening devotions.  And for me as an Anglican to be able to read the Early Church Fathers is a joy.  Many of the names are familiar to me from the Book of Common Prayer and are also mentioned in 'The Way of a Pilgrim', another classic.  I also appreciate that a thorough list is given at the back of the book telling basic facts about the Church Fathers.  Excellent.(i received this book free to review from booksneeze/thomas nelson)

This the fourth brand I have tried and is definitely the best.The others came in pouches and this one is in a plastic container (#5), which is far better.This one is a more softer powder and very fresh tasting.This one also has the best overall flavor and is less bitter than the others.

First of all, I have tried their onion powder in a glass jar and really liked it.However, this stuff is another story. It comes in a plastic container and I could detect no onion flavor that amounted to anything good.I did detect a lingering stale aftertaste (not good) that somewhat resembled dull onion powder.I threw all of it out.I will continue to buy their single glass jar onion powder if I come across it in a local store.

I first tried the Mach 3 out on a rather heavy 3-4 day beard and it was one of the best and smoothest shaves I have ever had with this type of razor. Very impressive and I will continue to use them.The price is excellent compared to what I found in local stores.

This a nice quality product but I have not noticed any changes in my overall health. It is nice to know I am getting the benefits of the beef liver.The capsules are easy to swallow and have only a mild scent.
This is an excellent quality knife and it is VERY sharp. I got two cuts on my thumb the first time I used it.
Even though a little awkward to operate at first, the peppers from this grinder have a very nice fresh and potent flavor.

Excellent product so far. The fine spray in the really nice BPA-free clear plastic bottle covered a considerable area and dried quickly.After 24 hours of normal activity, there was absolutely no detection of any odor.

First of all, I got excellent service....it was actually mailed the day the coffee was ordered.Next, keep in mind that everyone has different tastes.That being said, I did not like this java at all. It has the taste, to me anyway, of an artificial candy cane. Really not very good.

An excellent product that delivers really nice cooked rice. I cooked brown rice with my first batch and it turned out delicious. Just be sure you don't use any less water than is recommended because the pot steams a whole lot and the water will evaporate fast.Clean up is a snap.I am really glad they offer this particular unit with the stainless steel liner.Keep in mind that you don't get all the extra features that come with the basic non-stainless steel liner. You only get 'cook' and 'warm' with this unit but that is fine with me.
This seems to be a very high quality product and of the three (3) different brands I have tried is definitely the best tasting.

I just started taking these but I have high hopes for what they can accomplish. I respect Dr. Sinatra's  reputation for quality products and this one seems to be no exception.The fact that just one easy to swallow capsule provides 400 mg of DHA is really quite awesome. I also take 1250 mg of krill oil a day (Viva Labs) so this product will last me 60 days, which makes for an excellent price for such a potent supplement.
Although I just started using this, it appears to be an excellent quality product that is actually the best grade of 'natural' Vitamin E. The capsules are easy to swallow, as well.

Update 08/20/2015: I had originally given this a 4 star rating but I will bump it up to 5 stars after changing the way I brewed it.Evidently, my measurements were off for this particular coffee bean when using my Presto percolator. I decided to try it with my French Press using the recipe at http://www.thekitchn.com/how-to-make-perfectly-robust-french-press-coffee-cooking-lessons-from-the-kitchn-113601 as a guide.Well, it turns out that this did the trick because I got a really robust, great tasting brew that equals any I have ever made at home, and may even be the best.This could very well become my regular 'go to' coffee.End of Update.This is a good all around basic coffee with a nice flavor, excellent aroma and no bitterness.  It also has a very reasonable selling price.I would, however, not make it my regular brew. We all have different taste buds of course and some may find this coffee exceptional.
This is a pretty decent tasting instant though It doesn't come close to fresh brewed. It will do in a pinch. I like the fact it is freeze dried which enables it to retain its nutritional valve.
The seeds are fresh and actually doe taste like pine nuts, which I love. From the research I did, this brand appears to be among the best, if not the best.
This appears to be an excellent quality product. It has an okay flavor and I then add a packet of SweetLeaf to it in spring water and the taste becomes good. It mixes well and seems fresh.

UNBELIEVABLE....that is excellent quality keyboard sells for under $12! This is the best keyboard I have ever owned (so far) and the cheapest.All the positive comments from the other reviewers are true, and in addition, this is the best looking keyboard I have ever seen.
Only had the watch a short while but it is working great.This is a very handsome watch, the best I have ever owned.
Excellent quality product and love the flavor.
They have a nice crunchy, bacon-flavor taste with a tad bit of sweetness. However, I have found if I cook them with my scrambled eggs they become leathery and lose flavor. I will not buy again.
Seems to be a high quality fan and I like the features. Noise level is good.
This has a very salty flavor to it which I really like and the granules are just the right size for a shaker.

This seems like a really high quality product. It is fresh tasting and smelling and has a pleasant tangy taste, a bit less than other products I have tried. I take a quarter teaspoon straight 3 times a day and this will make the package last over 30 days.

Hands down, this is the best overall brand of coffee I have ever made. It is rich in flavor, smooth with absolutely no bitterness and is well balanced.I did not notice any extra kick from the caffeine and it seems normal to me.
I have tried a number of different brands of organic raisins and these are by far the best. And, I like that they are actually sun dried.
It has a nice flavor but nothing spectacular. I also wish they would have a darker bottle to keep the light out.I will probably not buy it again but it is still a nice olive oil.

Excellent quality shoes. The first time you put them on it feels like you have already been wearing them for a year. Very stylish looking and attractive.I have a pair of their sneakers also and that is why I ordered this brand again.

It arrived well packaged and smelled very fresh. Taken with about 8 oz of spring water and a packet of (organic) SweetLeaf stevia it borders on delicious. It mixes really well with water.It will take a while to experience the long term benefits, which should be excellent for this veggie.

One of the best , if not the best, cups of coffee I have ever brewed. When opening the bag the aroma was very fresh and  "coffee-ie". To me, it is medium bodied but full flavored with absolutely no bitterness. It is very smooth and well-rounded in taste and I noticed no subtle or unique flavors, only an excellent coffee flavor.I like that it is a medium-dark roast because a medium roast usually lacks boldness whereas a dark roast can be too overbearing with that too toasted, often bitter, taste. This comes off as being the best solution between the two.This coffee is so good I can leave it at room temperature for hours in a tight lid jar or thermos, and after SLOWLY reheating it, it will taste just about as good as when first brewed.The beans are a combination of 50% Honduran Peaberry/50% Guatemalan San Antonio.And, the price is outstanding for these high quality coffee beans!This will be my regular java from now on.

This is a high quality product that came fresh and in a nicely designed package to remain fresh. I take it 'straight' into my mouth about one quarter teaspoon at eat meal and this extends the use of the product to about 30 days. Being water soluble, it is best to take this powerful vitamin C periodically throughout the day.It has a sharp, tangy taste that is definitely not sweet but I am use to it 'straight'. Taken in a fruit juice or other liquid, you probably wouldn't notice the strong flavor, which to me, is not unpleasant at all.

I had given their House Blend Medium Roast a 5 star rating because of its excellent overall quality and was looking forward to trying this very much.It had a really nice, fresh aroma when the package was opened and the beans are quite shiny which indicates a dark roasting.  Now, this is a matter of personal taste and some coffee drinkers may like a higher degree of the 'toasted' flavor of a darker roast, but for me, I did not care that much for it. It is 'okay' but I would not use it regularly for my daily java fix.It was not bitter in any way....it was just a little too toasted for me.On the other hand, when mixed half and half with a quality medium roast it would rate 4.5 stars.
Although this seemed to be a quality made product it is very thin and it was even difficult to make it look presentable on the bed as a spread. I sent it back.

This is an excellent quality product that I just started using. I like that it is fermented and organic. I have used this company's products for years and trust them. This is is a long term beneficial supplement that should pay excellent dividends in the future health wise.
This is well balanced and delicious....I highly recommend it.
This calendar is absolutely stunning! I have had several different ones before from other publishers but this one 'takes the cake'. It is high quality and has beautiful pictures. A real gem.

This is a high quality, organic product that allows me to get my daily iodine needs with 400 mcg, or 270% DV. And, being in an easy to swallow capsule, it will stay fresher longer than the bulk kelp I was previously using.Of course, there is the added benefit of getting all those other valuable nutrients belonging  to the kelp.And, it is an excellent value with 90 caps per bottle and only needing to use 1 capsule per day.
This is smaller than the original filter in the vacuum but it fits perfectly and, so far, does an excellent job.

First, the good news. I am retired and usually have my 3rd and 4th cups of coffee about 6,8 or 10 or so hours after my first two. This thermos will keep the flavor of the original brew when I SLOWLY reheat it, and this is good.Now, the bad. This was made in China and it seems, and has the feel, of a cheap product. It is quite thin and the interior reminds me of chrome rather than stainless steel. The top of the container so thin it is almost sharp and this is not good when I have to wash it.The top, after a number of uses, is still difficult to take off and it is by no means a smooth removal.The worse part is the Number 5 in the triangle on the plastic top. This number indicates it is subject to having the most toxins in the plastic. Number 1 and Number 2 are the best numbers and indicate no BPA.  Since I only use the thermos to pour from AND NOT DRINK FROM THE LID, this does not concern me too much and I will keep it. If I used it as a travel thermos I would send it back because I do not want my hot coffee passing over a Number 5 rated plastic as I consume it.

This is a really high quality product that I have used for years. It helps with digestion and probably does a whole lot more than I am even aware of if the reports of the numerous benefits of this 'tonic' are accurate.Alcohol is used to prepare the mixture and the taste is pleasantly 'bitter'.

This honey has a well balanced and delicious flavor along with its merits of being raw and unfiltered.Even though it is in a plastic container, there is a "1" in the triangle on the bottom of the jar which means there should be no threat of BPAs.

I tried it for two nights straight at full strength and was non-effective for me. The first night I did get noticeably sleepy after about half an hour and my sleep was somewhat deeper for a few hours. The second night I noticed no difference.
These batteries seem to last about the average of others I have used and I have no complaints. I have found Eneloop to be the longest lasting and they can be purchased at Amazon.
This has a delicious flavor and seems to match up with the sweetness of my regular organic cane sugar. It even goes well with coffee.
This seems like a nice, quality made watch but the band was too narrow for the size of the face and I sent it back.

I wrote to the company about the source of their product and heard back from them promptly stating they get their magnesium from the ocean. It dissolves really well in water and I like the citrus flavor that does not need sweetening. I do seem to notice a subtle sense of overall well being and my sleep, although not longer, seems to come quickly and is deeper.
This product is from an excellent company and the raw ingredients are superb. I will have to report back on long term benefits.
This product is from an excellent company and I have noticed improvement in one area (for men) after about 2 weeks of  use.
It worked great the first time I used it for a really moist meat loaf. There was no sticking and it cleaned up really well.

This company is extremely quality conscious and their products reflect it. It will take some time to determine how well this particular item works but it is good to know I have an opportunity to benefit from the amazing properties numerous tests have shown this product to exhibit.I also use the powder inside the capsules like I would regular garlic powder. It is milder than normal garlic powder in a container but can be enjoyable. For instance, I sprinkle it on an (organic) English muffin along with (organic) melted butter and sea salt.

Well, I thought I would give this a try and it did not end on a high note! Using medium ground beans with a ceramic cone filter, I got just as much "sludge" as I got from my French Press....along with the nasty taste that accompanies it.By far, still the best cup of java I have ever had is using a Chemex filter in the ceramic cone filter, which I now appreciate even more.

Every hour an unidentified culprit was spinning up every mechanical hard disk and connecting to the Internet and sending data.For those who care about virus, malware and spyware this is totally unacceptable behavior.Not to mention needlessly wearing hard disks which I explicitly set to stay spun-down unless I use them.(This strategy will extent the life of 4TB+ drives indefinitely).So I used Resource Monitor and kept uninstalling each software app one application at a time. Then I had to wait until the next hour time to see if the hard disks still spun-up like clockwork.Finally the Samsung Magician process was identified as the malware. I disabled it in the Windows Task Scheduler.There is no discussion or user setting to disable this fragrant violation of owner/user privacy.If i am misinformed I will update this review. Please note I've disabled ALL other network Discovery etc, so no red herringsOnly disabling the Samsung Magician task stops this bad boy behavior.
The mesh is larger than a window screen - so many layers need to be used.This is hardly the "fine" mesh as described.I question the integrity of the five star ratings.
The cradle is NOT for the HTC Rezound as advertised. The actual product sticker states its for the HTC Sensation XE.The Rezound will not fit.The shipping is from England so returning is impractical.

For a set of sheets so highly rated I was not expecting them to be so full of wrinkles when taking them out of the dryer. They were still slightly damp. Disappointing.Same wrinkle issues with all cotton shirts. Manufactures may claim wrinkle free but they look less than ideal unless ironed. Who wants to iron sheets? I found a new and improved (soft luxurious feel) set of polyester sheets at Wally's for about the same price and my wife really liked them.

It is a bright laser with the heads off. It goes for miles. So never point it at anyone with the head/tip off. The five patterns are interesting and create a light show, especially when you wave your hand. Tried an 10mw black light laser and it is not much fun compared to this one.

Highly durable coating. I have hard fingernails and test the non-stick coatings on pans. Most will mar or scratch.Not these. Excellent durable quality, the benchmark to beat. Still use no metal utensils.The Chinese are also releasing more ceramic pans and even reinforced ceramic.Penny has a new Cooks ceramic pans too which come close for less.All these pans are way better than the outdated Teflon pans.I use these and the new terchnology Starfrit cast iron ceramic because it heats up so fast with a ceramic smooth-top stove.Starfrit 11 inch Light Cast Iron Fry Pan

I am an engineer who has been completely disgusted with the home lighting situation. There are no standards and many misstatements and counterdictions at the stores. I own a Minolta flash meter which accurately measures a lights color temperature. I've tried the bulb technology at Walmart, Sams Club Home Depot and Lowes. The most glaring examples:1) yellow light is called soft white (2700)2) very blue washed-out color light is called daylight (6000-6500)3) Low lumen (400-600 lumens) LED lights go for as much as $90!4) Some bulbs are advertised as white but the chart on the back shows its yellow. Go Figure!Here are the bulbs to avoid: all (harsh washed-out blue) daylight, and (yellow) soft white. The GE Reveal offers somewhat better clarity, but is overpriced and quite yellow.Full spectrum (5000-5500) bulbs are a step-up but stores offer a very limited selection. The Home Depot full 100w spectrum's beats the Lowe's Ott-Lite.On the LED front Sam's Club carries a 520 lumen, 4100K, 9 LED PAR38 reflector which has a easily noticeable smoother light spectrum. Great for the one light on in the kitchen in the evening. The equivalent $70 LED lights at the hardware store are hardly a bargain, as the Sam's is $20! However its Color Retention index (CRI)is only 74.The best of all are lights are these 5500K Alzo's. I've installed a 45w in the kitchen pantry and the color of the food boxes really pop. Food looks like it does in the magazines. The clarity is first rate (however 27w should be sufficient). They are the reference to which others are to be compared. My wife has not complained even when they are on at night-time. This is a first.Skin tones in the bathroom look very natural. A first again.Color temperature alone is not the sole basis to buy a bulb as a high CRI is also required. The Alzo's come in at 92, which is very high. Most manufactures do not even list this measurable figure (assume because its too low).I've been testing other bulbs. For vanity and lamps (Alzo does make any) these offer a VERY uniform ball of nice white 5000K glow. I ordered 12 for my new house's bathrooms:Maxlite 14 Watt G30 Globe CFL DL SKM14EGDLFor kitchen these are now the best 5000K PAR lights. Not as high of color quality as Alzo, but they don't make reflector lights!Maxlite 23 Watt CFL R40 Flood Day Lite SKR423FLDLIn summary best home lights are the Photo CFL which offer both a 5000-5500K range with a CRI over 90. Further these bulbs allow for brighter rooms, as compared to hardware store types. That is, the more pleasing light allows for greater brightness levels, so go for the 45watt bulbs in larger pantries or rooms.Thanks go to Amazon and Alzo for allowing consumers to purchase superior quality products at a price no higher than the unpleasant and unsatisfying bulbs in the store. Hope this helps!

The unit works partially as advertised and correctly receives and displays the current outdoor temperature, humidity, time and date.However all four days of forecast are wildly incorrect. The MSN weather source here in my large metropolitan area must be sending bogus data to the weather station. I've compared the WMS802 forecast to the local TV broadcasters and Internet sources such as AccuWeather. They are correct and the WMS802 is not.Investigation reveals that MSN Direct service is now targeted to the latest GPS mobile devices and annual subscriptions. For some reason these devices don't display the four day forecast. Further MSN Direct offers no support for Oregon Scientific owners. Oregon Scientific support says they will get back with you promptly - within SEVEN business days! Lastly MSN Direct charges $129 for a lifetime subscription fee for each device. Looks like Oregon Scientific customers are caught in the middle with no way out.I was hoping to eliminate maintaining my own outdoor sensor by purchasing the WMS802, but I have no choice but to go back. Finally the display is designed for desktop use only. Otherwise the text is too small.Update:A better method for receiving weather data is to use wireless Internet connection such as from the newest stations from La Cross Technology.

I am an engineer who has been completely disgusted with the home lighting situation. There are no standards and many misstatements and counterdictions at the stores. I own a Minolta flash meter which accurately measures a lights color temperature. I've tried the bulb technology at Walmart, Sams Club Home Depot and Lowes. The most glaring examples:1) yellow light is called soft white (2700)2) very blue washed-out color light is called daylight (6000-6500)3) Low lumen (400-600 lumens) LED lights go for as much as $90!4) Some bulbs are advertised as white but the chart on the back shows its yellow. Go Figure!Here are the bulbs to avoid: all (harsh washed-out blue) daylight, and (yellow) soft white. The GE Reveal offers somewhat better clarity, but is overpriced and quite yellow.Full spectrum (5000-5500) bulbs are a step-up but stores offer a very limited selection. The Home Depot full 100w spectrum's beats the Lowe's Ott-Lite.On the LED front Sam's Club carries a 520 lumen, 4100K, 9 LED PAR38 reflector which has a easily noticeable smoother light spectrum. Great for the one light on in the kitchen in the evening. The equivalent $70 LED lights at the hardware store are hardly a bargain, as the Sam's is $20! However its Color Retention index (CRI)is only 74.The best of all are lights are these 5500K Alzo's. I've installed a 45w in the kitchen pantry and the color of the food boxes really pop. Food looks like it does in the magazines. The clarity is first rate (however 27w should be sufficient). They are the reference to which others are to be compared. My wife has not complained even when they are on at night-time. This is a first.Skin tones in the bathroom look very natural. A first again.Color temperature alone is not the sole basis to buy a bulb as a high CRI is also required. The Alzo's come in at 92, which is very high. Most manufactures do not even list this measurable figure (assume because its too low).I've been testing other bulbs. For vanity and lamps (Alzo does make any) these offer a VERY uniform ball of nice white 5000K glow. I ordered 12 for my new house's bathrooms:Maxlite 14 Watt G30 Globe CFL DL SKM14EGDLFor kitchen these are now the best 5000K PAR lights. Not as high of color quality as Alzo, but they don't make reflector lights!Maxlite 23 Watt CFL R40 Flood Day Lite SKR423FLDLIn summary best home lights are the Photo CFL which offer both a 5000-5500K range with a CRI over 90. Further these bulbs allow for brighter rooms, as compared to hardware store types. That is, the more pleasing light allows for greater brightness levels, so go for the 45watt bulbs in larger pantries or rooms.Thanks go to Amazon and Alzo for allowing consumers to purchase superior quality products at a price no higher than the unpleasant and unsatisfying bulbs in the store. Hope this helps!

The unit works partially as advertised and correctly receives and displays the current outdoor temperature, humidity, time and date.However all four days of forecast are wildly incorrect. The MSN weather source here in my large metropolitan area must be sending bogus data to the weather station. I've compared the WMS802 forecast to the local TV broadcasters and Internet sources such as AccuWeather. They are correct and the WMS802 is not.Investigation reveals that MSN Direct service is now targeted to the latest GPS mobile devices and annual subscriptions. For some reason these devices don't display the four day forecast. Further MSN Direct offers no support for Oregon Scientific owners. Oregon Scientific support says they will get back with you promptly - within SEVEN business days! Lastly MSN Direct charges $129 for a lifetime subscription fee for each device. Looks like Oregon Scientific customers are caught in the middle with no way out.I was hoping to eliminate maintaining my own outdoor sensor by purchasing the WMS802, but I have no choice but to go back. Finally the display is designed for desktop use only. Otherwise the text is too small.Update:A better method for receiving weather data is to use wireless Internet connection such as from the newest stations from La Cross Technology.

Every hour an unidentified culprit was spinning up every mechanical hard disk and connecting to the Internet and sending data.For those who care about virus, malware and spyware this is totally unacceptable behavior.Not to mention needlessly wearing hard disks which I explicitly set to stay spun-down unless I use them.(This strategy will extent the life of 4TB+ drives indefinitely).So I used Resource Monitor and kept uninstalling each software app one application at a time. Then I had to wait until the next hour time to see if the hard disks still spun-up like clockwork.Finally the Samsung Magician process was identified as the malware. I disabled it in the Windows Task Scheduler.There is no discussion or user setting to disable this fragrant violation of owner/user privacy.If i am misinformed I will update this review. Please note I've disabled ALL other network Discovery etc, so no red herringsOnly disabling the Samsung Magician task stops this bad boy behavior.
The mesh is larger than a window screen - so many layers need to be used.This is hardly the "fine" mesh as described.I question the integrity of the five star ratings.
The cradle is NOT for the HTC Rezound as advertised. The actual product sticker states its for the HTC Sensation XE.The Rezound will not fit.The shipping is from England so returning is impractical.

For a set of sheets so highly rated I was not expecting them to be so full of wrinkles when taking them out of the dryer. They were still slightly damp. Disappointing.Same wrinkle issues with all cotton shirts. Manufactures may claim wrinkle free but they look less than ideal unless ironed. Who wants to iron sheets? I found a new and improved (soft luxurious feel) set of polyester sheets at Wally's for about the same price and my wife really liked them.

It is a bright laser with the heads off. It goes for miles. So never point it at anyone with the head/tip off. The five patterns are interesting and create a light show, especially when you wave your hand. Tried an 10mw black light laser and it is not much fun compared to this one.

Highly durable coating. I have hard fingernails and test the non-stick coatings on pans. Most will mar or scratch.Not these. Excellent durable quality, the benchmark to beat. Still use no metal utensils.The Chinese are also releasing more ceramic pans and even reinforced ceramic.Penny has a new Cooks ceramic pans too which come close for less.All these pans are way better than the outdated Teflon pans.I use these and the new terchnology Starfrit cast iron ceramic because it heats up so fast with a ceramic smooth-top stove.Starfrit 11 inch Light Cast Iron Fry Pan

I put these compensated saddles on my Fender Telecaster FSR and am very pleased with the results. The intonation is spot-on and the sustain is incredible. Perhaps most satisfying is that I still have that classic 'Tele Twang'. These are well-made attractive saddles. Highly recommend!

I should preface this brief review by saying I'm a huge fan of D'Addario strings for both my electric guitars as well as my acoustics. I own several of each and use many different gauge/type D'Addario strings. These extra light acoustics did not let me down. It seems I haven't lost any volume or tone by switching to these lighter strings. Thus far I've switched to these on two of my acoustics. I most likely will do the same next string change on my other two. As with all D'Addarios these are quality strings - they are indeed "warm, bright & balanced". Highly Recommend!

I own several of each and use many different gauge/type D'Addario strings. These extra light acoustics did not let me down. Fast Fret works wonderfully to clean strings and condition the fretboard between string changes. It couldn't be easier to use. This is one of those products you wonder how you ever did without.

This case is perfect for my Stratocaster - It is a very snug fit, which is what you want so your Strat doesn't move around in the case. The Douglas EGC-350ST is adequately padded (not as much as more expensive cases, but enough to surround your guitar with soft surfaces). Before putting my guitar in the case, I checked thoroughly to ensure there were no sharp objects in the case that my guitar could get scratched on, I did find one exposed staple however it was in the inside of the lid of the storage compartment and was flush to the surface. I love the size of the case, it is compact, yet there is room for picks, a strap & other small items in the storage compartment.It also has a very attractive tweed pattern on the case, in a nice shades of gold & tan - it is not yellowy like it appears in the photographs. All-in-all this is a very good case for a Stratocaster (I didn't try my Telecaster in it, but I imagine it would fit nicely as well.) It is light, compact, and perfect for my needs.

First of all this is an absolutely beautiful guitar! I mean it is stunning. However as my 8 year old daughter said to me today -"What's most important is how it sounds". Well this guitar sounds as good as it looks. I was not expecting it to be this good given the price-point this guitar sells at. I figured the pickups would probably be adequate, but no better. Boy was I ever wrong - the pickups on this 'Les Paul look-alike' are outstanding! The tones at each of the 3 positions of the selector are fantastic, the volume & tone knobs operate smoothly and just as they should. (The only gripe about the knobs are they do not fit flush to the body on mine, in fact there is quite a space as if the shafts are too long  Minor nit-picky gripe aside. I'm amazed that you can buy a mahogany bodied, maple necked (rosewood fretboard) guitar with body & neck binding, mother or pearl look fret-marker inlays, with a set neck, proper tuners, chrome or chrome-like covers over the dual humbuckers, and a gorgeous transparent purple finish at this price. Mine came perfectly set-up. All I had to do is tune it. The neck is well done, the fret ends are smooth, there are no dead frets and no fret buzz. IMO this guitar could easily sell for 2 or 3 times the price and still be considered a good value. Other than the 'too log' shafts on the volume & tone control of my OE20 the only other nit-pick worth mentioning is that the 3-way toggle doesn't feel as sturdy as it could, yet it works fine. Everything else feels like it would be at home on a much more expensive guitar (well maybe not the pickguard - it's fine but nothing special).If you are considering an OE20, my advice would be - go for it. This is a guitar that begs to be played. It's enjoyable to play for hours at a time. In fact you probably won't want to put it down. I know I don't.
This cover fits my Fender Frontman 25R perfectly. It appears to be well-made, and is just what I was looking for. Highly Recommended.

Anything that can help maintain my acoustic guitars at a proper relative humidity is okay with me. Having had a beloved Epiphone FT-120's neck warp after 38 years taught me a valuable lesson - don't let your guitars get too dry! After buying a new acosutic (a Yamaha FG710S) I decided to keep one of these Planet Wave humidfiers in the case at all times, as they came highly recommended. I use distilled water as recommended and moisten the sponge every 3 days or so as needed. When I'm playing the guitar I put the humidifier in a ziplock bag and store it in the case.I've had no issues using this humidfier & like it so much I bought one for my Epiphone as well (I'm planning on getting it repaired - as you just don't say goodbye to one of your favorite guitars after 38 years).Be sure to keep some replacement sponges on hand, and again use distilled water as recommended.

I wasn't expecting much from a cable at this price-point, but I was pleasantly surprised. The cable appears to be well-made, does not tangle and works fine. I use it to plug guitars into my amps & have not noticed any decrease in sound quality from my expensive cables. I may order a few so that I always have a cable at hand or in each guitar's case. I can't speak as to their longevity, it thus far I'm impressed.

Finally a comfortable pick that I don't drop! After using the same brand & style of pick since 1968, I've found myself dropping my picks more & more  in my old age. Let me tell you, it is both inconvenient & embarrassing to do, especially in the middle of a song. I decided I would try these textured picked (I prefer medium) and not only are they nice looking & comfortable, but I don't drop them! In fact since I started using these picks I haven't dropped one - not even once! I now keep a few of these Fred Kelly picks in each of my guitar cases. In fact I even keep one or two in my pocket for my frequent trips to the local guitar store. Highly Recommend!

When I bought my first electric guitar, a Telecaster, the sales person suggested the Fender 25R Frontman amplifier to me. However I decided to go with a Champion 40 instead, thinking I wanted something with a few more 'bells & whistles' as the Champion has many voices &  effects built into it. After I was playing a while the number of amps and guitars in my collection started going up as I added a Frontman 10 bedroom amp, a Champion 20, as well as a few Stratocasters and a Les Paul guitar. It seemed every time I went into my local guitar store to try out a few different guitars, I found myself seeking out that neat red amplifier with the nice reverb on it. I would pass by the expensive large amps with all kinds of features, and would plug into the 25R. I love the clear clean sound that they 25R amp provides in spades. At times a 25R wasn't available and I would plug into a much more expensive amp, but when one became available I would switch amps. I especially love the wonderful reverb. Also the overdrive & volume of this amp are very impressive. I also appreciated the straightforward controls the 25R has. Input jack, Rotary knobs for Volume, Gain, (a button to turn the drive/gain on or off)  Rotary knobs for Drive Volume, Treble , Middle,  Bass, & Reverb level - auxilary jacks, Foot Switch Jack, Earphone Jack, & Power (On/Off) switch - There you have it - all you need for great sound out of a 25 Watt amplifier. Again the sound of this amp is extremely impressive and I found it perfect to compare various guitars abilities for clean sound, overdrive, and of course the outstanding reverb that this amp has in spades. Finally I saw that fewer & fewer 25R amps were available and decided to get one before they were all gone. I called the manager of my local guitar store and he found me a brand new one still sealed in its box and had it shipped to the store for me. I have bigger amps, I have amps with a lot more features, but I find that my Frontman amps (both the diminutive 10, and it's impressive big brother the 25R) are the shining stars of my sound equipment. I truly find that the 25R is all I need in a home amplifier - excellent sound and excellent reverb. I highly recommend this amplifier - Get one before they are gone.

I am blown away by the quality of this case!  It is well-made, well-padded, looks terrific & fits my Epiphone Les Paul like a glove, (and my Les Paul looks terrific in the case as well). I only wish I could have found fitted cases like this for my Stratocasters & Telecaster. This is just a terrific case. When I first opened it I immediately noticed that there was no strong 'new case' odor. (I usually air out a new case for a day or two before putting my guitar in it. There was no need to with this case.) I really appreciate the 'safety latch' on the opposite side from where you open it, this looks like added protection from the case inadvertently flying open. The case also has a locking latch for security, however please note that it only comes with one key - another key would be nice, just in case (no pun intended). A nice touch is the very large, well-cushioned carrying handle which allows you to maintain a comfortable grip. The metal feet on the back & the bottom of the case are also appreciated - You can actually stand the case up on the floor without leaning it on something due to the feet on the bottom (I'd be worried a pet might bump it an knock it over though). As stated, the interior is very well padded, and it features a wonderful covered compartment in which to carry accessories such as picks, a tuner, a strap or an instrument cable etc.I really like the fact that because it is made for a specific model guitar, the Epiphone Les Paul case is no bigger than it has to be. You'll be surprised at how compact it is. Not only will this easily fit in the 'way back' of my SUV, but it will also easily fit in my convertible which I can't say for my large ABS cases that I keep my Telecaster & Stratocasters in. Granted the large ABS cases have lots of bins for storage inside, they are also heavy & more difficult to carry around, where this case is much easier to carry & has enough storage for just what you need to take along with your Les Paul Guitar.For the price paid I wasn't expecting such a nice guitar case. I was pleasantly surprised. Highly recommended!

The Epiphone Les Paul 100 is a lot of guitar for the money. First of all it has two wonderful humbucker pickups (at the bridge & neck), separate volume & tone controls for each pickup and of course the classic Les Paul 3-way toggle to select bridge pickup, both Bridge & neck, or neck pickup. It has a bolt-on neck (rather than a glued neck) which IMO is not a bad thing, it is a bit thinner than your typical Les Paul which makes it light (a good thing). Still for the $250-$300 usually paid for a Les Paul 100, you get proper tuners (which are very good) a nice finish (mine is Hertitage Cherry Sunburst) and the wonderful Les Paul sound in a well-constructed, nicely-crafted guitar. The 12" radius neck feels wonderful, and I found no sharp fret-ends on the rosewood fretboard. All controls work just as they should (volume, tone, pickup selectors) and the tones this guitar is capable of are wonderful.This is a guitar that although it is value-priced, it isn't and doesn't look, feel or sound 'cheap'. It's a guitar you can happily play for many years  and want to keep.What you don't get on this guitar that you might get on a higher priced guitar is as previously mentioned - a glue-on neck (this one is bolted on) fancy large inlayed fret markers (this has the usual dot markers common on many guitars) and binding on the body. The later two are more cosmetic than anything and doesn't change the fact that this guitar looks & sounds wonderful.I own many more expensive guitars, but I find that the Les Paul 100 is a very enjoyable guitar to play. My 8 year-old daughter refers to it as my "pretty" guitar, and indeed it is very nice-looking. The proof is in the playing, and this is a guitar that you won't want to put down. The lighter weight also makes playing very enjoyable and I've yet to experience a sore back playing (the weight is one of the reasons I choose this over other Les Paul models).Don't let the reasonable price fool you - this is a very good guitar that you won't be sorry you purchased -not a month from now, not a year from now & most likely you'll still be enjoying it years & years from now. It's that good & it's a great value. Highly recommended!

As with every Plant Wave Guitar Strap I have purchased, this one is great looking and very comfortable. The leather ends are nice & soft with no worries of marring your guitar's finish. The 'Red Bandana' design is well done. I high recommend this guitar strap.

First the positives - The Epiphone Slash AFD is nicely finished and even has body binding. The built in tuner (on the bezel for the bridge pickup) works well. The pickups are very decent, especially for a guitar at the price-point, and the sound is very good. It really is a nice looking guitar, comfortable in that it's a bit thinner and lighter than a standard Les Paul, and it is priced right. The gig bag is decent, but you probably would want more padding if you are going to be carrying it around much. The strap is okay, the picks are a nice touch.So why not 5 stars? Unfortunately, the guitar does have some negatives as well. First are the tuners - it has very low quality tuners and the guitar I received could not stay in tune, not even for strumming a few chords. The 'A' string was constantly out of tune. In fairness, the 'A' string's tuning peg felt like mush, so it could have simply been a defective tuner, but in any case - a better set of tuners would be in order. Secondly the strings the guitar comes with are not very good, not only that mine were covered with some kind of sticky substance. I don't know what the coating is for, but I would change the strings. Probably the biggest negative for me was the fret-ends were very sharp & rough needing a good sanding/polishing. Again it may have been this particular guitar as I have seen similar Epiphones with decent frets unfortunately the guitar I received was not one of them. As for playability otherwise, I had my luthier adjust the action because it had a great deal of fret-buzz and it did help quite a bit.Overall, it's an okay guitar that can be made better with a few modifications, and it is a decent but not outstanding value in my opinion.With a little work this could be a very decent guitar with a lot going for it, however if you spend a little more you can buy an Epiphone Les Paul with proper (better quality) tuners & separate tone & volume controls for each pickup. It depends on what you want/like. If you like the style of the Slash AFD Les Paul (and again, it looks great) it's not a bad guitar at all, but you'll probably want to change out the tuners & dress the frets.

This is one fantastic guitar. The build quality, fit & finish, features & playability & tone are all first-rate. I own a number of guitars including a Fender Deluxe Stratocaster & a Telecaster FSR and this Squier Deluxe Stratocaster can hold its own against it's Fender cousins. I absolutely love the HSH configuration. This beauty can play anything from metal to country, jazz & blues. (You can coil-split the humbuckers at the 2 & 4 positions) The locking tuners & 2 point tremolo are also wonderful features. The pickups are excellent and I wouldn't even consider swapping them out for pricier ones. The neck is beautiful, fret-ends smooth, and the Crimson Red Transparent finish is absolutely stunning, as is the flame maple top and the pearloid pickguard. Don't let the 'Crafted in China' stamp dissuade you - this is one exceptional guitar made by Fender. It's also an exceptional value. In fact, I doubt you could find a more versatile guitar at twice the price. If you're considering buying one, my advice is get one before they're gone.

These are great picks. I've trusted the Fender name and have been using their picks for nearly 50 years, and happily the quality is just as high now as it was back in the 1960s. Great colors, they feel good and they last. I use Fender picks on all of my guitars acoustic and electric.

The Road Runner RRDWA Dreadnought Guitar Case is a well-built, well-padded case that holds my Yamaha FG710S snuggly & securely. This case didn't have the typical odor that many new guitar cases have. Usually when I buy a new case I leave them open (empty) for a day or so to allow them to air out, I was pleasently surprised there was no need to air this one out.I own three Road Runner guitar cases (my other two are ABS Electric Guitar Cases) and I'm very pleased with their quality and the protection they provide for my guitars with their solid construction and abundant padding.

I bought these tuners as an upgrade for a Squier Bullet Strat HH. Off with the imprecise stock tuners and on with these excellent Fender American Standard tuners. Now my Squier's tuning has the same precision feel as my much more expensive Fender guitars. Upgrading to these tuners is inexpensive and worthwhile. The are well-made & look great too.

This cable not only looks good. It performs! Excellent cable that doesn't kink, snap, crackle or pop. Does what it is supposed to do and looks good doing it. No snarls or tangles means no-hassle use. Good to know it has a lifetime warranty just in case. I've yet to purchase a Fender product that disappointed me. Like all my other Fender products this is excellent in every way. Highly Recommend!

This is an extremely high quality, well-constructed instrument cable. I find they provide excellent sound without any issues at all I'd rather pay more for a premium cable and have no worries than have to be replacing cables often.  Mogami Gold cables are simply the best I've ever used.

This is an excellent stand. Very easy to set up. Extremely well made. I love how easy it is to adjust and how simple it is to fold.I was pleasantly surprised how solid this stand is. Highly Recommend.

I've been playing guitar 1968 and I've always liked Fender picks. Now that I'm an old geezer I still enjoy Fender picks and appreciate the fact that they come in colors that match my guitars. These picks come in great colors (I love the Lake Placid Blue & the Ocean Turquoise) and chances are you will find a thickness you like, whether it be thin, medium or heavy. In most cases I prefer medium, but it really depends on the guitar I am playing & the thickness of the strings. You can't beat these picks and you surely can't beat the price.

I've been playing guitar 1968 and I've always liked Fender picks. Now that I'm an old geezer I still enjoy Fender picks and appreciate the fact that they come in colors that match my guitars, such as these Ocean Turquoise picks (which match my Ocean Turquise Stratocaster). These picks come in great colors and chances are you will find a thickness you like, whether it be thin, medium or heavy. In most cases I prefer medium, but it really depends on the guitar I am playing & the thickness of the strings. You can't beat these picks and you surely can't beat the price.

Perfect tool for my needs! Compact size, the right size sockets for the jobs I need to do (especially the nuts on my input jacks), well-made, sizes etched in are easy to read & it easily fits in a gig bag's pocket or compartment in a hard case. If you own or work on guitars & amps, you will appreciate this very handy tool. I own mostly Fender guitars & amplifiers and this was just the tool I needed. No longer do I have to worry about loose nuts on my Strats or Tele, nor do I have to worry about scratching my valued guitars when tightening a loose nut. This tool is a good value that I highly recommend.

Given the mixed reviews here, I was curious as to how the Chord Buddy would work. Actually I was curious as to IF it would actually work, and this is what I've found thus far - Once you get the Chord Buddy installed on your guitar properly it works like a charm. I installed mine on a Squier Strat and found it was very easy to adjust properly. Within a minute or so I was playing chords easily and could work on my timing & strumming. Shortly thereafter I was playing LaBamba. I believe that it is important to make sure you install it absolutely in the proper position. I did find that it fits my Squier Strat better than the acoustic I also tried it on (although it does fit the acoustic, just not quite as well - a bit of string buzz, but still playable).I can't speak as to whether the Chord Buddy will actually help with finger dexterity (it very well could) or help actually learning to play the chords (it might) since I've had it less than a week, but it certainly helps me work on timing & strumming as I mentioned above.I do believe the Chord Buddy will be an excellent tool to get my daughter more interested in playing the guitar and that is definitely a good thing. I think it's a great idea, and time will tell how well it helps with finger dexterity. But for now I give it 4 Stars as it is easy to use and actually quite fun.
