I use it underneath my Keurig coffeemaker and paper towel holder that sit out on the RV countertop.  Neither have ever moved during travel - that's a testament to it's function.  The color was spot on for my needs and there's plenty in the roll.
I really enjoyed this book.  Several surprises along the way which I never saw coming.

It's ok, I could have saved my money and downloaded the exact same recipes by googling "Bundt Cakes" and sending them directly to my "Recipe Box" app on my iPad and iPhone which I'm unable to do from the Kindle version.
It won't tax the brain but for fluff, it was entertaining.

I read way to many reviews before deciding on this little gem.  I'm certainly glad I decided to get this thermometer, it suits my needs completely.  I don't use mine for grilling or oven use.  It's mainly used for testing the temperature of my milk and water for making sour dough starter.  For what I do, this serves the purpose.  I haven't had any problems reading the temperature or accidentally pushing the buttons on the back.  A great purchase!

We like the grill table too!  Not sure what the negative reviewers are expecting for something that is portable as well as easily set up.  We purchased the table for our Holland Grill.  The "lock down" feature was not needed so the fact that the table is for Weber products didn't deter us from ordering the table.  Once received and set it up, we were even more pleased.  It's very stable, attractive, easy to set up and break down.  We place a mat over it when not grilling and use it for many purposes while RVing.I can't comment on the lock down feature and how well it works as we don't have a need for it but overall, this was a great purchase.

I was hoping this would work for my baking needs and it has certainly proved itself worthy.  Today alone, I baked an Amish Friendship Bread Bundt Cake and six loaves of the AFB and used the Bundt Thermometer on all of it.  It sure beat the sharp knife method I've always used.  At first I wasn't to sure about it but quickly learned not to leave it in the cake but a split second to get a true reading.  I was leaving it in for to long and not getting much color.  Once I inserted it and pulled it right out, the tip turned red.  To double check the accuracy, I relied on my tried and true sharp knife test.  Yep, it was done.  This was a great purchase!

I have used this product for more years than I care to count.  I think it is a quality product with the desired effect I'm looking for - it works, no scent and a solid so there's nothing to stain clothing.  Simply put, it works!

I have four sets/3 of these.  I cook large quantities of homemade soups and freeze them for future meals.  These are the perfect size for holding three large servings of a hearty chunky soup or stew.  Clean up is simple and the lids are particularly tight and well fitting.  I highly recommend!Note:  I would not put them in the microwave for fear of etched staining.  But then again, I'm not a fan of any plastic in the microwave.
Very satisfied with these socks.  Would purchase again.

We bought this canopy to install over our hot tub to protect the cover from the sun as well as to keep the sun off of us while in the tub.  This canopy is well worth the price we paid.  Set up was fairly easy but it certainly took longer than three minutes.  We like the easy up frame with no loose poles to mess with.  The wheeled canvas storage bag is worth half the price of the canopy - this thing is nice!  Since our canopy will not be transported but remain permanently in place, we are trying to think how we can use the storage bag.  We are very pleased with the quality and function of this canopy.

I bought a pack of six in the red and came back and ordered two more packs.  These are the best dishcloths I have ever bought and I've bought plenty through the years.  I particularly love how they wipe up granite countertops without leaving a wet mess behind.  In addition, they dry so quickly after use.  I initially bought these to go in our RV but after trying one in the house, I kept back four to use everyday.If it's true that they don't smell as quickly I think it's due to their quick drying time.  So for now, I'm a big fan of these dishcloths!

Just what I was looking for and large as well.  I replaced an old Tupperware cake taker that had seen a better day.  I read so many reviews before deciding and I'm very happy with my choice.  I feel the snap closures are secure and it will hold any size cake I make including large Bundts and pound cakes.

Thank you to the person that wrote about his "Accidental Find".  I have been so frustrated with stainless steel appliance cleaners; sprays, creams, moistened towelettes, micro fiber clothes - name it, I've thrown my money away on ALL of them.  Something that I had right under the kitchen sink was the answer to my prayers.  Boos Mystery Oil does what no other did for me except mineral oil and even that was so messy but I did achieve the shine I was after.  The Boos oil is basically the same thing but it takes so very little to get that shine and then a light wipe with a clean rag and DONE - I love it!Oh, did I mention I use it as well as the cream to keep my large Boos board looking its best.  A little goes a long way and I much prefer it to drug store mineral oil.  When I treat my cutting boards, I apply the oil or cream and let it set in overnight.  Needless to say they look well taken care of and I highly recommend both the oil and cream.

I treat my Boos cutting board with both the oil and this cream.  I use the oil for quick jobs and use the cream when I can let it sit overnight.  By the next morning I lightly wipe with with a paper towel and I get the nicest deepest oiled treatment to my board.  I love my Boos board and hence, I treat it well.I also treat my olive wood cooking utensils with both as well.  I highly recommend this product!

I own this in the Anniversary Gold edition. I own several of the cake and muffin pans and each is very well made, high quality and produces perfect baked goods. The double handles makes removing from the oven so easy as well as flipping the cake out of the pan when done baking. Actually I can't think of anything I don't like about this pan. It does make for a large cake if your recipe calls for greater than a 12 cup Bundt pan.I simply love it!

Well, where has this been my whole adult life.  My feet have never been bad or really crusty but a couple of spots could use a bit of touch up.  This callus remover is a miracle gadget.  I have the softest, pinkest feet with very little effort.  This is easy and comfortable to use, no pressure needed.  Actually applying pressure will reduce its ability to do the job.  A light touch is all that needed - well, that and a towel as it produces a lot of white powdery skin.  I just run it along the area I'm working on and it softly sands away the dead skin.  I then apply a good body cream to my feet and done!  This is a wonderful product - love it!

These recipe protectors are excellent.  I have ordered many many packs as I made two recipe binders over the holidays.  I love the large deluxe recipe binder from CR Gibson.  I made one for myself and one as a Christmas gift.  I printed off all of the recipes with photos of the food and placed them all in these protectors.  The binders turned out wonderfully.

It works but I'm not thrilled with it.  The touch buttons are very difficult to push.  I contacted Kitchenaid about the issue and got very little support.  Basically they documented it or claimed to and that was that.  I wish I had returned it but for no more than I use it, I'll make do.  Doesn't do a very good job of chopping pecans.
Product as described.  It's just what was needed.

Not sure what some of the negative reviews are about but I found this egg separator to work perfectly.  I wanted one that could lay across a bowl to free up both of my hands and this fits the bill.  I do a lot of baking and wish I had this long ago.  I haven't lost either a yolk or white since using this.  I highly recommend it!

Outstanding!  I make a lot of sweet dessert breads and muffins and use only Nielsen Massey extracts.  One of my favorites is the almond extract and it taste wonderful in my Almond Poppy Seed Bread.  Yes you'll pay more but why would a person use imitation extracts in their home baking.  I wish I could find pure Coconut extract but evidently it's only available in the imitation.  If anyone reading this review knows of a pure coconut extract, please leave a comment.  I make a "to die for" coconut bread and I can only imagine how much a pure coconut extract could ehance my bread.  Just can't beat N/M extracts - I highly recommend!

I waited a long time to find a mister that actually works - this is that mister.  After pumping up the air the spray lasts as long as I need it to without having to pump a second time.  It's great for repeatedly seasoning my cookware with just a light mist.  The spray/mist goes right where I direct it with no overspray. I highly recommend this mister!

Very pretty and nice quality.  I'm using this as a reuseable doilie in my clear glass "goodie" jar that sits out on my kitchen counter.  It washes up easily for reuse.  It also makes a perfect hot pad next to the stove for setting a pot on.

bought this to use as a reuseable doilie for the inside bottom of an Anchor Hocking Montana 1.5 gallon storage jar that I use for "goodies" and it fits perfectly.  I make a lot of sweet dessert muffins, breads and cookies and keep them in the jar on the kitchen counter.  I was always tearing off a piece of wax paper to place on the bottom. I looked for paper doilies but saw this and thought - how perfect.  It fits a bit smaller than the bottom of the jar but I like that.  It has NO odor and washes up easily for reuse.  It comes in several colors and I'm thinking about getting a couple of different colors.

Just received this scale and from first impressions, I am very pleased.  It reminds me of my ipad. It seems well made, is very attractive sitting on the kitchen counter and is easy to use.  I wouldn't own a scale without the Tare function.  I particularly like the ease of use; simple and not cluttered with a lot of functions I would not use.  My one concern though is the display is very dim.  I'm hoping it's because it was very cold from the weather and that as it acclimates to the indoor temp and warms up, the display will become more intense.  This is my hope anyway.

I've been looking for a brownie spatula but not for brownies.  I wanted a small scale spatula to use for various situations.  Every one I looked at fell short in the appearance category until I happened upon this one.  It's exactly what I was hoping to find.  It's a quality looking spatula and I highly recommend it.

Nicely crafted scoops that match my Berard salt keepers.  These are larger than the tiny salt scoop that holds about a teaspoon.  I would guess without measuring that these hold some where between 2-3 tablespoons.  I particularly like the bulbous handle - easy to grab and hold.  I would recommend but know that they are not big scoops.

I have been looking at purchasing a pastry mat and was impressed with this one after reading the reviews.  Upon receiving it, I was not disappointed.  I have Sil-Pat baking sheets and this is right there with the quality of those.  This lays perfectly on my granite countertop and never moves while rolling out dough for my pie crusts.  I love it and highly recommend it!

First off, let me say that I measured out sea salt with this scoop and it holds just about a level teaspoon.  That being said, it is exactly what I was hoping for because I use the Berard olive wood salt keepers for my kosher salt and course ground pepper at the table instead of salt and pepper shakers.  This is so much better than sticking my fingers or anyone else's for that matter directly into the salt keepers.  Just a light sprinkle is all that's needed for our tastes.  The scoops are the perfect companion to the salt containers.  I would recommend the little scoop, just be aware they are tiny and may not meet your needs if you're looking for more than a teaspoon full.  Otherwise, great little matching scoop, I have another one currently on order.

WOW, now this is what a rolling pin should be, big, balanced, tapered and solid maple.  I've looked at this pin for quite a while but always thought, I'll get it later.  Well I finally ordered it and when it arrived I was more than pleased.  Be aware that it is long - 20", it does fit in my kitchen drawer because it pulls all the way out but for many people that don't have that option, a storage place will have to be found.  It's a quality rolling pin and I would highly recommend it.

Large and can handle any size kitchen utensil.  It is thick, has weight to it and very easy to wipe clean.  I've not had any issues with water spots but I do wipe it clean and set it back out on the counter.  It looks great with my stainless steel appliances.

Love these!  I revamped my pantry several months back and used these as well as the 1.5 quart size to hold all of my baking staples.  Gone are all the plastic containers.  I also bought the "Montana" style round glass storage jars in the larger sizes for storing flour, sugar, etc.  After the pantry was finished I ended up purchasing thirty nine glass storage containers.  The pantry turned out beautiful but what I like the most is the ability to see at a glance what I'm low on.As others have reported - do NOT lift these by the lid or you'll have a mess.  This is certainly not a deal breaker for me.
I usually add a photo ornament of hubby and I each year to our tree.  So fun when decorating to look back over the many years through these ornaments.
I have collected the Father Christmas ornaments for years.  I'm partial to the old time look and this one is beautiful.

I have bought many of these pet photo ornaments throughout the years.  I love decorating the tree and looking back at our beloved dogs that have passed.  So happy I have their pictures as cherished memories.

Love this little church and with a push of a button it plays "O Holy Night".  I've always loved Hallmark ornaments and this one is no exception.  This ornament does NOT tie into your string of lights but runs off of a watch battery.

Bought two of these stands to hold the C.R. Gibson 12"X11" Recipe Binder, one as a Christmas gift and one for my own recipe binder.  I love the simplicity of the stand and how it holds a very thick and heavy book securely.  It has a minimalistic footprint which I needed for the gift giving one.  I have one small issue as I read others do as well, that being the missing clear plastic "feet" covers.  One stand had all three of the pieces but the second stand was missing one.  Since one is for my use I will keep the stand missing the piece and give the other as the gift.  This is a very sturdy stand and I would recommend it.Suggestion: Quality assurance needed for the missing pieces.  I'm giving five stars for the quality of the stand but knocking off a star for the missing piece.

How I was hoping this stand would work as I have several spectrum items which I like very much.  After reading many reviews and the answered questions regarding what sizes it would hold, I'm very disappointed that it will not hold my C.R. Gibson Recipe Binder.  I carefully measured my binder and it was exactly 2" thick.  This stand could not accommodate that thickness so I'm having to return the two I ordered.  This is disheartening because one was a Christmas gift for my mother.  I have made the same recipe binder for her and was going to include the stand so she could display the binder as well as save kitchen counter space.

I love Orange Blossom honey and this is a favorite of mine.  I usually keep three of these stocked in my pantry.  I use honey in baking my sweet cornbread and sweet dessert breads.  It's also excellent in hot tea and to sweeten Greek yogurt.
Another excellent book by Sandra Brown.  I look forward to her new releases.

Very pleased with my new 2TB TC, set-up went smoothly, all of my devices quickly found the new network and all are running perfectly.  Did several speed tests with downloads in the 60's (30's before) and uploads running consistently around 8-10 (5-6 before).  I had an issue with my HP eprinter not connecting but once I manually went in and changed the network name, it found it and connected instantly.Overall, a very positive experience for someone who is router paranoid - we don't particularly like each other!

Superb!  This is a very elegant executive looking writing pen stylus combo.  For it's slimness, it's very comfortable in the hand.  Evenly balanced from stylus end to ballpoint end.  It's sleek with a bit of a texture giving it a satin look finish which I prefer.  I ordered the set of silver for myself and a set of black for my hubby.The micro fiber mesh tip is the best I have ever used bar none.  I'm not exactly sure what I was expecting but it certainly wasn't the smallness of the stylus tip.  My biggest complaint was I could never find a small enough rubber tip that I was pleased with particularly when using it on my iphone.  This mesh tip glides effortlessly over my iPad and only needs a soft touch when selecting or typing from the keyboard.  There is no sticking, dragging or leaving fingerprints.  The fiber mesh is soft and I have no fear of marring the screen's surface.The addition of extra tips that easily screw on and off puts this set over the top.  I simply can't recommend this product highly enough.  Clearly a lot of thought went into the design and functionality of this stylus.  High praise to the Friendly Swede!

I didn't want to wait to protect my new iPad Air 2 back so I ordered this because there were no others available.  I was skeptical about the fit and the frosted rubber material.  How surprised was I when I received this back cover and found a pretty nice product.  I've always had and thought I preferred the smooth acrylic clear hard back cases.  I actually like the feel of this cover and the most positive thing is that scratches are much less likely to show than the clear acrylic ones.I have the gold color iPad Air 2 and it clearly shows through as gold with the apple clearly visible as well.  I love the way the rubber totally encases the three sides of the iPad with my Smart Cover protecting the remaining side.  I dressed mine up a bit by attaching a silver "Scottish Terrier" jewelry piece off of a previous iPhone case onto the back.  You can certainly see that the back of the iPad is that gorgeous gold.I wouldn't hesitate in recommending this back case, just realize it's not a hard back case but since I don't tote my iPad around, it was not a deal breaker for me.Let me add, Luvvitt did a great job in getting these back covers out well before the stated availability and shipping date. KUDOS!

I bought this recipe binder for my printer produced recipes.  Upon ordering, I added four additional protector refill packs from C.R. Gibson which fit perfectly and are the exact same full page protectors that are included in the binder.  After giving some thought, I decided to order the "bundled" pack (includes the binder, page protector refill pack and the card refill pack) as a Christmas Gift for my mother.  My hope is that she will fill it with her treasured recipes that we have enjoyed throughout our lives and that after she passes, her recipes will remain in our family for every one to share and cherish her memory.  A keepsake gift for sure!This is a beautiful recipe binder with little stainless cooking utensils hanging in an inset on the front cover.  On the inside of both the front and back cover are helpful hints such as measurements and substitutions.  The tab separators are thick and sturdy.  The page protectors are a cut above the normal, thicker, not flimsy and a 8.5x11 page fits perfectly.  I feel for price you pay, you get a quality product.  I highly recommend this binder and the refill packs.Give the gift of memories this Christmas season.

Contrary to the other review listed here which, BTW isn't even for this top loading washing machine.  This is the best washer I have ever owned.  There are so many things I love about this machine but here are a few.*Slow closing lid*LOCKING LID - preventing opening*Super large tub capacity*Beautiful graphite color*Front controls*Sleek stunning looks*See through lid allowing you to see what's happening with your clothes*Minimal water usage*Minimal detergent as well as fabric softener*Stainless steel tub*Winkle free setting that tumbles laundry left in dryer at intervals for up to three hours*Self balancingWhat I love the most is your clothes do not sit in the water they've been washed in,  the washer drains and sprays clean water throughout the cycle.  I can definitely tell my laundry is cleaner and I'm quite impressed.

Bought this clock as a replacement for an identical one in our RV.  Twisted off the old and twisted on the new - good to go.  Did not even have to change the bracket out.  The finish is a light bronze where our old one was a brushed nickel look but this actually looks nicer with the RV finishes.  Very pleased with its looks, function and quietness.

I have the entire original Hallmark Lighthouse Collection and am now collecting the new edition.  I have a tree that is decorated with only lighthouse ornaments. I collect all types of lighthouses but am particularly fond of the Hallmark lighted ones.  This one reminds me of "Thomas Point Lighthouse" in Maryland with its shape.  These work with the new magic cord which I like because you don't have to plug into individual bulb sockets on your string of lights thus loosing that lit bulb.  I ordered this as soon as it was available and look forward to many more in the coming years.

Bought this 29" LG to replace a 26" Samsung in our RV.  We will be donating the Samsung to Goodwill - goodbye, good riddance!  We have a 47" LG in our home and have been most pleased with it.  Also have a 20" LG in the RV bedroom.  I recommend LG products as we've had no issues with any of the products we owe including kitchen appliances and new washer and dryer currently on order.  Nice product for the price!Ordered it on a Thursday evening, received it the very next afternoon via FedEx and primary shipping.

Nice thermometer!  We bought a new oven in May and I needed to check the convection oven.  I bought this thermometer and obtained an accurate reading of my oven.  I thought I would remove the thermometer once I checked my oven but decided to leave it hanging from one of the racks all the time.  Works well for my needs.

I make a lot of sweet loaf breads with glazes of which many call for citrus juices and zest.  I have very little strength in my hands and having a quality citrus squeezer is an absolute must.  After reviewing many squeezers I decided to spend the extra money and buy this one.  I am so glad I did!  Baking my breads is a true joy having this heavy duty kitchen utensil available to do the hard work for me.  I would highly recommend upgrading to this squeezer.  Well done Innovee!

I'll admit it, I've loved popsicles since I was a child.  I didn't need any of the fancy ice cream offered by the ice cream truck (telling my age) just give me a simple banana popsicle.  I'm on a health kick and thought making my own popsicles would allow me the freedom of enjoying different types of fresh fruit in popsicle form.  I tried little paper cups with wooden popsicle sticks but I couldn't fit it in my mouth to really enjoy a popsicle like you should.  In addition I despised the wooden sticks and having to buy them.After reviewing far to many popsicle molds I finally settled on the Zoku Classic Pop molds.  I am so glad I decided on these.  We've been making peach popsicles from fresh peaches we froze last summer and the molds have been great!  We love making peach sorbet in our ice cream maker but don't like it leftover and then frozen so we fill the popsicle molds with the leftover sorbet and freeze them - delicious!

I have the wired BP Monitor and loved it so much I thought I had to have the wireless one.  I ordered it directly from Withings and never could pair it with my iPad 4 or iPhone 5.  I have the Pulse as well as the newest WiScales and have had no issues with either one pairing up.  The instructions are minimal at best and indicated the initial light would be blue but mine was green leading me to think I had received a returned defective unit.  It would show that it was connected in my iPhone/iPad settings but would not pair up with the healthmate app.  It constantly would tell me to "reconnect" and therefore would never give me the option to inflate.It has taken MANY emails to get a response for the return and credit back to my charge card.  Withings finally sent me a return prepaid label and I returned the BP Monitor two weeks ago and have yet to hear if Withings received it.  I have sent numerous emails asking if they have received it with no response.  I have checked my charge card acct and no credit has been issued.  I love Withings products but the hassles with their customer service should not occur.  I will stay on top of the return until it is resolved to my satisfaction.  Also - there should be a phone number where their customer service can be reached, not by email only!  What's with that, Withings?I am staying with my wired version of the BP Monitor as I have no problems with it.  I really wanted to love the newest version but it was not to be, unfortunately.

We freshened up our master bath with new wooden window and shower cornices and got rid of a ruffled shower curtain and window valances.  We hung this shower curtain along with a liner in the white.  It's a heavy shower curtain which I love.  When I slide it across the curtain rod it stays where it's suppose to.  The white goes well with my painted white trim giving the bathroom a spa like appeal.

I own the WiScale WS-50 in the white and it is beautiful.  Being that I use it in my master bath, the white is perfect for not showing dust/powder, etc.  I had a few issues getting it connected to my wi-fi but once that was done it has performed flawlessly.  I love when I come out after weighing, look on my ipad/iphone and the app says "Congratulations, you reached your goal this week".  It's gives me a little boost of confidence.  Having the air quality and temp is an added feature that I thought "who cares" but now that I have it, I find myself paying closer attention to the readings.  Having all of the readings at a glance on the Healthmate App is great.I own the BP Cuff, Scales and Pulse and between all of my devices, I can monitor my health very closely.  I'm all about that!  They all perform the functions I'm looking for and now I'm waiting for the new wireless BP Cuff to be released and that will be mine as well.Thanks Withings for awesome products!

I'm very pleased with functions of the Pulse tracker but I do have a complaint about the display.  Mine is so blurred and fuzzy it almost makes me sick to my stomach looking at it.  No issues with auto synching.*Note: Somewhere in reading reviews I saw a question about the reliability of the clip lasting due to use and not finding any replacement.  Actually on Withings website they offer a package of three colorful clips for $14.95.  There is is a sky blue, orange and lime green one.  I ordered them and am pleased with the bright colors.  Easier to find if you lay it somewhere.

Pros:Chemical freeDetangles decently (not awesome, but my girls have curly, fine, wild hair).Cons:Greasy greasy greasy, even after diluting it 50/50 with water to see if it would help.No cap.Sprtitzer broke from regular, gentle, adult use within a couple of weeks so I've had to transfer it to other bottles to use it.I won't buy this again and wouldn't recommend it.Original Sprouts makes a better one, but i also have to dilute that or it makes their hair greasy.  I'm also not a huge fan of the scent, which is why I wanted to try this one.  I think I will go back to Original Sprouts.

The item I received is not the item I ordered.  The one pictured shows a separate syringe and separate medicine dispenser where the baby could suck as you push the medicine in OR you could just have the medicine part separate so they can just suck on it like a pacifier.  But I really wanted to be able to leave the syringe in so the medicine ONLY goes to the nipple and not the surrounding areas like other medicine dispsensers (I have the Munchkin one and meds get trapped around the rim.  The one I recieved is an all in one that I could buy at any Walmart, Target, etc.  I wanted the one pictured because it is separate and easier to dose small amounts.  The one I received is a white syringe with a clear pacifier nipple and the smallest dose amount you can dose out in it is 2.5mL.  I need one to be able to dose 1.25mL so this one is not even one I would order in the first place.  Also, the nipple part of this is HARD AS A ROCK.  No way an infant would find this appropriate to suck on and effectively get the medicine.SO disappointed.  I wanted the Mini Medicator pictured here and did NOT get that.

This brand of Brewer's Yeast tastes absolutely awful!I've been using Twinlab Brewer's Yeast daily for several years and LOVE it.  I ran out, couldn't find my brand, so bought this one.  I can't even stand it.  I put it in my oatmeal, tripled the amount of sugar I usually put in and threw in some milk chocolate chips just to try to help reduce the bitterness to no avail.It's disgusting!!  Go for Twinlab instead!!!

Adorable, functional, fits newborns!  I put it on my son when he was about 3wks old and close to 7 pounds.  I think it would have been too bulky on him at 5 pounds, 6 pounds might have been ok, but closer to 7 was perfect.I use Dandelion bamboo blend prefolds (trim and super soft), osocozy perfect fit cotton prefolds (bulky but work), Buttons inserts and Best Bottoms inserts.  All work well and this cover contains blowouts.Similar to Imagine covers.  The PUL on Rumparooz feels thicker than the PUL on Imagine covers, but they function the same, Imagine might have a little less bulk because of this.  I like both covers equally, but seem to grab Imagine more often.This print is adorable and brings me back to childhood.  I love all the colors.  There is a also darker magenta/purple color on it too that is not pictured and I love it.  Still very gender neutral if that is a concern.  (It's not in our house!)

The Rawr Imagine cover is absolutely adorable and does its job very well.  Rarely a leak, if I do, it's my fault or the insert is far too wet - my boy is a very heavy wetter.  Contains blowouts.  I put it on my newborn son starting around 3wks old once he was close to 7 pounds so this cover will fit most newborns.  I think I probably could have put him in it a little sooner, but I didn't have it until then.I've been using Dandelion bamboo blend prefolds in them (LOVE those!!!!  Super soft and mega absorbent while still being very trim!), first with a snappi and now (at age 2 months) just trifolded.  I also use Osocozy Perfect Fit cotton prefolds (much bulkier than the Dandelion bamboo ones!), Buttons hemp inserts, Best Bottoms hemp inserts, and Buttons microfiber inserts just laying in the cover because my favorite diapering system that I already have are Buttons and Best Bottoms (Buttons are superior for us) and it works well with those inserts too.  I do wish this cover had snaps so I could snap in my Buttons and Best Bottoms inserts, but other than that, I have been very pleased with this cover!  It does not have Flip style insides where you can kind of hold the insert in place with the top and bottom layer of PUL folded over inside - if that makes any sense!  If you know Flip diapers, you'll get it though and this cover does not have that.  I don't mind that it doesn't have this feature since my Buttons and Best Bottoms do not, but I do think the one-size version does - I have an Imagine one-size velcro cover and it does have the Flip style inside.This cover is very similar to Rumparooz.  The Imagine cover's material does feel differently than Rumparooz, but the fit and how they work have been the same for me. The Imagine's PUL feels a little thinner and less bulky than Rumparooz, which feels a little more substantial, but so far, it does not affect function or durability at all.  I think I reach for the Imagine covers more frequently.This dinosaur print is ridiculously adorable and even though I prefer my inserts to snap in, I plan on buying this print in the one-size version as soon as he outgrows this one because I am not ready to see it go!

Bought this in hopes of taming my girls ong, curly, tangly, dry, yet fine hair and wanting to stay on the more natural side.It did nothing to actually moisturize the hair (only made it greasy) and did not help with tangles.  First I tried using just the shampoo, their hair was too dry and tangly.  So I then tried with the conditioner - still wasn't moisturized, was greasy instead, and still tangly.It is over the top perfumy smelling and does not smell at all like mango, which I had hoped for, or even carrot.  When I first sniffed it in the bottle, it gave me an instant headache, but I figured maybe once it was mixed with water and then rinsed out, it wouldn't be so strong.  WRONG!  That perfume smell is insanely strong still 2 days out and even rinsing it another time.  I can hardly stand to have my girls heads near me right now!My 7 year old loves the smell because she says it smells like Grandma.Enough said.Except that it's cheaper at target online so if your'e going to waste your money/time, you might as well buy from there instead and be able to return it easier.

Bought this in hopes of taming my girls ong, curly, tangly, dry, yet fine hair and wanting to stay on the more natural side.It did nothing to actually moisturize the hair (only made it greasy) and did not help with tangles.  First I tried using just the shampoo, their hair was too dry and tangly.  So I then tried with the conditioner - still wasn't moisturized, was greasy instead, and still tangly.It is over the top perfumy smelling and does not smell at all like mango, which I had hoped for, or even carrot. That perfume smell is insanely strong still 2 days out and even rinsing it another time.  I can hardly stand to have my girls heads near me right now!My 7 year old loves the smell because she says it smells like Grandma.Enough said.Except that it's cheaper at target online so if your'e going to waste your money/time, you might as well buy from there instead and be able to return it easier.

7 year old daughter loves this set, but has complained about it being scratchy.  It hasn't bothered her enough to not want to use them, but don't expect a high thread count or soft quality.  I wish they made them higher quality, but it seems to be the nature of the beast when it comes to novelty items.
Absolutely adorable!!!!!!!!  My 7yr old was thrilled to get this.  It really is so very cute in person.

Bought this along with a sheet set for my 7 year old dragon obsessed daughter.  I was worried it would look too cartoon like, but she absolutely loves it!  It's HUGE and fits her twin bed like a comforter.I only wish it looked more like computer animations/realistic instead of like a cartoon, but that's MY issue - my daughter likes it just the way it is!

Looking for socks that would stay on and these do a great job, much better than regular socks.We get compliments absolutely everywhere we go on just how cute these are.  They are truly adorable.They still come up above the knee of my 9 month old, but I don't mind at all.  They still fit.  We were originally looking for thigh high socks, but had a hard time finding them in her size, so these were a great alternative.When wearing her in my wrap, these socks keep her lower legs covered when  the wrap makes her pants highwater on her.Love the grippies on the bottoms of the feet.The insides do not have a ton of loose strings like another brand I have (of thigh high socks) so that's a big plus for these.Highly recommend.

We use this in our Grace Travel Lite Pack n Play to give our baby girl a bit more cushion than the hard as a rock pad it comes with and we wanted to protect the original pad from leaks and spit up.This fit the bill perfectly.  We use changing pad covers as sheets for the Travel Lite since the sheets you can get for it are terribly scratchy and you can get much better quality changing pad covers that fit even better anyway!  This mattress is thick enough to add just a bit more comfort, yet thin enough that we have no problems putting fitting the changing pad covers we use over it.Perfect!  I am definitely going to try to find another pad like this to go with our full sized Pack N Play when she outgrows the Travel Lite, hopefully there is one, haven't checked yet!

We have tried every prescription steroid and non steroid cream and ointment and every natural cream and ointment out there for our 9 month old's eczema.  So far, the only 2 things that have worked are Aquaphor for the painful flare ups and Mustela Lipid Replenishing Balm for healing and maintenance.The scent is lovely, though I wish it was scent free.  It's very soft and doesn't last, I only smell it when I put it on her.  Almost a vanilla type of scent.This actually gets her rough, scaly patches all smooth and beautiful like her sweet baby skin should be!Check your local T a r g e t store first though because it's cheaper there.  About $22 in the store compared to $29 here.

I had no idea this shipped internationally.  My daughter wears a size 6 so I wanted the 7-8 for her to grow into.  It's more of a small size 6.  I wanted to return it only to find out that I'd have to pay international shipping to do so....  Was not thrilled about that.  Ended up keeping it.She never used it because it was supposed to be part of her Halloween costume that I knew she'd want to wear for a long time, but due to the size, I didn't want to use it for that purpose.  I ended up buying a white hoodie from another amazon seller for MUCH less expensive and dyeing it to the shade I wanted instead.It was $24, which is way too much to pay for a simple sweatshirt, but I really wanted that color for her DIY Vanellope von Schweez costume I was making for her.  Wish it would have been a more accurate size and I also wish it hadn't taken several weeks to be delivered.  I had no realized it was shipped from England or I would never have ordered it because I needed it quickly.  It arrived the day after Halloween so I ended up not needing it at all anyway.  Thankfully I had dyed the other sweatshirt I ordered (after this one!) from a US seller just to cover my bases.  I wanted to be able to compare the colors and then choose and possibly return this one if I liked my dyed one better.  But since returning it will be a hassle with even more money spent, I'm just not going to do it.  Maybe I'll resell it here at a yard sale though I know I can never come close to getting the $24 I paid for it....

Was hoping for a good substitute for Aquaphor for my 9 month old's out of control eczema.  We have to use Aquaphor 5 times per day all over her body (including her scalp) in order to keep it under control.  (Yes, we've tried everything else, prescriptions, diet, laundry, etc and Aquaphor is the only thing that helps.)  I was looking for something to replace Aquaphor since we tend to use mostly natural products in every aspect of our lives and weren't too keen on using Aquaphor so often.The scent is nice, I do like it a lot.I like that it absorbs very well, however that's also the reason I really don't like it.  I can't see how it would be a good barrier ointment since it simply absorbs.  Our daughter's skin was dry, peeling, and red (her normal skin without aquaphor) after lathering her full of this.  When we use Aquaphor, after just one application, her skin improves.  But we've almost used this entire bottle, which has only lasted a week, and it has really done nothing for her skin at all.I would not recommend this for those looking for a more natural Aquaphor substitute.**** UPDATE ****I still don't recommend this as a good natural substitute for Aquaphor, but I did find one that is pretty close:Burt's Bees Multipurpose Ointment.  Aquaphor still works best, but I like that I find I'm not using it as often.

Bought this for my 9 month old.  I have many friends who advise against buying from amazon and have places they recommend, but with our daughter cutting 2 top teeth and 2 bottom teeth at the same time, I was at my wit's end and wanted them fast, so amazon prime to the rescue!The necklace is too long for my 9 month old.  She can pull it up over her face.  My friend's kids necklaces are not this long and they've never had to shorten them at all.  They aren't constantly pulling it back down from their kid's faces like I am.  After just a few days, I took it off of her.  I started wrapping it around her ankle and putting a sock on over it to keep it there, though I can't let her nap like that because she could easily pull the sock off and get the necklace off that way.I kinda feel like I was ripped off.  This is my first amber necklace so I wasn't sure what to expect.  A few of the beads looked like the "raw" unpolished parts were coming off, revealing clear beads, not quite sure what that means.  Are they not real amber?  Did they coat some other bead to make it look like amber?  Like I said, I'm not experienced with amber, but I've never heard my friends say anything like this.She did seem more comfortable after several hours of wearing this, but I can't say whether or not it was related to the necklace or if her teeth were just feeling better.

Great for organization and the protection of those precious baby teeth.The materials are VERY sturdy, the clear plastic covering the tooth slots is strong!  Strong enough so that if you have the tooth not quite in the slot and the plastic (which is kinda hard to move) slides over the tooth, the tooth will break....  (yes, one of her beautiful baby teeth split right in half because it had popped up when I was trying to slide the plastic cover over it and it just snapped in half.)Love that it has a zipped case.  It also has a ribbon on the zipper, which is handy because I hide this in my closet between stacks of clothes and the ribbon is the only part I have sticking out - therefore, I know where it is and it's easy to grab, but my daughter has no clue.Speaking of which, this case seems to be designed FOR your child, as in, your child apparently should know that all their baby teeth are going in this album.  The Tooth Fairy takes all of her teeth, so this case is really for me, and possibly for her as an adult, so I wish it was geared more like a baby book instead of geared towards the child in their childhood years.The artwork on it is UGLY, I'm not a fan at all of the crazy eyed cartoon kids with gigantic heads.  I would have preferred just a simple cute tooth or maybe even just a plain case but no other tooth cases that did have much more muted artwork were this quality.  I haven't compared the size to an actual cd case yet, but they are pretty close so maybe I'll get a cute cd case and swap it out somehow.  It's just so ugly!

I love Rachel's blog/facebook posts.  The blog posts tend to be a little long and I have to admit, it takes me a few sessions between caring for my kids and other household duties to read one in its entirety (ironic since she's so "hands free" and present with her kids and still manages to write something that long and so often, but I can't even read one straight through), but they are beautiful and usually worth the read with a lovely reminder.  I was so excited she was coming out with a book, though I did question it since it seemed like she had just started her blog and I worried it would just be a compilation of her blog posts - which also would have been ok, honestly.  But reading the book left me rolling my eyes more often than not with a "HA, yeah right..." when thinking about incorporating some of the philosophy into my own kid's lives.  Maybe it was just too much sunshine and butterflies and perfect days rolled into one book, not allowing the parent to feel normal emotions or dealing with every day frustrations - when reading her blog posts, it was usually broken up into once a week or so and it seems more helpful.I think most of us who are looking to go hands free already understand that we're possibly lacking in a few ways as parents and truly want to make things better for ourselves and our families.  Reading this can kinda make you feel like the worst parent in the world for not doing these things.  Sensitive response, maybe, but I'm a realist.  Every day isn't going to be perfectly lovely and this book seems to ignore that or if you aren't having a perfectly lovely day, then you must be doing something wrong because you should be able to find something perfectly lovely about that day.  I know, we SHOULD try to find that perfectly lovely something every day, but it's also very ok acknowledge all the situations and emotions that might not be peachy every day too.  We can't ignore the "bad" stuff every day, that's not living, that's pretending.  Her blog seems more realistic in nature than her book.  While her posts do tend to get repetitive (understandable since how many ways can you say "enjoy the moment"?), the book was a bit excessive.I was hoping more for a guide, not something more like her blog.  Which is great, I love her blog, she tells incredible stories and is a great writer.  But I wanted a guide and there wasn't really much in the book that I wasn't already doing.  Maybe I'm not as addicted to devices as others?Another thing that rubbed me the wrong way was she mentions is her religious belief as the basis of all of this and instead of using an "i feel/believe" phrasing, it was more of a "God is" and that's that type of phrasing which can leave those with other beliefs feeling a bit judged if that's not what we believe.  I've never seen her mention religion in her blog and this is why it surprised and slightly disappointed me.  I understand everyone has a right to write a book based on their beliefs and I am very supportive and embracing of all beliefs, but like I said, I wasn't aware that would be in this book as she had given no hint of this in her blog posts (on facebook) so it caught me off guard.Maybe this would be a good book for those that do not already read her blog or for those that are so truly addicted to their devices - therefore these stories may just snap you offline.  I would recommend this to those people.  The stories can be really lovely reminders, but maybe not all in one sitting/book.  But I wouldn't recommend this to those that already read the blog or already like her on facebook.

Buttons vs. Best Bottoms reviewFirst things first:  Best Bottoms inserts are compatible with Buttons diapers!  LOVE this, because I prefer hemp inserts and Buttons have not made a hemp insert yet.  (Speaking of inserts, I prefer Best Bottoms inserts over Buttons inserts - the Buttons inserts bunch up more than Best Bottoms do.)Double gusset awesomeness.Buttons covers (2 layer PUL, just like Best Bottoms) are SO soft even though they are thicker and more durable than 1 layer PUL covers.  Best Bottoms are also 2 layer, but are much stiffer and noisier - if you pat baby's bottom with Best Bottoms on, it's loud, I know that sounds like a silly thing to rate a diaper on, but I much prefer my diaper options to be more discrete/quiet.Buttons covers are slightly stretchy, whereas Best Bottoms aren't for the most part, so I feel like I get a better fit with Buttons.Buttons covers are less bulky than Best Bottoms - this says a lot because Best Bottoms are some of the trimmest diaper systems out there!  Buttons is even trimmer, I think due to the fabric being just that much softer/moldable.Buttons covers seem to last longer than Best Bottoms.  I have a Best Bottoms cover that I purchased the exact same time as a Buttons cover - the elastic in the Best Bottoms cover has relaxed while the Buttons cover still looks like new.One of the hip snaps on one of my Buttons covers is starting to lose its snapping capability, however, my baby has an unusually trim waist and we've been using the same hip snap since she was 6wks old, she is now 8 months old.  I just use other snaps, so while slightly irritating, it's not that big of a deal at this point as I know we won't be using that snap much longer anyway.  I haven't contacted Buttons yet about possibly replacing the snap - I would like to replace it since I plan on selling these once she is potty trained.  On this same cover, there is also a small tear on the PUL on the inside of the diaper at a snap that holds an insert, this tear happened within a couple months of purchase.  Doesn't cause any leaks since this is a 2 layer PUL and the tear is basically under the snap - you can only see it when unsnapping an insert.  I do not have any tears in the PUL on the Best Bottoms diapers, so Best Bottoms PUL may be more durable.  (I still prefer Buttons and still consider them a 5 star cover.  My other Buttons covers are slightly newer, but have had no issues with them in the months I've used them and believe this is an isolated problem with just the one cover.)I have this in Pebble, Sweet Pea, Snow, Blueberry, Purple, Strawberry, Acres, Tangerine, Thicket, Cherry, Peony, Marina, Charming, and Banana Cream.We rarely have leaks.In addition to Buttons and Best Bottoms, I have a Rumparooz cover, a Lotus Bum cover, and fleece covers.  I also have fitteds (which I also like a lot), pocket diapers (my least favorite), tons of flats, some prefolds.  I always grab Buttons first.  Always.*** UPDATE ***My baby is 9 months old now and crawling all over the place.  She does get slightly irritated on the tops of her thighs from the PUL that is exposed to her skin and rubs there when she moves.  Once I realized this, I just started tucking that part of the "wing" in so the outer fabric is what rubs there, not the inside PUL.  Simple and does the trick.  Just wanted to mention this in case anyone else wanted a simple fix for this scenario.**** UPDATE AGAIN ****My baby is 15mo old and we still LOVE Buttons.  Pretty sure we are going to sell every other diaper we have and just stick with Buttons.Their customer service is phenomenal.  The slight tear in my Pebble cover eventually made the whole snap come out.  That same week I had ordered some new covers from them and one of the hip snaps popped off.  I sent a friendly email with a pic of the covers that the snaps had come off of and asked how to go about replacing them.  She right away emailed back and I had new replacement covers within 5 days - I didn't even have to send the ones with faulty snaps back!  That was a HUGE plus for me since I live out of town and getting to a post office is a pain.  LOVE Buttons!!!!!!!!

The socks are cute.They stay up like they should with minimal rolling.I wouldn't buy this again due to the massive amounts of loose-like string on the insides from the polka dots.  The overall length and the feet are also a bit big for my almost 17 pound 8 month old, the rest fits just fine.I have a similar product (juDanzy knee high) with all kinds of cute details like fake shoelaces and they do not have the copious amounts of loose/bunched strings like this one does.

My 6yr old dino loving daughter and I absolutely LOVE this book!We laughed out loud on every page due to both the illustrations and the words.The illustrations are awesome and very interesting and detailed.  We continued to find things we hadn't noticed before when reading it again.  (And again, and again, and again, and again!)Of course, this book invites the question, "Mommy, did Santa REALLY use dinosaurs before reindeer?"I like to think he did!

I was so disappointed when I opened it.  I thought it would be a prettier pinkish/purple and instead, it's more of a light burgundy-ish shade.  I also thought it would be a little shinier and it's very very flat, there is no sheen to it whatsoever.  The purple designs are almost a gray/purple, not nearly as vibrant as they appear in the picture.I wish I had looked at the customer image before ordering it because I never would have ordered it.I should mention, I want it for a baby wearing wrap, not for a tablecloth, so my preferences may be different than those looking for a tablecloth.It's a sturdy material, which is great, just wasn't the color I thought it would be.  Not even close.Bit of a bummer.  Now I'm wondering if I should bother returning it or if I should try a different one to get more of a look that I want.** Update **Decided to keep it since my other daughter really likes it and I'm making her a wrap from it as well.  After I cut/hemmed, washed, and dried it, the length (which wasn't part of hemming) shrunk from 120 inches down to 108!  I was a bit shocked at how much it shrunk.  I expected a handful of inches, not 12!  Yikes.  However, it still works as a great shorty wrap.  Very comfortable, soft, and baby agrees - sleepy dust in these for sure!  I prefer the reverse side of this, the grayish/purple is very pretty with the burgundy pink stitches showing through.  This will probably be a "car wrap" for me since it's a lot shorter and I don't have to worry much about it dragging on the ground in parking lots.  I kinda wish I had chosen a different color, but this one has grown on me after the initial disappointment in the actual color.

Wanted this to make it a "tooth fairy door" in my daughter's room.  The heart cut out is just way too crooked, I just can't handle it being a permanent fixture in her room.  Will be returning it and trying to find a similar one locally, in person.

Strong citronella-type scent.  I used these daily on my dogs while visiting some family that are not used to any doggy smells and had hoped this scent would be pleasant.  It's really not a very nice scent!  I saw reviews mentioning the scent is strong/not pleasant and I wish I had listened and gotten the unscented version or maybe tried the mango one.  Scents are not usually a deal breaker for me, but I truly don't want to use these anymore.  Maybe I'll save them for the summer time in hopes that the citronella-like quality of it will help repel mosquitos when we're outside.  ;)These wipes get dirt off just fine, but I need them to do more than that.  My dog has oily skin and most other bath wipes can cut the grease, but these do not.  That is what ultimately made me not care for this product.The scent lingers on their fur for quite a while - if you like the scent, that'd be a good thing.I just wish it could cut the grease in my dog's fur from her allergies.

I can't even express how beautiful this is!!!!  I didn't even notice the cute bow on the faux belt until I got it, it's so adorable!  Nice and cozy, warm, good for snow since it's actual winter coat material and not just fleece or microfiber like so many other prams, it's an actual snowsuit.Only a couple things I wish it had:  I wish the feet were detachable so she could use it a little longer since I'm afraid she may outgrow it before winter is over.  My other minor issue is that I wish the zipper was not straight up and down as it creates the bulky "ripples" like all coats do and for babies, it's just too much.  I've seen others at places like One Step Ahead that have zippers going from one shoulder down to the opposite foot to help with this.Decent price, but wish it had the other features like some of equal price have.  However, this is not much more than the non-snow play prams you can buy at local stores made of fleece/etc.She is 6mo old, 14 pounds 10 ounces right now, and it's a bit big on her, which is what I had hoped for in the 6-9mo size, so we're good there.

I am a Veterinary Technician.  My American Pit Bull Terrier has had incontinence issues since about a year or so after she was spayed.  She was spayed at 10 months old.  For the first 4-5 years, she was on PROIN, but we kept having to increase the dose to see results and eventually, the effectiveness of the drug seemed to wear off.  She never had a negative reaction while on it, but she started to refuse to take it and we got tired of jamming those huge tablets down her throat twice a day when it wasn't even working 100% anyway.  We have just been cleaning up the dribbles as we see them and washing the dog bedding frequently - she usually loses control while sleeping/resting and it's almost always on the dog beds or in her fave place to lay in our kitchen on the rug in the sunlight.  So while irritating and a lot of work, I thought it was better than her being on a drug with potential reactions.  But oh the puddles...they have gotten so large this year (she's turning 9 soon) have gotten out of hand.  She was waking up covered in pee and our other dog started getting covered in pee too if she slept on the same dog bed.  So we were bathing both dogs nonstop and washing bedding nonstop.  So tired of the smell of pee.  We were ready to rip our hair out.  She also has skin allergies and last year (after trying everything else) decided to go grain-free with her and have seen a huge improvement in her skin snice then.  I was afraid to introduce any supplements that might have grains so all tablet versions were pretty much not an option, not to mention, it's irritating to shove tablets down throats and I didn't want to deal with that if I didn't have to.  I was even nervous about this one, but decided to give it a try.We (hubby too, one who doesn't like to spend money on the dogs) are SO GLAD we gave this a try.  She's been on it for 3 weeks now and we started noticing the puddles were gone within a few days of the 3 times daily dose.  She still dribbled, but no more lakes.  That was awesome enough for me to be really excited and would have been content with just that result alone!  Within a week to 2 weeks, the dribbles were gone.  Now, she's down to the twice daily dose and we are still seeing no dribbles.  She doesn't reek of pee, the dog beds don't reek of pee, it's absolutely awesome.  After years of struggling with this, we have finally found something that is doable for her and us and it works!I couldn't be more pleased!I don't know how on earth people manage to get their dogs to take this on their food or in their water though!  Mine HATES the taste.  To avoid having her taste it as much, I put the drops in her closed mouth along her gums towards the back of her mouth, kinda just opening her jowls to do it, wait for her to swallow a couple of times and bam, done.  Easy.  She doesn't mind taking it that way.  I tried putting it directly on her tongue and she hated it, so I won't be doing that again!  Also, I thought maybe I could mix this with the coconut oil that she eats daily for her skin...Leaks No More does NOT mix with the coconut oil - I melt the coconut oil and put the dose of it she needs in ice cube trays, let it harden, and it makes it super easy to give her the coconut oil daily by just plopping the hardened perfectly dosed amount onto her food (instead of spooning it out every day, that got old quick!).  Well, when I tried to put the Leaks No More drops into the melted coconut oil, it went straight to the bottom.  When the coconut oil hardened, all the drops were on the bottom still and did not mix with the coconut oil.  I wasted about half the bottle of Leaks No More trying that, whoops...  So don't do what I did!

Love that you get these all together in one box (in their single dvd cases).  Perfect if you don't want to buy each one separately and it is a good deal.Here's what you get:*Creature Adventures* - 2 discs in single dvd caseMom of a CrocWhale of a SquidAardvark TownFlight of the DracoMystery of the Squirmy WormyPlatypus CafeBuild it BeaverVoyage of the Butterflier XTHoney SeekersBass Class*Jungle Animals* - 1 discWalk on the WetsideA Huge Orange ProblemBirds of a FeatherGoogly-Eye:  The Night Guru*Predator Power* - 1 discStuck on SharksMimicLittle HowlerRaptor Roundup*Lost At Sea* - 1 discSpeaking DolphineseBlowfish BlowoutI'm not a fan of the fact that they are coming out with discs with only 2 episodes on it...that's very inconvenient.  However, we love the series (my 6 year old girl is their biggest fan!) and we will continue to buy them, so it's not that big of a deal, I just wish they'd consider how inconvenient it is, not to mention wasteful of resources.  I love that the Creature Adventures 2 discs have 5 episodes per disc and think they should continue that way, instead of just 2.  I see that the Rainforest Rescue dvd (NOT included here) also just has 2...Love that the dvd cases fit into the cardboard box/sleeve making travel with them much easier.

Very similar to Play-Doh in all aspects, except one very important feature that has always driven me crazy with Play-doh:  The lids on the Alex Toys Dough has a tab you push up that makes getting the lid off much more user friendly than Play-Doh!  PERFECT for younger kids.  My 5-6yr old loves how easy it is to open and that she can play with play-doh whenever she wants to without having to ask for help.
Pretty colors, super soft.Fits our contoured changing pad, but also fits the Graco Travel Lite mattress, which is awesome.

We use ours for playing with Play-Doh on the living room floor.It's a great size for our 6yr old to be able to sit on and create with play-doh without getting play-doh in the cracks of the hardwood floors.  Now that I'm thinking of it, we should be using it while she paints as well.Quality seems great, I don't fear holes/tears.

This is my second one though not necessarily this brand. I had one I purchased a number of years ago and don't even remember where I got that one. But, it was soiled beyond use and I threw it away.I have a new dog now and needed another one. The price has come down on these so I was pleased. I think even if I didn't have a dog, I would like these because they really protect the seats.I can feel good about having the dog in the car, knowing that they won't fall to the floor and that they are comfortable and safer; and that the seats are protected, too.If you've never had one of these and you have animals - they are a must-have.

Now this is a cutting board I love and I have a number of cutting boards of various shapes, sizes and materials.I recently purchased the niftiest rolling kitchen island ever, at, of all places, Big Lots. The kitchen island has a drop-leaf stainless top, that, when opened, has a 30 inch top - perfect for all my kitchen projects, that also enables a stool to fit underneath for me to sit. I wanted the right size cutting board to work with on top, but that would also store perfectly in the cabinet. This one does the trick. I love the "juice groove' that is on one side of the board - perfect for capturing the juice when I'm cutting a pineapple or anything juicy.The rubber feet make it non-slid to hold it in place and I couldn't be happier.

Why has it taken me so long to get a good magnifying glass to have on hand? Boy, once you have one, you'll wonder how you did without. This is really handy, and I love the wide angle area for viewing. The handle is great, since you can position it a number of ways, depending on what you're doing. It folds compactly and tucks away in a drawer for when you need it.A great household item that would surely make a good gift because it's something people don't necessarily think about but when they have one, they are glad they do!

Since I bought it to wear under my clothes for warm layering, it doesn't really matter much how the fit is. Otherwise, it would kind of bug me that the armpit areas 'gap' funny.I like that the cami is stretchy so that it clings close to your body just enough that it doesn't get tangled with your sweaters and blouses. This gives the right amount of warmth when needed.It would also be comfy to sleep in.It looks really pretty on and the lace is nice and stretchy too. The neckline is great - I can wear it with most of my blouses without the lace showing.I would recommend and would probably get more to have on hand since they are versatile.

This worked just perfectly for what I needed it for. I cut a piece that was 3 x 3 feet to lay on the dirt where I am putting my Square Foot Garden. This will keep the moles from being able to come up from under the garden and eat my plants from below the ground.I have plenty left over that will do fine for any household product.For the price and convenience, you can't beat it.

The embroidery was nice - they did it accurately - and the lettering looks good. However, as I adjusted the collar to the proper length (I ordered the medium), then the buckle covered up some of the embroidery. It would've made more sense to begin the stitching farther to the left, so that you could adjust the length and not cover up any of the lettering.The collar was narrower than I would've preferred and the snap closure much smaller.I don't think I will be using it as a primary collar, unfortunately.

It's a winner! If you have a cat or even a small dog, get this!As a matter of fact, this technology has made me decide to go get a throw blanket at Bed, Bath and Beyond that uses the same type of technology.Why should just the cat be comfortable? LOL

My favorite pair of fleece-lined jeans are actually ones that I've bought twice before at Walmart. They are the (men's) Wrangler Carpenter Relaxed fit jeans, for $24.99 and they are won-der-ful. But, they were no longer available online and not available in any of the stores nearby, so I headed to Amazon.First, let me tell you the pros and cons of the Wranglers:Pros:They are toasty warm. I've worn them in 5 degree weather and was perfectly comfortable, and yet wore them in the office on casual days and was not uncomfortable at all.They are soft and move WITH your body, not clinging to your body for easy movement up and down stairs, bending, working in the yard, etc. In that sense, they were as comfy as pajamas.They looked good on.Price! At 24.99, they were a steal! And one time, I bought them on sale for $19.99!Cons:They are HEAVY. No kidding. It may seem contradictory to my 'comfortable' comments, above, but, you can easily add 3-5 pounds on your body wearing them. The extra weight was noticeable for me.I realize I had lost a 'little' bit of weight, but aside from that, it seemed that the waist stretches out and the fit gets loose, so getting a correct and consistent fit in the waistline is something to look for.On Amazon, I chose the Carhartts for my replacement because of the name. When you see people who work outdoors for a living, what brand of clothing do they usually wear? Carhartts. So, it must be good for cold weather. But, at more than DOUBLE the price, I was hesitant to give them a try.Here's my take so far:Pros:They look nice and they fit well. The waist is just as it should be. They washed and dried well. They are regular weight, and feel no heavier than 'regular' jeans, so I don't feel like I'm walking around with barbells on.Cons:Expensive. This may appear contradictory to my weight comment, above, but they are so lightweight; and the fleece lining so much thinner than the Wranglers, I don't know how it would keep me warm in frigid weather. It's not cold enough outside yet for me to put to the test - let alone 5 degree weather to make the comparison! But, the lining of fleece is much, much thinner.Comfort. They don't move with the body at all. When I walk up the stairs, I have to use my hands to "hitch" them up, otherwise, they grab my knees. The same is true when bending, kneeling or any movement. I wonder how, then, would this be for a 'working man' outside when the movement is not as giving?When the temps drop down to the teens and below, I'll update my comments, but for now, this is my review and I hope you find it helpful.If you're lucky enough to find the Wrangler Fleece Lined jeans in your area - snatch them up! Maybe you'll like those better. If warmth, price, and mobility is foremost for you, you'll do better with those.

Why did I forget all about Corn Huskers? It wasn't until reading on a FB Cast Iron Cooking page (with over 100,000 members), many of whom are cowboys, and ranch hands, etc and they were talking about the best lotion to help with chapped skin that I decided to get some.Oh, my goodness! I could not believe how instantly it made my hands, arms and legs as soft as a baby's butt! And get this, it seemed to STAY that way! I don't get that part, but for me, it seems true. You know how you apply lotion and it's only as good as the time it's on there, but as soon as you wash or shower, you need to apply again and in the winter months, you are winning a losing battle!?Well, my hands have actually STAYED soft and smooth.Anyway, I recommend. And, if you wash your hands a lot because of your job (doctor, nurse, teacher, etc) or simply because you do (!), then you'll love that this is non-greasy or slippery, but also that it seems to penetrate and really actually eliminate the dryness and chapped skin.

My first impression is that I don't like it. I felt like I was brushing with lemon furniture polish. I much prefer the minty flavors. If I change my mind, I'll let you know.Darn. I love lemon-flavored things - just not this.

Horrid. I don't understand the great reviews. For me, this has been the Emperor's New Clothes filter. They are like having nothing at all. After two months, they looked exactly the same as when they went in, with nothing on them.I contacted their customer service department and was greatly disappointed and dissatisfied with the response. They didn't answer my QUESTION or CONCERN at all - but merely stated that I could not get a refund. I didn't mention anything about a refund; or even a return! I asked about the product, and WHY it didn't show anything whatsoever on the filter after six weeks?Would NEVER recommend. A horrid waste of money and now I have all these filters..Anybody want to buy some filters? Real cheap..

Yum, Yum!Bought it first to try and just now subscribed!It's delicious! I take it to work and easy enough to eat right out of the can, while sitting in my car listening to the radio and catching some beautiful breezes.The juice is awesome - fresh tasting. No oil, very little salt..not even water. Just the juice itself.Fresh and delicious - haven't even made the 'regular' tuna salad with it yet. Haven't felt the need to.

I had the Aquasana glass bottle and left it in the freezer by accident, and of course, it shattered. I thought that bottle was pretty decent and wasn't unhappy with it at all, but once I got the Bromvital bottle, I realized what I had been missing.I know this may sound crazy, but the water tastes better in THIS glass bottle than it did in my other glass bottle! So that makes me wonder - isn't glass...glass? Why would one taste better than the other? The only thing I can think of is that my old bottle had a plastic top and this one is stainless - giving it a cleaner, less toxic taste. Who would've ever thought?!As all the others have said, it is a CLEAR glass bottle; and I appreciate that it is very lightweight.The company definitely wants to provide good service, but they might need to be mindful of customer's preferences. I will NEVER appreciate receiving a PHONE CALL even if it is a follow-up customer service call. EMAIL, email, email. I think most people regard phone calls these days as a violation of privacy and an unwelcome intrusion.That said, it IS a great bottle; a good company and I appreciate the lifetime replacement. And yes, I will be ordering another soon.Just don't call me.

Did we all read the same book!? Very disappointed..I found myself wondering MORE about the diet than what was written in this book, and even though it was only $2.99, I felt I had thrown that money away on this one. "Oh well - win some, lose some" - that's how I view this book.Also, a complete TURN OFF to me is when I see grammatical errors, typos, and misspelled words. I don't care if I paid $20 or $2 for a book - it better be written correctly, and clearly this book didn't get a final edit before going live.The only guide I will ever need? NOT.

The edition that I had, the 2011 Deluxe, would no longer work with my financial institution, so I just "let it go". There's no way I wanted to give in to the extortion of being forced to upgrade every two years and especially at such high prices. Personally, I think it's greedy and irresponsible that companies market the way they do.Anyway, I missed being able to do my normal, and basic reporting. I'm a "numbers" person, and I do like detailed financial accounting.When I saw this Starter Edition, which was priced at $22 (and not the $42 it is showing here today!!), I liked what I saw. Personally, I never used or cared for the Deluxe features anyway and just preferred the basic.When I read the reviews and read the website, it assured me that it would load my previous information, however, when I downloaded, it immediately told me that it would not because my version was the Deluxe. I opted for downloading anyway as a "new file".Then, it insisted on a password. I entered my email address, as prompted, and it said that email address already has an account, perhaps from any other Intuit product (such as Turbo Tax). It would not take what I presumed my password was and then locked me out. Long story short is, I was so angry and so frustrated, and the Chat Talk was not working, so I just paused and prayed for awhile. Lo and behold, I keep a document with some odd websites, products and services passwords, and looked there to see if there was one and there was. Even though it insisted on my email addy being my ID, I entered the info I had on this sheet, and it took it! So, I was very happy.The only thing I don't like about it is the way the account categories are set up. I also am not a graph or pie chart person. I prefer to see it written out. So, I will play with it and see if I can't create and change things to the way I want them.But, for right now, I'm happy to be back in the saddle again and downloading my bank info.Before you uninstall your old version, be sure to backup or copy files if you don't want to lose the info and in case it will not convert. And you may have to create a "new file" in order to proceed, but just press on and don't give up. You may be able to find a work-around to get you going.

Anybody that knows me knows that I have bad lamp karma; bad stapler karma and bad clock karma - LOL.Goodness! How hard is it to find a clock like this?! Well, for me anyway - much harder than I thought! So, I FINALLY have one that works for starters; and that is big enough and that I like the numerals. You'd be surprised sometimes how ugly the numbering can be!And I wanted just basic, old fashioned, school-house looking style, with a second hand and I didn't even care what color, although I would've liked red.So far, so good. I just wish I could secure it better to the wall. Other than that, it's a dream.

I have the Lexi Marigold sandals in the Red and absolutely love them, so when I went back online (I had actually ordered that pair from QVC) to order them in Black, I was devastated that they were not available, not even on their Wait List.I could not find them in Black anywhere - not on Amazon; not on Clarks, Zappos - anywhere.So..I looked for another pair of black sandals that I might like instead and decided on these - the Lexi Sumac. The first pair I received was in the 7.5, which is what I normally wear, but they were tight around the foot and I could feel the straps, and they bothered my little toe and the bunion on my left foot. So, I sent them back and ordered the 8, since ordering in a wider width was not an option; and hoping they wouldn't be too big.The size 8 feels great and these are incredibly comfortable. I don't even feel anything on my feet at all - just simply feel clouds of comfort. I can stand for long periods of time; walk for long distances and be completely comfortable. I love how stealthly quiet they are, too! Makes me feel like I'm gliding across the carpet at work.I still would have preferred to have the Lexi Marigold because I think it's a more elegant design for greater variation of day-to-night wear while the Sumac style seems more casual with it's brass buckles, but I do like it very much and am glad I have them.As far as I'm concerned, Clarks is 'on a roll' with me and winning hands down!

Sometimes the best movies or books are ones handed to you to read that you have no idea what it's about or anything about it and it ends up being something so worthy, and so surprisingly good.Such was the case here when this book was mentioned in a FB post, and I found myself so absorbed in the book and unable to put it down.I hate to confess that so often, I don't read a book from cover to cover anymore, but skim around and through the book, but NOT this one! This was a real page turner!Sadly, I was finishing up this book when yet another shooting tragedy occurred (will it ever end??) and the man in that story can easily be compared to the character in Carolyn Wyatt's book.As another reviewer said - there are so many other families and homes going through the same thing and we ALL, unfortunately probably know someone just like that - someone we all would see capable of committing heinous crimes.I lived next door to one. He terrorized the neighborhood and was the reason most sold their homes and moved.The 'soul particle' and various other theories as to 'what went wrong' with this child is interesting to contemplate and is a topic that needed to be written about. What is the problem? What, then, is the solution?I especially appreciate what Carolyn Wyatt wrote at the end of her book which reflected my own thoughts exactly and I look forward to reading more of her work.Thanks, Carolyn for writing this. I think it's very timely.

First, let me say that I've always been a Travelon-Girl and have never owned a Baggelini until now.I carried the same exact Travelon purse for 8 years - even had it stitched up a few times at the shoe repair store because I loved the bag and Travelon stopped making it.This year, when I finally had to ditch my favorite purse, I've enjoyed buying several purses that I do like, but they still never have compared to my favorite, dearly departed discontinued Travelon.A couple weeks ago, I went out to lunch with my sister and absolutely loved her new purse. I had to try it out - zip and unzip and visualize my belongings in it. My heart was racing and I got really excited to see that many of those favored features were designed into her purse, the Criss Cross Baggalini and I wondered hmmm..She had ordered hers in the Mushroom color (I really liked it) and lo and behold, she surprised me and ordered one for me in black!I couldn't wait to try and put all my belongings into it to see if it would work! I don't really carry much, but what I do carry has to be arranged just "so". One thing I love about Travelon bags is their whole premise is that you can do everything with one hand, and without looking. I refuse to be one of these ladies who are digging and searching through their purses - or better yet, have to take things out to find them!
